Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...I spent many days tending this garden... or nights? Quite difficult to tell the time here. But, it's held on longer than I would have expected...

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...Persephone... I...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Cerberus! I missed you so. And dutiful as ever, aren't you.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...I'm sorry. Know that I am sorry.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Hades... you look tired. Though, I am not the only one you ought to be apologizing to.

Speaker: Hades
Text: I know. I know, I.... Why have you returned? If Olympus... if your mother discovers what happened, not even Zeus, not even *he *could stop what would transpire, here!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Oh*, I've a thought or two about how we can settle that. Though I shall need for you and Zagreus to cooperate with me on a solution. Or, if you'd rather, I could just return the way I came?

Speaker: Hades
Text: A solution? What, do you intend to have them over for Ambrosia? Not even you can fix a broken family, Persephone.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You're right, Hades! I can't. Certainly not by myself. So, are you going to help me, or what?

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...I would do anything that you would ask of me.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Then, first, talk to your son.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...*Mm*. Zagreus? You have already met Persephone, our Queen. I expect for you to show deference to her, at all times!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wow, Father, you called me by my name! What is this strange sensation that I feel? Perhaps it's this *deference *of which you speak?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, stop it, both of you. Don't make me regret this, Hades. Speak honestly with him. About yourself, not me. Go on.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Yes. I... Zagreus. I know there have been times... when I've let my mood reflect on you. I showed very little patience. Questioned your judgment, often, when my own was flawed. Thus, I apologize to you, my son. I have no excuses. And I ask no forgiveness.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What about the part where you lied to me about Mother, do you apologize for that? Your foul moods, and venting them on me... I've long since come to expect that from you. And I resented you for it. But I always thought... you're honest.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Your mother did not come here willingly when we originally met. When she left... believing you were stillborn... her decision was final. I believed that she was better off without the lot of us, Olympus included. Deceiving both of you... it tore against my being. But it needed to be done.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, you didn't need to vent all that inner turmoil onto me throughout my life. Though, I think I understand. I only wish I could have understood sooner. So, uh... what now? I've grown so used to ransacking your domain, I think I'm really going to miss it.

Speaker: Hades
Text: About that... your *ransacking *revealed many flaws in our security. The types that never get into reports. Our reputation rides on there being no escape from here. Would you... keep trying to break free? Not for my sake. But for this realm. For the Queen.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Zagreus... If you keep fighting out of here... it shall help keep appearances that everything is as it always was.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Question, Father. Let's say I accept. When next I reach the surface... is it still going to be you waiting up there?

Speaker: Hades
Text: Ah, boy. If you think for an instant that I shall go easier on you because of this, you'll soon learn otherwise.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So I just battle to the surface and repeatedly kill my own father, then?

Speaker: Hades
Text: You have it half-correct!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Perhaps you'll also tend to my little cottage while you're in the area? The garden doesn't take much care at all. I'd like to keep the place in decent shape. In case I cannot suffer this for long.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Hahaha*, well! I guess I'll see what I can do.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Just do the best you can. And, clearly, I've work to do as well. We have a lot of it ahead of us, I'd say. So, shall we get started, then?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *After all this time*, it's only been a few days! But it's been good. Mother and Father are back together, made some new friends, got this fancy painting! Easy. All is well in the Underworld!

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The House of Hades: That dark and lavishly appointed lair of the Underworld's King is home not just to him, but to his willful progeny.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *What once was a small lounging area within the House of Hades now is sealed off, in utter shambles since the multi-headed Cerberus tore the space apart, mourning the missing Prince.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Shades of the dead mill constantly within the House, complaining of their woes, and seeking audience from any who would listen.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The lounging area within the House of Hades is a dismal place to be, in spite of its intended purpose to enliven the House's grim inhabitants.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A commemorative board adorns one of the stoic walls within the lounging area, celebrating and proclaiming the accomplishments of those who serve Lord Hades best of all.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The ancient casks of wine hidden within the recesses of the House of Lord Hades... few have tasted the intoxicating vintage they contain, and fewer still are permitted anywhere near their vicinity.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The stalwart casks of wine within the House of Hades now are almost entirely devoid of content, having bravely stood against the combined thirst of the Olympians during a certain feast.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A majestic gilded edifice of Mount Olympus, crafted with the utmost care from the true mountain's stone, now shines forever brightly even in the dim light of the House of Hades, as a parting gift from the Lord Master's kin.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A vast and intricately crafted mosaic depicts the Underworld King presiding over the enormity of his domain, whilst its chthonic residents look on in awe of him.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Seldom does the overbearing throne of grim Lord Hades sit unoccupied; thus the House's denizens all go about their business, daring not so much as to ask why.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The garden of Persephone the Queen, off-limits to the Prince throughout his life, now is laid bare to him at last in all its splendor.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *He ventures toward the stately throne of his Lord Father, half-expecting to be caught, but ill-expecting what he is about to find.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *He does not know exactly what he seeks. He only knows that something always has felt off to him, that he does not belong. Who is he, really? Lord Hades never would indulge such questions. So, Prince Zagreus would find out for himself.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *He rifles through his Lord Father's possessions. There is not much of any import there. Ledgers and administrative parchmentwork. Correspondence from Olympus which he had ignored. No trace of any reference to his son.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *But then, there is the note... written finely in a hand and voice the likes of which the Prince had never seen or heard.*

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *'Hades: I can no longer tolerate my life here in this place. So, I am leaving, even if it kills me. I won't be returning to Olympus. If there is a place where I belong in this world, it must be somewhere between heaven and hell. Perhaps it's on the coast and has a little garden. Take care of Cerberus; I shall miss him.'*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Thus did Prince of the Underworld Zagreus absorb the contents of this hidden letter, written in his mother's hand.*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: His mother's hand, my mother's hand, wait, *what*?! You're saying this Persephone, that she's my... mother...? But, but Father always said that Nyx was my.... That liar. He lied to me, they both did. All my life!

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Uhhh erm thus did the Prince discover, inadvertently, the well-kept truth about his lineage. Entirely by chance, this did occur....*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Persephone... the one-time Queen of all the Underworld... where had she gone, and why? Engulfed by newfound questions and his rage, the Prince decided to confront his Lord and Master.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Responsibility-rejecting Zagreus strides down his Father's hall, quite unconcerned about the urgency with which he is expected to behave under a set of circumstances such as this.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The door to the administrative chamber beckons just beyond the hall. The prince perchance believes that he may enter quietly, without drawing the notice of those laboring within.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Among the countless splendid gemstones hidden underneath the earth, a great many are used to decorate the House of Hades, god of the dead, god of riches.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Water is the source of life, yet still it flows within the darkest Underworld recesses, whilst restless shades of mortals look upon it and recall the short days they could drink it and draw breath.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The gemstone-bearing Prince commissioned such a finely crafted fountain for the House, that all the shades who witnessed it still think of him quite fondly, ever since.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The dead have utterly no use for sustenance, although they try to feast upon it anyway, as though imagining the customs of the mortal life brings them some sense of peace.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Having invested heavily into the cooking-area within the House of Hades, the empty-stomached Zagreus can nonetheless find nothing fit to eat.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Within the House's gallery now sits the bust of a distinguished poet, ruggedly handsome in his age, who, although yet to earn his fated fame, shall probably be better known someday.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The frightful countenance of a bleached Bloodless warrior decorates the hall forever more, eternally in tribute to the savage servants of the House's lord.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The perfect-chiseled physicality of one of Greece's greatest-ever heroes now adorns the House's gallery, reminding most onlookers of many ways in which they fail to compare.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The light provided by the flames of deepest hell enhances the lounging area with a soft glow; and their warmth soothes the few living denizens there.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Time seems to stand quite still within the eternal realm of the dead, evidenced even by the means of measuring its passage.*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg. *Oh*. I was not expecting company. Were you, just, casually snooping, or... is there something I can help you with?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I was just leaving, Zagreus. Happened to be in the area, no thanks to you, and thought I'd go retrieve the last of my possessions. I have to say, you've really let this place go to hell.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...She left. Great. Wonderful! I guess we'll just go back to killing each other repeatedly, then.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Forget another something in my bedchambers, there, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sorry. My mother's out there, somewhere. I won't rest until I can find her. You wouldn't understand.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What are you saying?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm saying... I know you need to find your mother, Zagreus. I have my part to play in all of this, but let me see what I can do, if anything.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg...! She... *ah*.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Forget another something in my bedchambers, there, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No. We need to talk, again. My sisters are involved now, in all this. You've really stirred up quite a mess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I know. I'm sorry. But this is something that I have to do. You wouldn't understand.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You wouldn't know. What I'm trying to say is... with my sisters involved, it changes things. Takes some of the pressure off of me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Some of the pressure... wait, what are you going to do?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm saying... I know you're doing what you have to do, here, Zagreus. And, my sisters and I will always try to stop you. But I am only doing it because I have to. Understand?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg...! She... *ah*.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg... what a surprise. Again. What is it? ...What's the matter? Wait. Why are you looking at me like that?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus, would you shut up already with your idiotic questions, and get over here? Right now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I... you really... oh...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus, you don't have any doors. Why are you always so surprised?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Meg, Than, what... what are you two... what's going on? Whatever it is, I can explain, or... wait, you're both smiling. Oh... let me just... take this in a moment here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You give Thanatos and me too little credit, Zag. We've known each other longer than you've been alive.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'd say we know quite a bit by now, all things considered. Isn't that right, Megaera?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Can't you see we're off duty right now, Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg... what a surprise. Again. What is it? ...What's the matter? Wait. Why are you looking at me like that?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Shut up already, Zagreus. And come here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I... you really... oh...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos...! I'd ask you to come in, but... you're already here. It's really good to see you.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Just tell me one thing, Zagreus. Did you really mean what you told me before, that... maybe we ought to... take our time?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus, you don't have any doors. Why are you always so surprised?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Meg, Than, what... what are you two... what's going on? Whatever it is, I can explain, or... wait, you're both smiling. Oh... let me just... take this in a moment here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You give Thanatos and me too little credit, Zag. We've known each other longer than you've been alive.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'd say we know quite a bit by now, all things considered. Isn't that right, Megaera?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Can't you see we're off duty right now, Zagreus?

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *It is the dead of night, or the approximation of it in the realm of Hades. Prince of the Underworld Zagreus rises from a fitful slumber, with much mischief on his mind.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The heavy-sleeping Underworld Prince arises, with the feeling that the brief nap he intended as a respite from the rigors of the day or night apparently was none-too-brief, at all...*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The bedchambers of Prince Zagreus lie in a perpetual state of utter disarray, despite his Lord and master of the House repeatedly insisting that he pick everything up.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The shattered weapons of the siege of Ilion are now reduced to window-dressings in the Prince's ever-cluttered lair.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The valor of the great-hearted Achilles is immortalized upon the Prince's wall, as though it might stir up more courage from within.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The visage of the goddess Aphrodite now adorns the Prince's bedchambers, perhaps to provide consolation after when next he dies.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The ever-smiling, wine-washed countenance of the great Lord Dionysus now adorns the Prince's chamber-wall, thus radiating questionable influence.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A beautifully decorated, subtly enchanted bowl containing traces of the hapless Prince's past attempts to flee the Underworld now accents a particularly cluttered corner of his room.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A delicately crafted instrument of music-making now resides within the clamor-causing Prince's chambers, doubtless fearing, if it could, his heavy-handed touch.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *An object intricately carven solely for the purposes of recreation now resides within the pleasure-seeking Prince's chambers, although his lack for an opponent limits its appeal.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Much of the softness of the richly woven rug the Prince procured cannot be fully felt beneath his flame-licked feet.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *With its just-right softness and death-themed embroidery, the new bedding of Prince Zagreus is the envy of all those who wish to rest in peace.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The ever-energetic Prince alas remains incapable of sitting still, even with such a supple, comfortable seating arrangement nestled in his chambers now.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A massive set of weights positioned carefully in line of sight of any visitors shall doubtless make them think the Prince is stronger and in better shape than in reality.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The fate-abetting Prince perhaps believes it was through his own choice that he procured the Fated List of Minor Prophecies, but it was preordained.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *All is quiet at this time; ever-dreaming Hypnos put a spell upon the House, as willful Zagreus had asked of him. All are fast asleep, save for the Prince. It is exactly as he planned.*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's been a while, Resources Director. I'll be sure to pay you a visit whenever I'm swimming in Underworld valuables and want to feel better about myself in my new role.

Description: Inspect Death Area Bedroom Hades Portrait 01
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *In his Lord Father's very private chambers, Zagreus, the lock-removing prince, discovers a most delicately painted likeness of none other than Persephone, herself. A coat of dust suggests it has remained here for some time.*

Description: Inspect Death Area Bedroom Hades Capes 01
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The stoic Lord and Master of the House possesses wealth beyond imagining, a portion of which he has used for a crisp set of attire for every passing day.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Within the recesses of the administrative chamber lies the Eldest Sigil of the Master's House: a symbol of the Fate-given authority to rule beneath the earth, and means by which to travel the entirety of all that dark domain.*

Description: Inspect Death Area Office Water Cooler 01
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The cool, purified waters of the Styx are available in limitless supply to all servants of the god of the dead authorized to work endlessly within the House administrative chamber.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The administrative chamber's ever-working shades remain utterly dedicated to their thankless toil all because of an inspiring rendition of how dedicated they ideally should be.*

Description: Inspect Death Area Office Sealed Contract 01
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Amongst the parchment-records of the dead and punished are the sealed documents known as the Knave-King's Sentence, forcing said king to endlessly toil with a boulder till the end of time.*

Description: Inspect Death Area Office Sealed Contract 02
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Nestled among the towering administrative parchmentwork of the long-since-deceased lies an old document concerning a special pact signed by a once-living court musician, who attempted vainly to rescue his wife from death.*

Description: Inspect Death Area Office Sealed Contract 03
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Buried deep within the archives, holding many binding pacts between Lord Hades and the dead, resides an old agreement; an exchange for services from an extraordinary warrior, for eternity within Elysium for his dear partner.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The day or night's duties are sheer simplicity itself; at least at first, as when the prince simply signs in to signal the commencement of his shift.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The often-failing prince attempts to sort the ledgers in the fashion necessary for the proper keeping of his father's realm.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The training-lacking prince's efforts to administer approvals to the judgment terms ultimately leave a lot to be desired.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The hard-laboring shades responsible for the administration of the prince's father's realm merely look on at the prince's ill-fated attempts.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The relaxation-loving prince never paid suitably enough attention to learn properly how to arrange the record-bookings of the regions of his father's realm.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *This set of delicate responsibilities is easily achieved, at least by someone capable and trained to do the work, unlike the oft-distracted Underworld Prince.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A careful record must be kept of all expenses paid within the House; a delicately-handled tabulation process which the prince is ill-equipped to fully undertake.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A steadily-updated ledger of the House's income in the form of brilliant gemstones, diamonds, Darkness, and the like, is merely one among the prince's least-liked aspects of his work.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Records of expired House Contractor renovations line a desk in the administrative chamber, though the prince has absolutely no desire now to organize them alphabetically, by date.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Attendance records of the working-shades who toil for the House need to be verified; the shades' due compensation, rapidly approved; and yet the prince cannot remember all the necessary steps.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Disorderly Prince Zagreus gazes upon the endless stacks of parchment-paper, each containing work-details to be registered and neatly organized, and starts to feel his optimism fade.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Prince Zagreus must have some favored tasks in the administrative chamber of the House; but surely none of them include the tasks demanding his attention, here.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Reviewing lists of claims from shades with grievances is a very important service of the House, or so Lord Hades once attempted to impress upon his willful son.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *A litany of complaints submitted by restless shades across the Underworld must be evaluated, organized, and processed, but Prince Zagreus does not even know where to begin.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Supplies on all the desks in the administrative chamber must be carefully maintained and neatly placed in a specific way, which the forgetful prince has not yet memorized in full.*

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *Security reports concerning failed escape attempts from Tartarus require timely verification and official response, neither of which Prince Zagreus is fit to give.*

Description: Flashback Day Night Job Office Conclusion 01
Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *At last, the work-disliking prince records a summary of the results of his attempts to be of any use to the administrative needs of his grim father's House.*

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I'll level with you, pal. You have impressed somebody well above my pay grade here, and so... they have a little proposition for you, you listening?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Let me guess... they want me to fight all the way through the Underworld, having used the Pact of Punishment over there to make the going even more treacherous than it already is, and if I succeed, they'll reward me with some sort of useless trinket?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Wrong! We're talking something really big, here, pal, you see that thing back there? Trinket. Come on, what are you, scared?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I just knew you had it in you, pal, enjoying your new prize? Pact of Punishment, *Shmact *of Punishment, no problem, know what I mean? 'Course, that was just the easy one you got there, pretty sure I could've got that one, myself.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, just so I understand. I literally toiled through hell and back, and my reward is just... a statue of you? Don't get me wrong, it's lovely, it's just... I don't know what I expected.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Look, boyo, there was a little mix-up when we put in the request for that thing, see? I told 'em to make something that'll make me look good with my sources, and anyway that's how it all turned out. The other ones turned out much better, though, you'll see!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, let me ask you something. Did you really commission three nearly-identical statues of yourself to goad me into using the Pact of Punishment?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I am offended, pal! You haven't even seen the third one yet, so how can you insinuate a thing like that?! Maybe I was wrong about you. I thought you really were the one!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're only saying that to get me to apologize and try and unlock the last of your three identical statues, aren't you.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *How could you*--? I would return those statues for a full refund right here and now, if I could move! And if there was a refund policy on them.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Look I'm sorry I messed up your statues, boyo. Really. When I saw them, I just kind of freaked. But then I figured there's no way he's going to see how they turned out, so, I just rolled with it, you know?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You shouldn't have underestimated me, mate. But... I shouldn't have said such awful things about your statues. You must have really gone out of your way to get them here.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh you better believe it, pal! So how about we call it even. We've been through a lot. Both of us! Really learned from this experience, and now, we share a deeper understanding, yeah?

Speaker: Storyteller
Text: *The courtyard of the House of Hades is kept neat and orderly, in contrast to the terrifying sprawl that lies beyond.*

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...You help him out again, you'll get a thousand lashes next we meet. And when I return, this little rock of yours had better be up there rather than here, or else you'll get a thousand more.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Sounds good, sounds good, Madam, that's more than equitable really, I'll hold you to that! Be seeing you around!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...And you'll keep busy with your boulder if you know what's good for you, you little cheat. Don't go thinking I'm not watching you.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I appreciate your vigilance, Madam, and surely I'll be getting Bouldy up this very hill in no time flat, despite the fact that I have never once achieved this!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...And when this matter with the Prince is over with, we will be getting back to how things used to be. Until such time, I'd better regularly see your boulder on that hill.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Entirely makes sense to me, Madam, and rest assured that Bouldy, *erm*, that is to say this boulder here, that I will push it regularly, moving forward, same as ever! Now good-bye!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...And, lastly, you're forbidden from offering further assistance to Prince Zagreus. Do we understand each other?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Why, absolutely, Master Thanatos, I wouldn't think of it! My mind is fully occupied with all the latest boulder-pushing strategies, besides.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Enough! Get back to work, and I'll get back to mine.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I understand you, Master Thanatos, and will be doing as you say. No more assistance for Prince Zagreus, dead serious this time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good. It shall be both our skins if you are caught in one of your deceptions. See to it that this doesn't happen.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...You would be wise to heed my words next time, and fear the consequences of eluding me. Death can be most unpleasant, as I'm sure you know.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, that's just it, Master Thanatos. I never was terribly fearful of you gods, if you'll forgive my saying so. Far as I can tell, all of you seem to have your struggles much like mortals do. A fear of death aside.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What would you know of the struggles of gods? Now you have eternity to think on what you've done. Maybe I'll check again with you after another aeon or two, see if you've learned anything more.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nice place you got here, boyo! Name's Skelly, how's it going, but enough with the small talk already, I'm here to do a job. So let me have it! Give me everything you got!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't remember having you on payroll, mate. Who's your supervisor?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Oh-hoh*, I'm not about to rat my sources, pal! Just try and beat it out of me!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't suppose I can talk you into fighting back this time?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Not a chance, boyo, I'm paid to take it not to dish it out! Now give it to me!!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hey, you're getting pretty strong, there, pal! Though, I am being paid to tell you that! But not being paid to not tell you that last part...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to ask you something, mate. What do you even need the pay for, anyway?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: That, pal, is nobody's business but my own! Besides, it's impolite discussing money all the time! Now back to beating me to powder!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Let me give you a piece of advice, boyo. You run across a guy like me out there, you just give him a good stab right in the back without a second thought before he sends you crying back to Papa.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You getting pretty strong, I'll give you that, boyo. Strong enough to smack a guy like me right up against the wall and I'd go straight to pieces, *boom*! You just remember, when you're duking it out, the walls are your friend!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Smack guys against walls. Sound advice as ever, mate.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hey pal watch where you throw those bloodstone things of yours, you drop them, you go pick them up, you understand? But if somebody gives you grief, you got my permission to chuck one right in his eye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll just aim generally for the midsection since the eyes are a lot harder to hit in my experience.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You're pretty quick, you know, boyo! Just be sure to use that fancy dash of yours and keep 'em guessing! Don't let 'em catch you standing still!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dash like mad instead of standing still. That's not the worst advice, I guess.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Little tip, boyo? You find any coinage while you're out there, you be sure to pawn it off to that old Charon, boatman guy? Use it or lose it, pal, use it or lose it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanks, mate, note to self: Always spend everything I earn instead of ever saving.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Once in a while, pal, you're going to see a real fancy bozo try to ruin your good time. You'll know him 'cause he's glowing like a light, but that's his special armor, see? You got to punch right through it, he's going to shrug you off until you do!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: For a good time, beware the fancy glowing bozos on my quest. Check.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You know something, boyo, I think you could do a real number on one of these columns holding up this place, and bring the whole thing down in just a few swipes, boom, boom, *BOOM*! I'd hate to be standing near one of them if you did!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wreck my father's finely crafted architecture every chance I get. That I can do for sure.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Boyo, next time you make it to the big VIP area upstairs, you watch out for those weapon-wielding gents out there! The eyeball soul thing that pops out when you beat 'em? You got to squash those, too, or else they'll grab their gear and come right back!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Crush the souls of Elysium's Exalted shades to stop them from regenerating over and over. I'll definitely do that next time I'm there.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: If you're having a rough time out there, boyo, you just remember something: You're a *god*, all right?! Way tougher than you think. They give you trouble, you just turn on *God Mode*, and you let 'em have it for me!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You act as though this *God Mode *is some sort of lever I can simply switch at will if ever I wish to unlock my latent strength, there, mate.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, how do you know all this stuff, by the way? I mean no offense, but you're a skeleton who just stands around. Yet you have this wealth of knowledge of the Underworld?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hey, I know people, pal! We'll just have to leave it at that. Now let's see you break some of these bones, huh?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Well, pal? You have come a pretty long way, let me tell *you*. I think most of the smarts I've picked up, you know by now. And so... if I'm fresh out of tips for you... I guess there's only one thing left to do.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Stand there eternally to be whaled upon at my whim, using whichever weapon suits me at the time?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, mate? I picked up a painting for our lounge that looked a little like yourself. Reminds me... have you ever even been inside? Should come join us sometime.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Ah, you know, while I appreciate that, there, boyo... those kind of social spaces, they're not really for me. I kind of like it out here, just me, these bats whizzing around from time to time.... Besides! The old contract makes it pretty clear I got to stay right here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What if I picked you up bodily and brought you in? Contract have anything to say about that?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Got to say, you're really getting somewhere, boyo, I'm pretty impressed here! And they don't even pay me to do that, I'm just supposed to stand around!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Appreciate the vote of confidence, mate. Maybe you're right and someday I'll get out of here. Hey, if I never come back, you won't just be stuck here forever, will you?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Heh, hehehe*, that's a good one! *No*! Probably not. Wasn't anything in the old contract about that... *huh*.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hitting a wall out there, boyo? Hey I know the feeling. You just keep at it, though! You're getting tougher, getting smarter... between the two of those, I'm thinking you'll pull through soon enough here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, mate, won't you say who hired you? Was it Achilles? Couldn't have been Nyx...? Is it that big a deal?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I am an individual of some integrity, boyo, and protect my sources with my life! You'll have to kill me if you want to make me squeal!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, *uh*, Skelly? How'd you get here, anyway?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh, you know, just kind of zapped right in, like Papa lets us do! Some of us sometimes. Why do you ask?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I meant... how did you get to the realm of the dead, in the first place. Lord Hermes whisk you to the entryway? Thanatos scoop you up, Charon give you a lift, what?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh, *haha*! Well, that's a little personal, don't you think, boyo? I... I don't like to talk about it much. So, if I could have a little privacy...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, is it really true you don't want to talk about how you got here? Just curious who you used to be. What you were like. Your real name.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hey, what makes you think this isn't my real name, pal? I'm offended!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sorry, what I meant was... I was just interested to get to know you better, after all you've done to help. Anything you can share? Trade you for a detail about me!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: ...Well all right... I was once a commander of men. Name of Schelemeus. Captain of the Cretan second fleet, sailing on Athens under King Minos. We were unstoppable... but then one day... one wrong turn... and we sailed straight into the waters of Charybdis.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, that's... that's incredible! So then... you and your crew, you perished at sea?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I, uh, *pfff, hahaha*, boyo, you are something else, you know? All that Schelemeus stuff, I could have had you eating out of my hand for days!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, I get it. You got me. Fine, then, *Schelemeus*, but I don't appreciate the trick.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly... I'm serious. You really won't tell me anything about you? You're just going to leave me to speculate, forever?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Skelly... or should I say *Schelemeus*? I happened to have a chat with somebody familiar with that name. Large bull-headed fellow originally from Crete. You said you made it all up! What's going on?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Never said I made it up, pal! I just knew you weren't going to believe me, I mean, look at me! I look like a captain of the Cretan second fleet to you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't know. I've never met one. Do they all just stand around doing nothing?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Well, sounds like *somebody*'s never had to lead like fifty-or-something sailors in a voyage across the sea in a Minoan galley with nothing but the stars to guide 'em! What do you think the captains do, pull the oars?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, what about Hermes? He gave me the impression you might have been somebody else. Nobody in particular. Not some great sea-captain.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: What is it with you gods talking behind the backs of all your friends, boyo?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't change the subject!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Don't change the subject!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That Lucky Tooth you gave me, Skelly. First off, thanks again, and secondly... is this even yours? Had a run-in with Hermes, who got me thinking.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: What, *haha*, you going to believe everything that gabby guy tells you, now, boyo? He doesn't know a thing about me!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Never said he did. Though since you let on... what's your relationship to him? Working for him?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No! Nope. Definitely not working for him, closer to a peer relationship. Well, other than the fact that he's a god and I'm just... well, what you see is what you get with me, pal. Hey, you won't tell anyone, will you? I'm just here to help, I swear!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: All right, fess up, Skelly, who are you working for? I know it's not Achilles. It's not Nyx. Dusa has no idea who you are. My father... no way. Hypnos? Give me a break. So the House is ruled out.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Sorry, pal, my lips are sealed. How about we change the subject?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How about you tell me who your sources are?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nope!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Tell me.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No way.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Tell me!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I said no!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Tell me, Skelly.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nuh-uh.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, tell me, please?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No. Means. No.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why won't you tell me?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nice try, pal.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What if I never hit you again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So help me, Skelly, if you don't tell me who you're working for, there will be no more violence between us, ever.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No... please, have mercy, boyo...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No mercy, Skelly. Tell me. Or else... it will be only pleasantries between us from here on out.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nrrrghh, *all right*! But you got to promise me something, promise not to let on or tell anybody in your fancy House, all right? Or else I'm done for. *I'm serious*!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I promise. So...?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: ...It's Charon.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon! Huh.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Yeah. He's rich. He's got connections to guys like me, and I think he's got a horse in this chariot race you've got going on around here with Papa.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What's his angle?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No idea. Maybe he likes you, maybe he's bored.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And Hermes... he's working for Charon, too?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Yep! Now, let's pretend like none of this ever happened, so I can stick around, all right? Remember, pal, you promised!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, did you tell Charon and Hermes about our little conversation from before, about your sources? Because, I didn't tell them, but... they seemed to know.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Boyo, thought we agreed we weren't going to be having conversations on the subject from here on. Spares me having to spill my guts with my sources later.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I didn't get you into too much trouble, did I?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Skelly, what with everything out in the open now, with the Queen and Charon, and all that... mind if I mention some of this to Thanatos? Charon's his brother, after all.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh! Yeah, now that you mention it, I guess that part of the old contract no longer applies. So, go right ahead! Appreciate you asking, pal.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Pal, thanks again for that Nectar bottle from before, stuff just goes right through me like you won't believe! Though, I hope you're not going around giving that stuff away to every bozo you know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, Skelly, you worried something bad is going to happen if I express a bit of generosity from time to time through our somewhat-illicit gift-giving custom around here?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: No, I'm worried you'll be wasting your time! If you give that stuff away, don't expect to get anything back. Well, not after the first time, anyway. Usually! I'm just saying... don't get your hopes up.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Maybe I just want to show thanks to my friends for its own sake!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Skelly? You look like you know your way around Tartarus. Found some of this ancient Titan blood out there, and I was looking to score some more.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Ah, you've come to the right place regarding that, there, pal! It's your mean weapons back there that can find the stuff. Once you get all the way through Tartarus with one, that's all the blood you're going to get! For the time being anyhow.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How am I supposed to keep track of which weapons I've earned these with, then?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I don't know, there's always the invention of writing stuff down? You'll figure something out.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, you mentioned the ancient bit of blood I found in Tartarus. Know what I'm supposed to do with this stuff?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Wouldn't know a thing about it! Definitely doesn't have anything to do with those Infernal Arms of yours, some of which appear to still be *unavailable to you*, as I understand?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: So the strangest thing happened while you were out, boyo! One of your weapon holder things back there, it picked up this eerie glow! Could see it from the corner of my eye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Calm down, Skelly. I'm sure whatever it is is perfectly normal for a legendary semi-sentient Titan-slaying weapon from the dawn of time.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: That's just it! Those weapons of yours, they have seen some real business, pal. You're giving them a real workout, so maybe they're starting to like you or something? Loosening up a bit, you know? Like you and me!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You know, pal, when you're not around and it's just me and all your weapons, I mean your *Infernal Arms *right over there, between us they are making me a bit uncomfortable.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Can't blame you, mate. I wouldn't want to be stuck in a chamber with a bunch of legendary, quite possibly malevolent killing artifacts. Anything I can do?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh I didn't mean it like a bad thing, boyo! The weirder you make those things, the more it gives me the shakes, and keeps me hopping like this nice and steady till the next time you get back! So, thanks!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Skelly? Don't suppose you'd care to tell me how the infamous Twin Fists of Malphon came to be right here in this very courtyard, would you?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Nope! Not any of my business, pal, which is to say, I didn't see a thing! And even if I did, it isn't what I'm paid to do! Don't you have someone in your fancy House there paid to keep watch over stuff like that? Ask them!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Hey, just want to say, pal, that spooky *crimson phoenix *stuff that you were going on about before? I mean, whoa, you just say some nonsense and you get a brand-new spear? I was so impressed, I decided to try that trick for myself!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, gods... Skelly, what did you do...?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Relax, boyo, just had a little chat with your old serving platter over there after you left, is all. That thing hits pretty hard! So, then, I say to it, *I see you through the eyes of the crimson phoenix*... and you want to know what happened after that?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So you carelessly spoke secret words imparted by the Fates themselves to an infernal weapon forged at the dawn of creation, then what? Say, did you walk up to Aegis, or just shout over your shoulder?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Over my shoulder! Anyway, what happened next was *nothing*! Your *Aegis *kept on bobbing like a dummy. So then I went and said that mumbo jumbo to every other weapon, but nope! Doesn't work at all. So much for your fancy sorcery, huh?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So, what exactly happened with the formerly pink window over there? Now it's got these sinister orange flames and an enormous Pact of Punishment hanging ominously over the exit. Father stop by?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Pal, I don't know a thing about it, honest! I was just minding my own business, when all the sudden, *wham*! I get hit right in the back. I fall to pieces, no idea what's going on! When I finally come to, the window job was done...!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Listen, boyo: I don't know exactly how to put this, so I'm just going to come right out. I need your help with something, and, I'll be honest, I don't think you're going to like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If it doesn't involve hacking away at you with reckless abandon, Skelly, I don't want to hear it. But... oh. You're being serious.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I am. And funny you should put it like that. Boyo, I am asking you to get me out of here. *Permanently*, if you catch my drift. This standing around stuff... just kind of wears on you, after a while, you know?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I know. I can only imagine. Tell me what I can do.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: That blade of yours back there. It's got a special power. You got to spruce it all the way up. Your Aspect, not somebody's else's. Then let me have it with that thing... and I'm out of here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Then you'd be dead, forever? You're asking me to kill you.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: I know it's a lot to dump on you, but I got my reasons. I don't exactly have a lot of options, here, so... give it some thought. Till then, we'll act like nothing's changed, all right?

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Skelly
Text: Listen, boyo: I don't know exactly how to put this, so I'm just going to come right out. I need your help with something, and, I'll be honest, I don't think you're going to like it.

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If it doesn't involve hacking away at you with reckless abandon, Skelly, I don't want to hear it. But... oh. You're being serious.

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Skelly
Text: I am. And funny you should put it like that. Boyo, I am asking you to get me out of here. *Permanently*, if you catch my drift. This standing around stuff... just kind of wears on you, after a while, you know?

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I know. I can only imagine. Tell me what I can do.

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Skelly
Text: That blade of yours back there. It's got a special power. Your Aspect, now that it's maxed out. You got to let me have it with that thing... and then I'm out of here.

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Then you'd be dead... forever? You're asking me to kill you.

Description: Skelly True Death Quest Beginning 01 B
Speaker: Skelly
Text: I know it's a lot to dump on you, but I got my reasons. I don't exactly have a lot of options, here, so... give it some thought. Till then, we'll act like nothing's changed, all right?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: So, *uh*, pal? My sources tell me that you made it pretty far. Which means... my usefulness is coming to an end.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Your *usefulness*, what, you just mean the standing around, letting me lay into you with whatever vicious attack sequence I fancy at the time?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Yeah! Once you achieve your goal... my contract's up. You won't need me anymore.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But only if I leave for good, isn't that right? So if I stuck around... you'd stay here, too?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Probably, but... wait, you're really going to stay?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: So Mama's back in town from what I hear, boyo! It's awful nice knowing I trained you well.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, you must mean the Queen, and evidently you're aware of our relationship. You keep that quiet, understand, Skelly?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Ahh*, and thus the pupil trains the master, for a change! I hear you, pal. Your secret's safe with me.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You must have had yourself a real bash, with all those fancy gods and stuff! Could hear all the festivity from all the way out here. How was it, pal?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It... went better than expected, all in all. I hope you didn't feel left out! It was a pretty limited guest list. Kind of a diplomatic mission, I would say. Not quite as good a time as it might have sounded from the outside.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Ohh*, don't you even worry about me, there, pal! I much prefer the solitary life, and besides! When things are good for you, they're good for me. Glad everything worked out.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Less yakking, more smacking, boyo, now come on!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Less chatter, more batter, boyo, hit me already!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Less talking, more socking, here, pal!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Come on, boyo, less gabbing, more stabbing over here!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Less prattle, more battle, boyo, give me all you got!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Can't break *these *bones, pal, what you just try it!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You want another a piece of this, or what?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Enough with the small talk, boyo, hit me, go on!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Trying to bore me to death with all this chit-chat, pal?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: This look like a shoulder to cry on to you, boyo?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Let me have it already, boyo, no holding back!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Let's see what you can do in terms of hitting me, pal!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You could be hitting me right now, boyo!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Sure could go for somebody just whaling away on me right now.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: What's the matter, you gone soft or something, pal?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You going to hit me over here, or what?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Go on, boyo, give me your best shot, it's my job!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Sure could use a good smack in the jaw from you right about now!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You want to fight me, boyo, well hop to it, stat!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: What do I look like, pal, some kind of conversationalist?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Our relationship, boyo, requires no exchange of words!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: For you, mate! Thought you might get a kick out of this.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: For me, pal? Awful nice of you, just awful nice, but guess what, I got this for you! Tit for tat, you understand, a deal's a deal!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Whoa-hoh*, you being serious here, pal? You brought that all this way, for little old me?! That's real nice of you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're not so bad yourself, mate. Thanks for always being here for me to savagely attack without a second thought.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Whoaaaa*, now get a load of what you got there, boyo! Wait, really, that's for me? Or you just pulling my leg?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm really giving this to you, mate. Now go enjoy it, will you? Once I've finished pummeling you some more just for the sake of it.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Heeey now *that's *what I'm talking about, thanks, boyo! Won't forget you doing me a solid like this, cross my heart!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No need to thank me, mate. But don't you dare forget it or I'll attack you repeatedly and without mercy.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Oh look here, pal, I can't just keep accepting these from you! Not when they're paying me already, I got standards to uphold, you know?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I will look the other way if you do, mate. Now, here! Or else!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Haaah*, you're kidding, *what*? Sometimes, boyo, you make me feel alive again, you know that? Being honest with you here, I'm grateful, really.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If not for you, my friend, I'd have no one to viciously attack with no fear of reprisal whatsoever.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Skelly, while I know your services have already been paid in full, your sources ought to know you've been doing an excellent job. So much so, I wanted to give you this.

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Whaaa*, is that a vintage bottle of Ambrosia, pal?! I never even thought I'd get to try a thing like that, I mean, what am I, here? Know what, I want you to have this. To symbolize our friendship, and in case you ever need a hand out there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hope you enjoyed that vintage bottle of Ambrosia last time, Skelly, because I got you another. Here!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Aww*, no way, boyo, you kidding me right now? Why are you even, I... look, I, I just stand around and let you beat me up, you don't have to do this. You don't even know who I am. Who I was.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're my friend, mate. That's all that matters. Although... I don't suppose you're willing to divulge those types of details? Just out of curiosity.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, Skelly, I still cannot entirely get over that whole permanently-kill-you stunt you pulled on me. You had me deeply worried for a while, all for just a laugh?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Yeah, that's right! Not exactly much to do here, case you hadn't noticed recently! Good thing I'm able to stay occupied with intellectual pursuits.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's what you call it, then? In any case, I did want to make sure: You sure that you're all right, having to stand around like this?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: You kidding, pal? This is the life! Imagine getting paid to stand around! And being pals with you!

Speaker: Skelly
Text: *Hahaha*, got you pretty good, again, didn't I, boyo?! *I am asking you to get me out of here. *Hahahaha! All that stuff about your blade, and your Aspect, I mean, you ate all of it right up! *Woo, hoo-hoo!*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It appears I've been the victim of an elaborate prank. Not sure that I appreciate it, Skelly. What if I were to never hit you again, how would you like that?

Speaker: Skelly
Text: Whoa, *whoa whoa whoa whoa*, whoa! Now come on, boyo, it was just a joke, I figured things could lighten up a little here. Don't need to do anything rash!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: My sisters and I. We've had a chance to talk, and we have come to an agreement, Zagreus. As you can see.

Speaker: Alecto
Text: Megaera, Tis, you ready?

Speaker: Tisiphone
Text: *Mmurdererr*!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Three against one. Doesn't seem all that sporting, now, does it?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We're each well past the need for any sport. We'll kill you, whatever it takes. Erinyes! *Now*.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What's the matter, Zagreus? You look a bit uncomfortable. Something you want to say to me? Or any one of us?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's just... there's something that I wanted to discuss with you, at some point, Meg, but after more consideration, I am thinking maybe now is not the time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I understand entirely. Though you should know my sisters and I keep no secrets from each other, anymore. Isn't that right, Sisters?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Eugh*, I almost want to thank you, Zagreus. I thought you'd never change that blasted Pact, and leave me here, in peace.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, you mean you aren't lonelier without Alecto's or Tisiphone's companionship? They seem so wonderful to have around.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: They're tolerable each to some extent. About as much as I can say for you. Now let's the two of us begin.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: See, Alecto? He is right on time, just as I said.

Speaker: Alecto
Text: Megaera, *bleed *him!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Heads up, Tisiphone. I think I found a murderer for you.

Speaker: Tisiphone
Text: *Mmuuurrr*derrrr...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I have to level with you, Zagreus. For all we've been through... never once have I wanted you to meet my sisters.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I can't imagine why not! We had a lovely time getting to know each other. We laughed, we cried! My only regret was that you couldn't be there, yourself.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You don't know what you're saying. There's a reason that they're not permitted in the House. Though, come on. One of us is going back there, now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You've really done it, Zagreus. My sisters have returned. All three of us now share the same assignment.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Is it wrong of me that I am somewhat honored to have garnered the attention of the Erinyes?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh I would say it's very wrong of you, indeed.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I sense something different about you, Zagreus. Your old weakness. *Ah*... the Mirror. I thought you said you weren't trying to compete with me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I wasn't. But then you gave me a good idea to try. I'm not as weak as I once was. With or without the Mirror's help.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Is that so? Well then let's see if you're correct. Come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I heard that you escaped. Then, what are you still doing here? Forget something along the way?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know... I think I'd rather fight you to the death again than try to answer either of those questions, right now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I don't know what you're up to, Zagreus. But I guess it doesn't matter, either way. All that matters is you're not getting past me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your mother has returned to us, already, Zagreus. And still you're going to keep battling your way out, past me and everything up there? Why?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Father says there's no escape from here, and I like to repeatedly show him he's wrong. Besides, I think getting out there a bit from time to time does me some good.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Sounds like you've found yourself a steady line of work. Most jobs just need doing. If this one gives you some fulfillment, stick to it. Now, come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What is it that you're up to now, Zagreus? The Queen is back. But still you're making me show up like this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Got some unfinished business with the Olympians to take care of, was in the area, figured I'd say hi. Hi, Meg!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't start with me. You show up here, we fight, somebody dies. That's it. Now, who's it going to be?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Been seeing an awful lot of each other lately, haven't we. You had enough of me, yet, Zag?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Never enough, Meg. You ready for another go at it, too, I take it?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Always. Although I do like to keep things fresh, so... surprise me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Listen to me, Zagreus. Your mother is long gone. You're never getting out of here, and even if you did, what hope could you possibly have in finding her up in the world out there?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I've hope enough. Not that it's any of your business anymore.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your family is here. And so is your responsibility. You're running from yourself. Though, I can slow you down a bit I think.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *What*... where did you get the Rail? Do you know what you have? Where are your customary weapons?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I left them at home. And, I sort of know what I have, inasmuch as it's largely responsible for getting me this far. Would you like to see a demonstration?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Yes, I would. I always have, as a matter of fact.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What's that you're holding, Zagreus? Please tell me that you didn't steal the most dangerous, unstable artifacts sealed shut within your father's vault.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, it wasn't I who stole them, if that's any reassurance to you, Meg!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You are a hopeless fool. You cannot possibly know what you're doing with those things. You put them back exactly where you found them.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Nyx really let Dusa go?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She did... so you heard. I don't know what happened. You didn't even get a chance to say goodbye?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No. Damn it. If you had anything to do with this...! Even if you didn't, come on and die!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What have you done with the Pact, Zagreus? This isn't even Asphodel, and I can barely tolerate the heat. Do you really want to die this terribly?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Appreciate all the concern, but I just thought I'd live a little, Meg. You ought to try it for yourself, sometime!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You ought to try watching your mouth. You want a swift and painful death, you'll have one momentarily.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know exactly why I'm here. Now shut your mouth, and come die like a man.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Halt, Zagreus. Not one step further.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Meg. Haven't we had more than enough of each other by now? Besides, don't you have someplace else to be?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your father sent me. All in all, I'd rather be on your bad side than his. Now you can turn back like a good little man, or I can send you home the painful way. What'll it be?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I'll have to go with the painful way.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: A man after my own heart.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Tell me something, Zag, because I'm curious. Do your Olympian relatives know the real reason you've been trying to escape?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll get around to that in due time. They're family. They'll understand no doubt.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're in over your head, you idiot. You'll fray what bonds are left between Lord Hades and those ingrates on Olympus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Things can't entirely be different between you and me. You know that, don't you, Zag? Not when it comes to this, at least.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I do. We wouldn't both be consummate professionals if it were any other way. You won't be going easy on me, will you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm going to pretend you didn't ask me that. Now give me everything you've got!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What is it, Zagreus? You've got that pleased-with-yourself look, which can only mean you have something obnoxious to tell me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *I never*! Look, I'm simply pleased to see you, Meg. Hence the insuppressible smile. Could have been one of your lovely sisters here instead...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're not going to throw me off my guard that easily. My sisters wouldn't let me hear the end of it.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: And where, exactly, do you think you're going, Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think I'm going all the way to the top again, Meg. To find my mother. You won't stop me. Get out of my way.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We both know that's not going to happen. Getting out of your way, I mean.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your mother, Zagreus. You really think you'll find her once again, out there? Even if you make it out... maybe she's found another hiding place.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It isn't us she's hiding from up there. Father let her go. He never wanted to go after her. So I appreciate your concern, but I'll find her again.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: That sounds like information neither one of them would want for me to know. You know the punishment for spilling secrets, don't you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What are you doing, Zagreus? The Underworld is sealed off. What you're attempting is impossible. You've seen what happens when you go too far.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This place can't stay sealed shut forever, Meg. In the meantime, I thought I'd get some practice in, you know?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm not your practice partner, fool.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: May I help you with something, Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Now that you mention it, you can, Meg. I was wondering what was Father carrying on with you about back home?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Eavesdropping again? If you must know, my job performance is under review. Though, I'm sure this job's about to go just fine.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I sincerely hope that you enjoy these meetings with me while you can. I know I will.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Now that's a rather ominous thing to say to someone, Meg. Care to explain in terms an idiot like me could understand?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Lord Hades is exploring other options. He has no confidence in my ability to stop you anymore. Though, maybe it isn't too late for me to change his mind.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It's been a while, Zagreus. You must have made it pretty far last time. Let's see. Outer reaches of Asphodel?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Outer reaches of Asphodel. And I have to say, Meg, you are positively a sight compared with that blasted Bone Hydra stewing away up there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How very flattering, to have compared me to the remains of some mindless outsized lizard. Come, maybe I'll kill you just as easily as your new Hydra friend.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How many times have we been going at it like this, Zagreus? You tired of me, yet?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: We're both immortals, Meg. We'll be seeing plenty of each other for a while yet. I've come to welcome these occasions.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Then, good. Lashing you across the face beats waiting for the opportunity to do so. Come.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I heard what happened. You crossed the River of Flame. You really did it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That Hydra was a total bastard, though. Bastard*s*. But, you sound practically impressed with me, there, Meg! I feel so flattered!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You'll soon feel something else. I don't know how you did it. But it changes nothing.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How utterly disgusting... I was just counting, Zagreus, and as it happens, I have lost to you fifty times, already! If not more. Can you believe this? *Ugh*, how I've fallen.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, don't take it so hard, Meg! Once you die several dozen times, you start to get accustomed to the emotional pain, as well as the physical! Up for some more of either?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Of course! Who do you think I am? Although I guess there's no use keeping score with you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know how many times you've beaten me, here, Zagreus? Can you even guess?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*... feels like a lot, admittedly, I mean, we've been going at this for a while, now. Four hundred and twelve times...?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Five hundred times, exactly. Though I figure, you haven't been keeping track of how many times I've killed you. *Ugh*, maybe that's my problem. Well, plenty of time to work it out after this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You beat Alecto, Zag. Could hear her screaming her head off about it all the way through Tartarus... I almost want to thank you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I almost want to say you're very welcome. Have you and she always been on bad terms like this?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We have long-standing differences. It's worse with family. You know what it's like.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Huh*. Not even Tisiphone could stop you. Your father must be sorely disappointed.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He's difficult to please, that much is true. What happened to Tisiphone, anyway? She isn't much for conversation.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It runs in the family. Tis only knows her work. And, professional distance is important.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If there's anyone in all the Underworld who owes you, Zagreus, it's your friend, Sisyphus. He would be much worse off if not for you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, because I've been distracting you from administering lashings like before? I hate to think you prefer to whip with no fear of reprisal whatsoever, Meg.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Dereliction of duty and fear of reprisal are not one and the same. Though you don't seem to be concerned with either one.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your weapon's looking rather dull, there, Zagreus. Great Daedalus decided not to grace you with his gifts this time around?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Now that you mention it, he hasn't, no. Though I'm prepared to say I don't need special augmentations to get past you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh, we can put that to the test right now. Just remember, you need all the help you can get.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: That Mirror's made you stronger, Zagreus. You're fortunate to have Nyx helping you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No hard feelings. I think she feels partly responsible for all of this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: She shouldn't. The only one responsible for all of this is you. And I thought even you would have understood that by now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*. I can't believe it. You signed the Pact of Punishment. Have you completely lost your mind? Or just trying to insult me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well if you're going to be so rude about it, maybe a little of each? Though, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm not an idiot. I see what you're doing. You want to be punished? Then, come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*. You really volunteered into a Pact of Punishment? You can't back out of it, now. You're even more of a fool than I already thought.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Maybe I just like a challenge, ever thought of that? Besides, what do you even care which pacts I sign or don't?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're right. I *don't *care. You want to be punished? Then, come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I have been longing for a fairer fight with you. Maybe that's why you signed the Pact? To pity me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If it's punishment you want, how am I to say no?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know I can hit even harder than usual with the Pact of Punishment working against you. Maybe that's why you signed it? To pity me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have my reasons. Pitying you isn't one of them. Although I guess you don't believe me, do you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No, I don't think I do. Come on, then, and let's see where all your pity gets you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: This should be over pretty quickly, I think, Zag. Never took you for the Forced Overtime type. That's not a Pact condition for the faint of heart.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You wound me, Meg! You know I like to barge into situations thoughtlessly and recklessly, and sort everything out later. Forced Overtime's the perfect fit!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Ahh*, well, when you put it that way. Look, don't go saying I didn't warn you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Hold it, Zagreus. I sense something, is that... *ah*. You've been in contact with Chaos. So even they are now involved with this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Just because Chaos is giving me the power to crush you doesn't mean they're getting involved with this, does it?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You don't know who or what you're dealing with. Ask Nyx about them for me sometime. Here, I'll give you a chance to ask her very soon.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I know that Thanatos assisted you in getting to this point. I don't appreciate his interference.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sure you'll have a chance to tell him back at home.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: He has domain over the wretched shades, but his power has no sway with me. And neither does your own.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I still cannot believe that Thanatos is helping you. I mistook him for someone with integrity.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You mistook him for someone who blindly follows orders without considering the implications.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How dare you...! If you like death so much, then here, let me indulge you. Thanatos will welcome you with open arms.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Prince Zagreus, you are trespassing beyond the limits of your authority. I am under orders to stop you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Meg, why so formal all of a sudden? We've been through this countless times. Wait, is it because...?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh, come on, Zag. Will you just learn to play along, for once? Come on and fight me like you mean it.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What is it, Zagreus? You look a little hesitant to go another round with me. Or is it my imagination?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's just... can we really keep the personal and the professional completely separate like this, Meg? It's with mixed emotions that I fight you to the death, only to be happy to see you back at the House.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Then learn to keep your emotions in check. You keep them bottled up a while, they'll be that much stronger when it's time to let them out.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Nice gloves, there, Zagreus. Think you can take me up close with those things? Well within striking distance of my whip.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Not wearing them for fashion's sake, here, Meg. You won't mind if I give you my best shot with Malphon here, will you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'd mind if you didn't. Want to get your hands dirty, fine. Let's see it.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What happened to your weapon, Zagreus? I sensed its power long before you turned up. That isn't just some Daedalus enchantment on it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, Stygius and I have been getting much more closely acquainted lately, Meg. Would you care to see the fruits of our healthy symbiotic relationship?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You, in a healthy relationship? Why yes, then this I have to see.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Nice earring, Zagreus. Maybe I should have thought twice before giving you a thing like that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why, because the gift you generously gave me may end up being instrumental in your own demise? Sounds straight out of one of those tales the mortals like to go spreading around.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: They like it when best-laid plans fall completely to pieces, don't they? You better grow to like it, too.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I sense something of death upon you, Zagreus. What's that you have, something from Thanatos is it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, this old thing? It's just a listless butterfly Than gave me, which happens to fill me with even more supernatural strength than usual. Don't pay it any mind.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Not even Thanatos can help you here. But if I ever start a bug collection, I'll know who to call.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know Battie's not going to work here, don't you? I'm definitely not going to help you out of this one.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Meg, you can do anything if you set your mind to it! Though, don't worry, Battie's just here for the show.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Then, let's make it a good one. Come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your little bat companion not too much to handle, is she, Zagreus? I trust you're taking excellent care of her. Not that she needs your help.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh she's been positively perfect, thank you, Meg. Especially in how she puts us into contact when I need a hand. I hope it's not too much hassle, helping out from time to time?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If you were hoping to avoid a hassle, you've definitely come to the wrong place.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Look at yourself, Zagreus, you are a total mess. Halfway to death or worse. You're making this too easy.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hit a few snags on my way to meet you, Meg. So, if you wouldn't mind going easy on me this one?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Not on your life or death. But I will kill you quickly, how's that?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're wounded, Zagreus. How unbecoming of a god. Not to mention that I have the upper hand.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I figured I'd give you a head start this time, so I let the wretched shades bludgeon me repeatedly along the way.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Fool. If you're half-dead already by the time you get to me, what hope can you possibly have for what lies ahead?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You look like you had trouble getting to me, Zagreus. Did you try asking for directions on the way?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You sound like Hypnos. He's getting to you, isn't he. Isn't he!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You shut your mouth right now, with that. Come die.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're not escaping death this time, here, Zagreus. You ready to go home?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, not just yet, though thanks for asking, Meg. If you intend to force me, know that I am going to resist, with all my might.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well I appreciate the warning. Now prepare to die.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Ever stubborn, aren't you. Maybe my whip might make you reconsider whatever it is that you're attempting here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Your whip's not been all that persuasive in the past.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Maybe persistence will pay off for both of us. Come, then.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: And there you are again. Lord Hades ought to lock you up rather than let you run amok in his domain like this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sure he'd welcome all this feedback from you, Meg. Or maybe you're just pining for my father's job?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I have no envy for your father's position. Besides, I happen to enjoy my own responsibilities.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh, there you are. Just as I was beginning to think it's been too long since last I killed you, Zag.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Admit it, Meg. You can't stop thinking about me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't flatter yourself. I think of you in pain. And now there's no more need for the imagination.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, Zag? Any last requests this time before I send you home?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Let's see, how about a swift and painful death, would that be possible?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Be cheeky all you like. You'll get exactly what you asked, and nothing more.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Pff*. And here you are again. You're slow to learn the way of things I see.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I may be slow to learn, but... least I'm rather patient!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: This talk about your patience is beginning to test mine. Enough! Come on and die.

Speaker: Megaera
