Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, Nyx, please, it's... quite all right. You may not have given birth to me, but you still cared for me. I never doubt that. Likewise, are you sure it's all right that I continue to address you by name?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, you must know something about why Father broke off ties with the Olympians, don't you?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: That is a question only your father can answer, child. I cannot tell you more than you already know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to ask you something, Nyx. What is this debt you owe my father, anyway? Forgive my eavesdropping, it's just, I heard the two of you discussing things, and... it came up.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...I was here long before your father. The responsibility to govern fell to me. Yet, I could not manage on my own. I shape the darkness; ensure the integrity of the domain. I am less prone to census-taking and administering rules. I receded from such responsibilities.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It was too much, even for you. So... when father arrived... you welcomed him? He helped?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I was quite skeptical of him, at first. I thought his presence merely a cruel trick of Fate. But... he worked diligently, from the start. Soon there was order where once there was none. I fashioned this House for him, and I maintain it still. We remain in partnership. In interdependency.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He has never taken advantage of you? Of your generosity?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: No, child. He has not. He can be short with me, as you have seen. But that is the extent of it. We have found ways to reconcile disagreements. Though, your relationship with him... it is more complicated than my own, I fear...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, all you've done to help me, with the Olympians, the Mirror, the House Contractor, I... I worry that if Father were to know, that he would turn his wrath upon you. I don't want anything to happen.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You need not fear for me, my child. For I am not some underling your father has authority to punish if it pleases him. I am the Night; and it is by my grace that this House stands. Your father knows this. Thus, he and I have certain common goals. We are obligated to cooperate.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Then... if there's really nothing he can do, why go along with his deception? About my birthmother, I mean?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Please... that is something I am not at liberty to say. When you meet your birthmother eventually... you shall understand.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, all you've done to help me, with the Olympians, the Mirror, the House Contractor, I... I worry that if Father were to know, that he would turn his wrath upon you. I don't want anything to happen.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You need not fear for me, my child. For I am not some underling your father has authority to punish if it pleases him. I am the Night; and it is by my grace that this House stands. Your father knows this. Thus, he and I have certain common goals. We are obligated to cooperate.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Obligated to cooperate... no wonder I thought you two truly were husband and wife.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father and I... sometimes convince ourselves.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I heard lately from the goddess Athena, Nyx. She seems to admire you. I thought Olympians didn't like our kind?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: They typically do not. But, you are family, child. And I, why... I believed Athena wise enough to understand why someone such as I would seek her, in particular. She has, in turn, made others in her family aware.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Athena sends you her kindest regards, Nyx. Sounds like you have maintained some correspondence since all this began?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: We have, thank you, my child. Goddess Athena is reputed to be wise, and so she was the one I felt was the most likely to listen to reason, understand my view, and ultimately have a willingness to help. It is most fortunate that I was not mistaken about her.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But... you told her you're my mother. If she's supposedly so wise... isn't that quite a risk? If she finds out you've been misleading her...

Speaker: Nyx
Text: She *is *wise, child. It is precisely for that reason I expected she would understand.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Nyx, at first I thought I maybe should ignore this, but I wanted to give you greetings from Lord Ares, who seems rather interested in you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Ah*, yes, the god of war. Among all the Olympians, he often struck me as much more accepting of our kind, born of the Underworld.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're not... wait, you're not interested in him, I mean, he's... murderous... polite, though, I don't know.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I take an interest in whomever I take interest in, my child. I thank you for the message.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Nyx, *erm*, Lord Ares wanted you to know, and I believe I quote, that *'I am often thinking of her here'*. Take that for what it's worth?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall, thank you, my child. If the god of war is thus preoccupied with me, well then, perhaps he shall be slower to send droves of mortals to our doorstep here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Help me, Nyx. Or rather, help yourself. Lord Ares seeks for me to put the two of you in contact. I mean... I don't know why I'm getting so defensive, here, now that I think on it.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not concern yourself with my ability to navigate my interpersonal relationships, my child. It pleases me Lord Ares told you this. Those of Olympus rarely say such things, to any of us here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, did you really start a *correspondence *with Lord Ares, as he put it to me recently? Is everything all right with you and him?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: His interest in the Underworld is genuine, and he does not regard me as beneath him, even if the technicality exists. The Olympians and the chthonic gods... we have much left to learn of one another's kind.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What of Father? He's forbidden any contact whatsoever!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have repeatedly received such contact, all despite your father's wishes, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're going to meet Ares, sometime, Nyx? Or maybe you already have?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: What is your concern, exactly, child? Speak plain with me, or else take not my time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, I... it's just, Ares, he's... I don't know, he just doesn't seem your type! And isn't he a little young for you?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You do not understand the basis of our friendship, child. Lord Ares may not meet the moral standard of the mortals who hate him, or Olympians who shun him, but to me? He is cordial and eager to learn. I am quite capable of forming my own views on him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Nyx, I... Ares sends you his regards again. Wanted to let you know.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Thank you, my child. We may seldom have occasion to encounter one another, he and I, but it is good to have another friend upon Olympus. Even if goddess Athena and he are not on the best of terms.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: The Olympians can't really see me, can they, Nyx? I mean, not very well. I get that they can sense details here and there, but... they don't know the full extent of what's going on. Are we really so far beyond their influence?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are enshrouded from them, child. For your own benefit, and theirs. They know as much as necessary to assist. And I trust they shall, for as long as you require. They are bound to one another as family. And they know that you require aid. Do not be too prideful to accept.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I was pleased to see an order pending approval for the release of Orpheus with the House Contractor, Nyx. If Father wants him to start singing again, locking him in Tartarus doesn't seem like the most efficient way to go about it. Besides, I think he's suffered enough.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father found a certain peace from song, my child. Perhaps with this reprieve, our Orpheus shall reconsider and resume his craft.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're worried Father doesn't have enough live music to enjoy while brooding over his gloomy court?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father's temperament is easier to navigate when he is in relatively better spirits. And my opinion is that punishing the court musician does not further your father's goal with him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Do you enjoy Orpheus' singing, Nyx? He seems a bit concerned that you might not.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am amenable to the consonance of his harmonies, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't suppose the name *Skelly *happens to mean anything to you, does it, Nyx?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It means nothing to me at all, my child. Though, why do you invoke such names within this House? Who is this Skelly, and what do you presume is the connection that exists between us?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*, I... well, essentially, he is an animated skeleton who shows up just outside my bedchambers, and lets me practice with my weapons on him. I sort of figured that *you *put him up to it. So it wasn't you?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Achilles moves throughout these chambers under my own shroud, if you must know. And thus you have in your possession the Infernal Arms. But, I have not exerted further influence than that. Is this skeleton to be trusted, then?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I finally made it to the surface, Nyx! Confronted Father, there, out in the cold. I couldn't make it past him, but... I was so close!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not despair, as I told you before. With effort and with time, most any setback can be overcome. Even your father. You have come closer to your goal. Achieve it!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father is not here, and you are back. Then, it can only mean one thing. Are you all right, my child?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yes, I think so, Nyx. Returning here by Father's hand does put a special sting into it, though. So, any invaluable tips on how to vanquish him? Some hidden weaknesses only you know about, something like that?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You know his weaknesses better than anyone. Better even than he. It pains me to know that the conflict between you could not be settled in some other way. But if this is how it has to be... destroy him for me, next you fight up there. However long it takes. Would you do that?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have been served a Pact of Punishment, now, child. I thought to talk your father out of it, at first, but... it may serve to let you grow your power, even more.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Something about setbacks building character, I guess? I didn't take you for someone to look on the bright side of things, Nyx.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is a point of fact. If you can overcome the conditions of the Pact, your influence throughout this realm shall surely grow. Though, do not overextend, of course.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I thank you for the lovely flowers, child. They make my corner of the House hospitable. Such simple comforts never were for me, and yet... now that I am surrounded by them, I have found that I enjoy their presence, more than I would have admitted in the past.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm glad you like them, Nyx. Though if you don't, just give the word, and I will have them removed. Probably incinerated for good measure! Now that you mention it, though, how come you are always in this corner in particular?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: This point is closest to the center of the House. To its foundation. And, therefore, to the center of the entire realm.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't you ever get lonely down here, Nyx...? For companionship, I mean, because... I mean, just look at you, you're very beautiful, the night herself! There's nothing you can't do. When I was younger, I thought you and father, you know, but... is there not someone else?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: How very forward of you, child. I accept your compliment. Although, I am the Night, as you observe. The night conceals all. I know nothing of the loneliness which you describe. This entire realm... it is a part of me. And many of its subjects sprang from me, alone.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You appear to have grown stronger since when last we interacted, child. Your bedroom mirror may appear to be the cause... but then of course the real cause is you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I sense the growing darkness in you, child. I am so very proud of you. You always have been capable, yet now, you seem to radiate with newfound power.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The unfathomable power of the Underworld thrives within you, child. Your godliness has grown since last we spoke; you have learned much of harnessing the dark.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Even among those born longest ago within the deepest reaches of the Underworld... I have seldom encountered anyone so united with the Darkness of this domain as you are, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: United with the Darkness? I've just... been picking it up here and there. Although, for quite a while, since you mention it! I'm not sure that I feel any different, though.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Surely that is not so. Think back on when you started all of this. You now know so much more. Are capable of so much more.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have revealed every facet of the Mirror of Night, child. The full extent of its power. I was aware this was possible, yet... you achieved it sooner than expected.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't know where I'd be without it. Probably still in Tartarus trying to get past Meg. I only wish I could get even stronger.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Mirror has little to do with your power, let alone your capability. You may deactivate its effects and see for yourself. It merely gave you greater opportunity to learn. And you shall continue to do so.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... I have to ask you something. Are you certain that my search isn't in vain? My mother, what if... what if she's gone?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your mother yet lives. There can be no other explanation. For, if she did not, she would be with us, here.... She was a good woman. Stately, kind. I wished to raise you as I thought she would have.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, sometimes I get the impression the Olympians look down on those of us born of the Underworld. Is that my imagination, or, what do you make of it?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The gods of Mount Olympus tend to think themselves above us, child. Or so your father often likes to say. He alone was relegated to this realm, and grew resentful of his relatives on high.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have met most of your Olympian relatives by now, child. Although the power of their blessings is fleeting here, they shall continue to support you. As long as necessary.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: They all still think I'm headed to join them on Olympus. That's why they're helping me.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: They are helping you because you are family. Family with whom they do not yet have a complicated past.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... the Olympians have been immensely helpful, but... did they really have to get mixed up in all this? I could have gone off on my own.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: And you would not have gone far, child. Your father is too proud to accept assistance in personal matters. Do not cede the advantage that you have.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But I'm misleading them. Taking advantage of their good graces trying to find Mother. What if they find out?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall do everything within my power to prevent this, as shall you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, can you... tell me more about my birthmother? Anything at all. What was she like, when you first met? What did you think of her?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your birthmother left a strong impression on us, child. It was apparent she was from a far-off place, and yet... she brought with her a lightness I had not experienced before. My first impression soon subsided, and I grew to care for her. You possess many of her finer qualities.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Finer qualities? Such as abandoning her family members? Why did she leave? Why won't you tell me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Please... you must not ask such things of me. I swore a binding oath never to say. I have already circumvented it as much as can be done. Go find her, child. Then, you shall understand.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, if I can ever make my way from here, out to the surface... how do you know that I can find her? The instructions you gave me... how can you know for sure that's where she is, that she hasn't left, or...?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: When your birthmother departed, I bent the light for her, shrouding her path, though I myself could see it. I trust she remains there, and that I am not betraying her confidence by telling you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father fell to you, as once his father fell to him. Although, you were substantially more merciful. I know it is a bitter victory, at best. Though, tell me... what transpired subsequently, that you have returned? Did you locate your birthmother?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I did, I... she was there. She was... where you said she'd be. And, more than I imagined, but... I had so little time with her. I can't survive up there, for very long. Why didn't you tell me I'd just die, no matter what?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Oh, my child... I say this seldomly, but... I did not know. Or... I did not wish to believe... that the surface would have such an effect on you. But it seems you share your father's fate, after all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: My father's fate? But he is smugly waiting for me every single time I make it there, and seems quite healthy by then, all in all! Though... maybe the farther we get from this realm... the worse we get. Because he cast his lot... inheriting the Underworld?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: So I now presume. You are bound to this realm by powers greater even than mine. Tell me something... if you knew that you could only see Persephone for but a moment's time... would you still make the journey to her, there?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Yes. Yes, I would. I had so many questions left for her!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Then, go and ask them, child. Steady your resolve, and find her there, again. And use well what brief time you have with one another, whilst you can. As mortals do.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father fell to you, as once his father fell to him. Although, you were substantially more merciful. I know it is a bitter victory, at best. Though, tell me... what transpired subsequently, that you have returned? Did you locate your birthmother?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I did, I... she was there. She was... where you said she'd be. And, more than I imagined, but... I had so little time with her. I can't survive up there, for very long. Why didn't you tell me I'd just die, no matter what?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Oh, my child... I say this seldomly, but... I did not know. Or... I did not wish to believe... that the surface would have such an effect on you. But it seems you share your father's fate, after all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: My father's fate? But he was smugly waiting for me up there, and seemed quite healthy, all in all! Though... maybe the farther we get from this realm... the worse we get. Because he cast his lot... inheriting the Underworld?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: So I now presume. You are bound to this realm by powers greater even than mine. Tell me something... if you knew that you could only see Persephone for but a moment's time... would you still make the journey to her, there?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Yes. Yes, I would. I had so many questions left for her!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Then, go and ask them, child. Steady your resolve, and find her there, again. And use well what brief time you have with one another, whilst you can. As mortals do.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... why did you never send word to Mother that I lived? You knew at least approximately where she went. You and Father... you could have spared her so much pain!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I swore a binding oath never to say, child. I have already circumvented it as much as can be done. Know that we... that *I *acted with only her wellbeing in mind. As well as yours.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... you saved my life. Gave me life. When I was born. Father told me. I don't know what to say. Why didn't you tell me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: There are many things that I am not at liberty to speak of, child. Through my own binding choice. These circumstances are among them. Suffice it to say that your revival... required the extent of my ability. And considerable time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I never should have been born... is that what the Fates wanted? Did you defy your own daughters?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Silence. Tempt not my daughters thus.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: How is she, child? Queen Persephone, I mean. Has she been well up there, in her abode? What is it like?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She's doing well, I think. It's nice to visit her. Her residence is beautiful. A little home nestled amid the cold. All of these plants, in bloom! It's difficult even to describe. And very bright, as well.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: That sounds quite pleasant for someone who values brightness, I suppose. Well, then... I trust your visits are worthwhile for the both of you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, my mother was quite concerned to learn Olympus has been aiding me. Did you... haven't you... put her in danger by involving them? Was there no other way?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: No. There was not. She has been in danger, all along. I concealed her, yes. Even from me. But, it is not enough. I do not think that you could have found her without the Olympians. And, if I did not reveal your existence to them... if they discovered who you are... it would be worse.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ugh*, what a mess. How are we going to fix this?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Olympians maintain belief that you are trying to reach them. I trust we can sustain this understanding for a long, long time. Perhaps not forever, but... long enough to discover a solution. Perhaps with your birthmother's help.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Child, quickly now, before you go. I know how all of this must look. Know that I was true to her. Persephone. And, that I think fondly on the time she spent with us.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Of course, Nyx, though... why did she really leave the Underworld, do you think? Besides because of me. So what if she thought I died at birth?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: She did not feel that she belonged. It was a very difficult adjustment she was forced to make. And... she feared that she would inevitably end up caught between Olympus and this realm. That she might start a war.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: A war... wars have been fought for less, I understand. And, Father must have been a real burden, too.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You do not know. Ask her yourself, about her time with him. But... I have already said too much. And I cannot say more.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: What is the matter, child? I sense your distress, not the specific cause.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother doesn't want to see me again. I mean... she asked me not to return. Thinks the risk is too great.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Oh*. That is a fair-enough assessment. What shall you do?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I'm going back.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Father loved her, didn't he? Mother, I mean. Faith like that... he's just stubborn enough to hold onto the idea of her, isn't he? Though, what she saw in him, I'm not sure.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father was different with Persephone, to some extent. He has always been as you know him, yet... her lightness... it affected even him, I think. And he knows... that he was better with her, than without.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sounds like a lot of pressure on Mother to fix all his failings... but, it sounds as though she cared for him, as well. And you, and Cerberus. She said she misses you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, why is it the mortals come here knowing all about Olympus, while knowing so little about what goes on in our realm? Is there something more we could be doing to help spread the word?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: This realm remains enshrouded and obscure by my design and by your father's will, my child. Tell me, what would be the benefit of the attention you would seek?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, I... I don't know, it's just, for all the famous gods and monsters and the like, it seems to me that someone such as you, who does so much, why... you should be at least as known as any one of them!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Obscurity is not a weakness, child. Are we understood? Seek to be valuable, not to be known. If you are valuable, then fame or notoriety can be a consequence. Should they become a burden... I can help.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have encountered setbacks within Asphodel, have you not, child? The Bloodless shades residing there are eager to bring death to any form of life. Beware of their infernal power.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have confronted the Exalted Shades within Elysium, my child. Your father offers them a handsome bounty should they bring your journey to an end. Although, I think the pride of vanquishing you would more than suffice in getting them to take up arms again.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You nearly gained the surface, child. Considerable progress. Though, the setbacks that you faced within the Temple... if it is of any consolation, the foes you faced there have been quite a burden to your father, too.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, Father can't control the pest problem? Never thought I'd be of any help rampaging through the upper levels of his domain.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I saw you took possession of the List of Minor Prophecies, of the Three Fates. As ever, I should never have doubted my daughters' expectations. I was uncertain you had necessary guidance to select it from among the House Contractor's many opportunities.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You offer something called the *Fated List of Minor Prophecies *to me, chances are I'm going to pick it up. Though, you make it sound like there's more I should know about it. Should I be concerned?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You know exactly what is necessary, and no more. I know better than anyone never to tamper with the Fates' design. Though, if they had cruelty in store for you through their List... I think that I would warn you, anyway.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have fulfilled already many prophecies envisioned by my daughters, child. Although perhaps inevitable, I find it impressive, nonetheless.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you, Nyx. Though, they're just *minor *prophecies, right? The kind that won't necessarily come to pass unless spelled out and coupled with a decent reward to make it worth my while. Not even the Fates are above greasing the wheels of progress, then?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Fates have perfect knowledge of exactly what is necessary for the future they have woven to someday come to pass. We each are instrumental to their ultimate design. Some more than others, it would seem, of course.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I sense all of the minor prophecies described within the Fated List have been fulfilled...? I do not understand how that is possible.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it certainly took some doing, and several of those really were rather difficult, and took some time, but... what's so special about getting through them all? It's a list, right?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Fates are always at their weaving. To have caught up with their designs... well, I should think that they shall have to learn to weave a little faster, perhaps.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Any new prophecies need fulfilling, they know where to find me.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: What is it, child? Is something amiss?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, it's just... the latest renovations from the Contractor... Father told me you've been supervising all of that. Look, just between us, and I'll not speak of it again, but... thanks. So much.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Ah*. Yes, no need to speak of it again. Though, I am pleased to oblige.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: This House is not a place of cheer, child. A certain severity always struck me as appropriate, if not necessary, given our role.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Is this about all the House Contractor decorations? Look, it's one thing if Father objects, but if you do as well... just tell me, and I can have it taken down.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You misunderstand. I am grateful. These changes... I would not have commissioned them, myself. But, seeing them now... I appreciate their presence. You have a discerning eye.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, if, hypothetically, I felt that some injustice had been dealt to someone who deserved a better lot... say, that they were subjected to too harsh a punishment for all eternity... don't I have some of my father's authority to do something about it?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Now that you have regained your access privileges to the administrative chamber, child, yes; that is a level of authority you hypothetically possess, again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But how can I possibly find anything in there? The place is wall-to-wall pacts and parchments. I've no idea where to look.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You can be made aware. Though, use discretion, if and when you need to exercise this power. And make certain that the time is right. Now, are we understood?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Never thought that the administrative chamber would have been so invaluable, Nyx. Though, I have you to thank for all of it.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Nonsense, child. Our records must be kept up-to-date. You merely observed that several were long past due. Not even your father can argue with that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... I encountered Demeter. She mentioned her daughter... *Persephone*. You never said she was my grandmother. Didn't you think... under the circumstances... that was something I should know?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...Listen to me, child. What you know, or do not know, is for your protection. Your protection, and your birthmother's, as well. Your suspicion and your curiosity are warranted. But I can do no more about them, now, except to caution you. Are we understood?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, I've come to know the god of swiftness, Hermes, though... it seems to me he doesn't work directly with the others on Olympus. Do you know him well?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Lord Hermes is a point of contact, yes. Among Olympians he works the closest with our operations here, and aids with shepherding the souls of the departed to our gates. Accept his help; for he is faithful to our cause.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Someday I'd like to meet more of your children, Nyx. Eris, Nemesis... Thanatos told me of several others. Have they ever visited the House?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: No. They are required elsewhere. It is for the best. Some of my children are not on speaking terms with one another, or with me. As a mother... one has her victories, and her defeats.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, I was just busy doing some administrative chamber record-keeping recently, and, wouldn't you know, it somehow slipped my mind where I could find the sentencing parchmentwork for the knave-king Sisyphus, forced to toil out in Tartarus? I ran it by Megaera...

Speaker: Nyx
Text: He has offered you aid, repeatedly. At first I saw it for a brazen act of bribery, but... try as I might, there was no deeper underpinning to his actions that I could detect. That is to say... the records you seek may be found in section sigma-phi-alpha, lower gamma folder.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I waived the punishment-sentence for Sisyphus the knave-king, Nyx, except... he chose to stay! He chose to stay, in Tartarus, I think in part because he likes getting to speak with me, from time to time! Also his boulder friend.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: That sounds to be an agreeable outcome for him. Though, his liberty is not the end of his rehabilitation. As his friend... please make certain he does not run afoul again of your father, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Nyx, you ever have a burning urge to find the case files for the circumstances under which our court-musician bound himself to eternal servitude here in this House, and forever lost his opportunity to be with his beloved muse? I was wondering if you had a remedy for that.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Our court musician brings a certain peace to this abode, my child. But, you may discover, once you find his case files in section zeta-pi-omega, upper beta folder, that the consequences that he suffers may be quite in excess of his trespasses...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You don't know how pleased I was to see Orpheus visiting with his muse Eurydice over in Asphodel. Best of all... I don't think he's left for good. He'll just have some time to visit her now and again! Thank you, Nyx, on their behalf, and mine.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You need not thank me, child. Your actions made this outcome possible. I merely did what anyone in my position would have done.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, *ah*, happened to be looking into our security situation here, just running background checks, that sort of thing, and... I was wondering if you could help me locate an old pact signed by... signed by Achilles, Nyx. It would mean a lot... not just to him, but me.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Achilles... We would struggle to put someone comparable in his role. Though, be that as it may... epsilon-iota-theta. Rho folder, middle, I believe. You are certain about this, child?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I saw Achilles with Patroclus in Elysium, Nyx. They're free to be together, now, thanks to you. If only you could have seen them.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Oh, I can see them, my child, and I have. And it pleases me Achilles has earned some degree of respite from his servitude, for all his loyalty to our House. For what you have done for him, thank you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Father isn't going to be thrilled I've let him out of a binding pact.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father is committed to his rules, and you released Achilles from his pact according to those rules. There is not much that even he can do about it save to have Achilles sign again.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Persephone, the Queen... she has returned! I scarce believe it, child. You have brought her back, to all of us.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I scarce believe it, too. What happens now? Pick up the pieces and begin again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How has it been for you of late, Nyx? Having Mother here again, for old time's sake?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Though reminiscent of an older time, it is now very different, child. For one thing... you are present, now. Unlike before.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, right. So, are you getting on OK, is everything all right?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Everything is all right. Your birthmother... Persephone... her presence has been welcome here, I think.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Congratulations on your new responsibilities, my child. So, you have reason to rise from here to the surface, still.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's more of a formality, I think. My responsibilities, such as they are, remain quite similar to those that got me to this point. But thank you, Nyx. It's strange... to think that I can serve the House, by trying to break from it, time after time.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: There can be no escape. Your father wishes that this reputation spread. So that the mortals and the shades never attempt what you were able to achieve.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it does beat standing around in my chambers aimlessly. And... I daresay it feels rather good not to feel utterly incompetent, for a change.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is an honor to be working with you, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, meant to ask... Charon was there to take Mother and me home the one time. So is he... has *he *been working for *you*? All part of some elaborate plan, or something?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Charon serves only this realm, child. And, he is very trustworthy. I suppose that it is also possible he has some affection for the Queen, if not for you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are still in a difficult predicament, my child. And I, with you, in turn. Those on Olympus think you seek them, even now. That you are my own son by birth. Our deception, well intentioned as it was, has multiplied in size.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're right. We have to do something. We can't just keep pretending with them.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: But if you reveal to them the truth of everything... I fear the wrath they shall unleash. Perhaps not all of them, but some, at least, shall not take such deceptions well.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I couldn't agree more. Fortunately, Mother has a plan! Asked me to get in touch with everybody on Olympus, one by one.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your birthmother is resourceful, certainly. Though can you say as yet, which sort of plan?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Would you believe it if I told you she wants to have all of them over for Ambrosia?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, this feast Mother has planned... would it be all right with you if I were to invite Chaos?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I... hardly think that Chaos would attend any festivity of ours. I am uncertain that they even could. Even more doubtful that they would want this. However... if you truly wish to ask, proceed.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It was a privilege to meet your relatives at last, child. Athena, Ares, and the rest. Confronted face-to-face, they were much more agreeable than I expected. A night we shall remember, was it not?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: A memorable night it was, indeed, Nyx! For most of us, at least. Dionysus, he won't remember any of it, I don't think. But, it was really good to see everyone having a good time. Getting along as though they didn't hold a grudge! So, then, we're clear, I think?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Persephone told them everything they needed to hear. Sometimes that is the only way, with family. Though, the Olympians... they are prone to their misunderstandings, are they not? This state of kinship may not last eternally.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, let's enjoy it while it does, I guess.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Pride has been the failing of so many mortals, child, and has brought low members of your family, as well. And yet... I am so very proud of you, for what you have achieved. I wanted you to be aware of that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That means a lot to me, Nyx. Though I never could have done any of this without your help. Even after I lashed out at you after I learned the truth about Mother, you never stopped caring for me... and you put yourself directly in harm's way, defying Father's will. Why do all that, for me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am eternally committed to this House. Long before your father came to rule, I was already here. When he arrived... I needed to do everything I could to keep order, and establish with Lord Hades an agreeable relationship. But, there is one more reason, besides that...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: To get on better terms with the Olympians. They always used to frown on the Underworld, but... now that they know us, they seem much more willing to get involved and help with things.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: A reasonable guess, and not without some truth to it, but no, my child. My reason for helping you is simpler than that. It is because I love you. You may not be born of me, but I raised you like one of my own. And I have cared for you as I am capable.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... I love you, too. Thank you for everything.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: She has departed once again. Your birthmother the Queen. Although, it was not as difficult to see her off, this time. Knowing she shall return.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It must be difficult for her... returning to Olympus. She had no love for it at all. I hope she'll be all right.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not despair. We have ways of watching over her. Not that I expect anything untoward to happen, but... well, with your family, one learns to take precautions, as you know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I'll miss her.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: So shall I. But it shall not be long, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I was pleased to see even Chaos was able to attend our little feast there with the Olympians, in spirit, anyway! Were you able to chat at all?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Only a little bit. The first communication we have had in quite some time. It went better than expected. Perhaps they and I can continue the conversation at some point. Thank you for your initiative, child.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, let's enjoy it while it does, I guess.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Alas, you have seen much of Hypnos lately, child. I hope you find his disposition somewhat tolerable? Please tell me plain if this is not the case.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*, he's not so bad, Nyx. Be proud of your sleepy, cheerful son! Who else among us is able to muster that kind of enthusiasm?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't often see you interact with Hypnos, Nyx, so I just wanted to make sure... is everything all right?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Hypnos still is learning independence, child. Thus, I have decided it is best to keep my distance from him temporarily, else he shall continue to rely upon me, even for completing the most rudimentary requests. We have agreed he shall not call upon me for the time being.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: For the time being? How long are we talking? Can't remember the last time I saw you speaking with him, now that you mention it.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Based on his rate of progress, I suspect his education shall have been complete well before the dawning of the next age.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, have you seen Charon lately? Everything all right with him? I can never tell how he's doing.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Charon and I have not lately taken opportunities to correspond. But he has always been among the least dependent of my children, other than perhaps only the Fates. This much I know and can assure to you: He always is content to steer his boat.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I suppose you are the one to thank for his assistance, when it comes to selling me his wares and such.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: No. He is the one to thank. Do not mistake his lack of speech for lack of cleverness. He serves this House as I do. But he does not answer to me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Nyx? You don't suppose Charon would hold it against me if... we had a little fight? To the death, I mean.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: None of Charon's brothers ever dared fight with him whilst growing up. Why would you fathom such a ruinous idea, child?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It... kind of already happened. And, I can confirm he's rather strong. Something I can do to make it up to him?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Probably not. For it is unnecessary. Likely he appreciates having an adversary, in his own way. Few would so much as dare.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You must have vanquished Megaera, my child, for she has been sulking in the lounge for quite some time. You are safe here from her whip, but not her words.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'd better talk to her. Thank you for the heads-up, Nyx. See you later, I'm sure.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You must have vanquished Megaera, my child. For she has been sulking in the corner there for quite some time. You are safe here from her whip, but not her words.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'd better talk to her. Thank you for the heads-up, Nyx. See you later, I'm sure.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, do you know anything about a softly-spoken gentlebeing under the guise of Chaos? They approached me recently, and offered me a Boon, of sorts.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Primordial Chaos... indeed, I know them well. They must have taken interest in your quest. I would advise that you beware their offerings, though know that Chaos, whilst a trickster, is not a deceiver.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Can you tell me something more of Chaos, Nyx? I... have a lot of questions.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: My place is not to speak too openly of Chaos, child. It is their own prerogative to tell you of themselves. I can say they are the eldest force within this world. Before them, there was nothing.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Chaos seems to have taken somewhat of a liking to me, Nyx. They mentioned you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: They mentioned me, did they... I thought, perhaps, that they had long forgotten. You should know they are my mother and my father, child. We have not spoken since the dawn of time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, I hate to be a bother, but I wanted to ask you about Chaos once again. Won't you at least try to reach out to them?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is for Chaos to reach out to me if they wish to reacquaint themselves with me. Child, it would please me if we spoke no more of this for now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Child, I... know not exactly what you did, but... I detected faintly an attempt by Chaos to reach out to me. A message, merely at the edges of my consciousness, yet I felt certain it was there. But I could not discern it, otherwise. What does Chaos want from me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... think Chaos wishes to reestablish contact with you, Nyx. The two of you drifted apart from one another, so, I think I can imagine. I lost touch with Thanatos awhile! But that was nothing in comparison to this. Isn't there someway you can reconnect?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Now that the House is strong, and this realm orderly, I do not know. But I shall think upon it, child. Leave me, please.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I know what must be done, regarding Chaos and myself, my child. It is not often that I ask for your assistance, but I need for you to do something for me, if you would hear me out.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Of course, Nyx. Anything. What can I do?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: In the administrative chamber, you perhaps recall the Eldest Sigil there. Through it we have access directly to the darkest reaches of the realm. But not to Chaos, anymore. Not currently. Though, this is solvable, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, the Sigil? But I'm not authorized to use it. It's never worked for me, and I have even less authority around here now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: That you were stripped of your authority is what makes this possible at all. It shall require a significant expenditure of Darkness. Then... the bridge to Chaos may be restored. So that I might travel again to visit them. Will you bring Darkness to the Sigil for me, please? When possible.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll do everything I can. Hey maybe you can put in a request with the House Contractor for me? Make it official, right?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: At last. The bridge to Chaos is restored. Thank you so very much, my child. I shall be going, then. And I shall presently return. Please, have no fear. And now, farewell. I shall bring Chaos your kindest regards.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, you're back! So, how did things with Chaos go? Please tell me it went well?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It did. It did go well, my child, I... appreciated having had a chance to reconnect with my great ancestor. Thanks to your generosity, to both of us. We had to make up for a great deal of lost time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So what happens now? You're back on speaking terms, then... does it mean Chaos will stop by for a visit soon, something like that?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Chaos is comfortable in their realm. I may, however, visit every now and then. Keep them apprised of what unfolds up here. Beyond that... Chaos knows better than to exert too much influence upon this realm. Beyond having already formulated it, and everything.

Description: Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest Complete Aftermath 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How are you and Chaos getting on, lately, Nyx? Sounds like they expected an awful lot from you before. That you should shine as bright as day, something like that? I can't imagine.

Description: Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest Complete Aftermath 01
Speaker: Nyx
Text: To shine was never quite my strongest suit. During the dawn of creation, there was much to do. This place... all that you see around you... it was more my leaning. Chaos understands that better, now. As for me, the work helped me to know which limits I have.

Description: Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest Complete Aftermath 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What limits are those? You seem capable of anything. Probably even shining bright.

Description: Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest Complete Aftermath 01
Speaker: Nyx
Text: Come, child. We each have our limits.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Fury Megaera is under orders to prevent your passage out of Tartarus, my child. Conflict between the two of you is unavoidable. It brings me pain to have to see you fight.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't say that, Nyx. Besides! Conflict between Megaera and me has always put the spark in our relationship. We're going to be fine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, you've known Megaera practically forever. Well, before my time at least, so could you... tell me more about what she was like, back then?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Ah-hahah*. I am pleased to see the two of you on better terms of late. Megaera always was as she appears. Dutiful and quite particular. Thoughtful and dependable. Respectful.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It pleases me that you and Megaera have come to deeply understand each other, child. I must admit to you, it was my hope that you and she were capable of this result.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're pleased we're together, Nyx? I thought you'd be concerned that such relationships distract from work responsibilities and such. Although, I'm grateful to have your approval.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I have no fear that Megaera shall be distracted, child. Besides; such matters are more likely to inspire, and to spur greater accomplishment. Although, the greater sense of contentment tends to be a sufficient end unto itself.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It pleases me that you and Megaera have come to deeply understand each other, child. I must admit to you, it was my hope that you and she were capable of this result.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're happy Meg and I are friends now, Nyx? I appreciate it, certainly, though... I worry it might get in the way of Meg's ability to do her job.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I have no such fear for either one of you. You both are dedicated to your tasks. I trust your friendship can withstand your confrontations every now and then. For that is why the friendship blossomed, is it not?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... I ran into Thanatos out there. He aided me, although I think he's rather upset. That I took off like this.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Thanatos is worried for you, child. I hope you understand whatever anger you may sense from him is not the feeling at the source. Please forgive his rudeness.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Thanatos has finally come home. Have you not seen him, child? He has been very much preoccupied of late. It must have gladdened him to see you once again.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You and my son... it pleases me to see the two of you have grown so close of late. Thanatos has always led a solitary life. He never would complain of it, and yet... I know he yearned for closeness, in his way.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you, Nyx. I think we each have harbored feelings for each other for some time. We've finally been true about them.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Then, in this you each achieved what you desired. I ask that you take care of my dear son. I often fear that he shall work himself too hard.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*, he's all right. Though, I'll be sure to keep an eye on him.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You and my son... it pleases me to see the two of you have grown so close of late. Thanatos has always led a solitary life. He never would complain of it, and yet... I know he yearned for closeness, in his way.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's difficult to find a friend down here. Though, I have always had a trusted one in Thanatos, and he in me. I think we have a better understanding of that now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Then, may the bonds of your friendship last for as long as this House shall reign beneath the earth, here in the dark. Take care of my dear son.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: What is it, child? I sense that your concern is of a different nature than it usually is. Yet, it is veiled to me, somehow.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, it's just.... Please don't take this the wrong way, Nyx, but I was worried you were being rather harsh to Dusa. You asked her not to speak to me, at all?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I asked she mind her own responsibilities. I fear she forgets herself, in this House. Though you have an informal air... you are the Prince! The only son of the Lord Hades, Fate-appointed master of this realm. You shall have the company of gods. Not severed gorgon heads.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Pff*! If I'm so important, shouldn't *I *be the one to choose whom I get to interact with around here?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You do not fully know your place, my child. The gorgon-head most certainly does not know hers. Please focus on your task at hand, and leave her be.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are consorting with the severed gorgon head, my child. Despite my wishes that you maintain respectful distances between yourselves.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She's my friend, Nyx. Look... I love you very much, you know I do, except... you cannot choose my friends for me! I can't allow that. I know you don't trust her. Don't you trust me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...I do. Then, very well. But understand that your relationship with her does not preclude the need for her continual improvement with respect to her responsibilities.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What happened with Dusa, Nyx? You really fired her because she talked to me? She was my friend!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: She was removed for insubordination, and repeated overextension and lack of proper judgment, child. Your affinity for her is the reason her removal was as amicable as it was.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Insubordination, and repeated lack of what? She worked harder than anyone here to keep the House neat and orderly! I'd thought you would have valued that!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Her eagerness to please was to a fault. Perhaps your Olympian relatives require sacrifices, child, but this House requires efficiency, and nothing more.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Efficiency*... you know who you sound like right now, don't you, Nyx? I can't believe this.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: If you are bent on undermining my authority, go do so someplace else.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx... I'm sorry that I raised my voice with you before, it's just... I cared about Dusa, and I know just how much she cared about working here, with you, and all of us... isn't there some way you would reconsider letting her go?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I appreciate that you have calmed yourself, my child. As for the gorgon head, this House needs steady-tempered vigilance, not unthinking devotion. Despite repeated feedback, she refused to approach any aspect of her duties with restraint.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you're saying you fired Dusa for *working too hard*? Did you give her any warning?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: She did not understand how to work properly. Despite all that she did, she ultimately was a burden to this House. There was no warning necessary on my part.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Please give her another chance, Nyx. She can learn, she just needs to know what she did wrong. She gave this work everything. She just pushed too hard. Shouldn't something like that be forgivable?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...It seems you have more patience than I, child. And, I did not realize you cared. But do not ask again for me to rescind my decision. Are we understood?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You really asked Dusa to come back. Thank you, Nyx! I'm very grateful. And Megaera. Probably everybody here! I'm sure she won't let you down.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I know you care for her, child. And I admit I retain several concerns. Not only about the appropriateness of her conduct, but of her reckless inexperience. I do, however, see the possibility that she can work through these issues. Perhaps with your support.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: At first, I was deeply concerned that you were spending so much time with Dusa, child. It seemed unbecoming for the both of you, and threatened to disrupt our custodian's routine. Except... it pleases me to say that, in this case, I was mistaken about you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you for saying so, Nyx. Though, you mean you were mistaken about me, or about Dusa?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I was mistaken about both of you. That you would influence her in a harmful way, yet here, in point of fact, she has performed her duties with increasing skill. That she would fail to perform her role, or to learn well from her mistakes. Please do continue to look out for her.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Hold, child. I have a message for you from my daughters, themselves. Concerning the Blade of the Underworld in your possession.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you mean the Fates? And Stygius? I'm honored that they would have taken any notice of me. What is it that they want for me to know?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: They wish for me to impart to you these words, so that your blade, in turn, may hear them uttered from your lips: *I see your kingly pardon from a prison of stone. *Repeat them, and remember.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *I see your kingly pardon from a prison of stone*... this must be for one of the weapon's hidden forms. Please tell your daughters I am very grateful, Nyx.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall, child. Although, I'm certain they already know. Though, whether they are aiding you or this is simply what must come to pass, I cannot say.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, the words you told me... when I spoke them to Stygius, the blade revealed to me the form of a great leader among men, taking counsel with his loyal retinue about a circular table. But if his reign is inevitable, why would the Fates need me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: That I cannot say, child. It is peculiar having daughters who know every outcome that shall come to pass. It puts a strain on our relationship, and... I have learned never to ask they tell me more than they are willing to impart.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You... you're... Nyx, you're not my mother. All this time, you and my father, you... you lied to me?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Oh*, my dear child! So now you know...? So now you know. But, only half the truth. I can explain the rest, so, please.... It never was my wish to hurt you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Nyx, I would have you know, I'm now proud owner of my very own Chthonic Companion! You really built them to last. Just... not very many of them, apparently. I'd all but given up on ever finding one.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I sensed this outcome, and it pleases me. Though, you never would have simply discovered such a thing. They each are unique artifacts that must be given willingly if they are to retain their shape, and power.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to say, and I do mean this as a compliment: It's hard for me to imagine Night Incarnate herself fashioning these little keepsakes to be given between friends.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not mistake them for their unassuming look. Within them is the strength of an unbreaking bond between two souls conjoined.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, did you really give Dusa quite possibly the sole surviving epsilon edition Chthonic Companion in the entire Underworld? She's very grateful for it, so much so that she entrusted Fidi to my care. They grow in power that way, right?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The severed gorgon head is not without redeeming attributes, my child. Though, I expected this companion would soon find its way to you, the way the two of you have grown attached. Thus, in one action, both of you have found encouragement.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...You are not to aid him in these matters, Nyx; his foolishness is to be scorned and reprimanded, not indulged. Do we have an understanding?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: We have an understanding, Hades, yes. He is your own son, after all, and therefore your responsibility. I, in turn, have my commitments to this realm, and to this House. You have aided me in them, so I remain, as ever, in your debt.

Speaker: Hades
Text: It is not necessary to remind me. Surely all those who once defied my brothers and myself would much prefer a post within my House over eternity within the lowest depths of Tartarus. Not that the darkness there would trouble you.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...It is plain to me that you are helping him; in spite of my insistence you do not. What do you expect that I should do about this, Nyx? What would you do, in my position? Deception, in my very house and home...! Answer me.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Hades, my relationship with him remains unchanged. It is the very same relationship from when you first requested I take care of him. He has my full support, and always shall. You must know this. He wishes now to leave. I shall make no attempt to stop him.

Speaker: Hades
Text: *Tsch*. What good is any one of you? He's not even your son; and yet you coddle him. You know as well as I that he cannot succeed. You fill his mind with harmful delusions. If that is what you want for him, then, please! Proceed at pace.

Speaker: Hades
Text: *Olympus knows of him*?! Bestowing on him all their worthless blessings, here, within my realm! *Our *realm! Explain to me how, exactly, this is possible, Nyx. Either your limitless power has considerably waned, or you are up to something.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not question my power, Hades. Your son was bound to be discovered the closer he came to the surface. The Olympians are pleased to know they have a distant relative, and bid him welcome to their mountain. That is all. Their influence is very limited.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Blood and darkness! Do not speak to me about their *influence*! I've seen their influence firsthand. You've made a foolish mistake.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You would speak to me of foolish mistakes? You cannot change the course that has been set. Try all you like.

Speaker: Hades
Text: What now, Nyx? Do you realize the danger you have put her in? You claim to care for her, but now you threaten to expose her, to *them*!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Hades. When have I even once been unaware of precisely what I mean to do? I shall bring no harm to the Queen, and neither shall your son.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Harm to the Queen, wait... what are you talking about?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Child! Zagreus. Do you intend to betray the presence of your birthmother to the Olympians?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No! Of course not. She... seems content to be all on her own.

Speaker: Hades
Text: You take his word for it? How can you trust him not to ruin everything?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Precisely how I trusted him to get us to this point.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...What I attempt to tell you, Nyx, is I am grateful. For our long-standing collaboration, here. My rule was thrust upon you and your kin. By all rights, you ought have undermined my every move. I often thought you would. Yet once Olympus and I severed ties... you stood by me still.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am the Night Itself, as you well know, Hades. As I declared to you when first we met: I shall stand by your side, so long as you remain the fate-appointed ruler of this realm.

Speaker: Hades
Text: I shall require no additional reminders. Know, in turn, that I shall always oversee this realm to the full extent of my ability.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: ...I've done the best I could, preparing him. Though, I am fearful it was not enough. No one ever has escaped this place.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your expertise has readied him, Achilles. Yet I sense it is your confidence in him which spurs him on. Do not lose faith in yourself now, lest soon he do the same.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: ...You raised him well, O Night. You know that, I hope? Though, I can't imagine even you could have expected this outcome. Thank you... for making all this possible. For all of us.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are to thank for this outcome as much as I. Perhaps more so. For I have little choice but to serve this House. I was created in this realm, and it is everything to me. But you? Your loyalty could not have been assumed.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: *Oh*, I don't know. I felt I had no choice, either, except to serve this House. At least at first. But in training the Prince... preparing him... I felt like I was living for something again. As strange as that may sound.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Nevertheless, given the circumstances of your life and servitude, you need not have given so much of yourself. The greatness of your mortal days followed you into death.

Description: Duo - Nyx and Achilles After Myrmidon Reunion Quest (1)
Speaker: Achilles
Text: ...I cannot ever repay you for what you have done, O Night. Know only that it is my honor to continue to serve at your pleasure, here.

Description: Duo - Nyx and Achilles After Myrmidon Reunion Quest (1)
Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am certain I know nothing of what you mean, Achilles. Though, your continued service here is more than welcome. The honor is mine.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...Persephone, my Queen... it has been far too long. Although, the passing of the time was very kind. It is an honor to see you again.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, please, Nyx! No formalities between us, right? It's wonderful to see you, too, my friend. The days there on the surface, they were very different, but the nights... I was reminded of our times together, here.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Good times, I trust.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Good times, most certainly! I try not to remember the others!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: We are pleased to have you back. Although, it shall be a difficult adjustment for you once again, I fear. For all of us.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Well, having built a little house all by myself up there, I think I'm up for anything! You know what it's like.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Darkness guide you, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am preoccupied, so please excuse me, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Take care of yourself, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall be watching over you, and our House alike.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not concern yourself about your father. I shall be watching him.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Fear not for Cerberus. He is well taken care of in your absence, and well-fed.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Go, fulfill your purpose, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your fate lies somewhere past these walls, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are always welcome in my company, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not despair, and hold to your resolve, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Remember there are those who love you, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Do not let circumstances rattle your resolve, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Thank you for visiting me, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Such brief exchanges gladden me, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father is the same as ever, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Someday, you shall achieve your heart's desire, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The life the Fates apportioned to you lies ahead, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: May you discover what you seek, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall keep you safe during your stay here, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am well, though thank you for your remembering me, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am filled with joy to see you whole, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Always am I grateful for your company, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are most generous to visit with me, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You look rather well on this occasion, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It pleases me having these brief exchanges, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: My faith in you has never faltered, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I sense your worry for me, child, yet would seek to disabuse you of the sentiment.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Though your journeys take you elsewhere, still it pleases me to see you, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: My focus is on other matters at this time.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Please leave me to my current task at hand.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Let us communicate again some other time.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall support you however I can, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Through any setback, you are always welcome here with me, dear child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The nature of this realm, my child, is not fully known or understood, not by anyone within it or above.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: There is no setback which you cannot overcome.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: All here is well at present, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The House stands strong from all your labors, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You bring me pride through your accomplishments.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Go, and serve this House.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: May Thanatos assist you should you cross his path.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Remain unseen, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The Queen Persephone must be so proud of you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Go, in honor of your birthmother, the Queen.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: This House is stronger with the Queen returned.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Honor the Queen, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your father's spirits have been better as of late.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your birthmother awaits. Go find her, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Seek out your birthmother again, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Persephone awaits above.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I know for certain your birthmother waits for you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Go. You know precisely where to find her now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I am afraid I cannot help you now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You shall discover what you seek when it is time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Nyx? You've done so much for me, I.. thought you might like this.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You know your father does not like it when Nectar is doled out on the premises, dear child. However, I am not he... and I wished, regardless, to provide to you a token of my affection.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: How can I possibly accept such generosity, my child? Surely others whom you know are more deserving of such offerings.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nonsense, Nyx. I want you to have it. You've always cared for me. I can't ever repay you for that.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your kindness toward me is unnecessary, child. You know I have no expectation of such gifts, from you or anyone.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think of you always, Nyx. You raised me as your own, and I am grateful for it.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You honor me, my child; although I dread that I am not deserving of such generosity. There is no need to flatter me like this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Be that as it may, Nyx! I would still like for you to have it, with my compliments.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: No gift which you could bring me can exceed the value of our kinship, child. Though, it moves me to receive this offering.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's nothing, Nyx, really. I know you've always believed in me, and it's not something I ever take for granted.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Among my many children, both those born to me and surrogate to me, you are one of the most thoughtful and most generous of all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You have always cared for me and protected me. And given me someone to look up to. This is nothing, Nyx.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, if you'll forgive me this transgression for a moment, I would like for you to have this vintage bottle of Ambrosia, please. You can hand it off to Megaera as contraband, but... just in case, I wanted you to have it, first.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Ah*. A crystal bottle come all the way from the highest peaks of Mount Olympus to these depths within the earth. Your father always said he hated it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Though, Father does have questionable taste.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Ah, hahahaha*. I accept this gift, with gratitude. This is a delicacy I have not experienced myself. Perhaps I may yet save it for appropriate occasions still to come. Thank you, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: By the way, I meant to tell you, child. The Ambrosia that you gave me? Rather than hold onto it indefinitely, I decided recently to sample it. Your father's claims about its flavor are quite false. I have never tasted anything like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So glad you liked it, Nyx! And, good timing, too, because... I have for you another bottle, here. They say each one is different in its own respect! And besides, the pleasures of Olympus should be shared. Please, take it, won't you?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are persuasive like your mother, and determined like your father, child. But if you so insist, then I shall not deny myself the simple pleasures of this drink. Though rare is the occasion for it here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx, along with giving you this bottle of Ambrosia here, there's something I have meant to say to you. The Three Fates have been very kind to me. Because, in denying me my birthmother... they gave me you. Without your steady presence here, I... can't imagine what it would be like.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: *Oh*. Then, the Three Fates are whimsical, indeed. When you were born, and I was filled with fear for what it meant for you to be alive, to be responsible for you... I must admit I did not guess that, one evening, you would provide for me both such a gift, and such a sentiment.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, I mean every word. I love you, Nyx.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: My greetings to you, child. How unusual that we should come in contact here. Chaos and I had quite a bit of catching up to do. Please go about your business, and I shall see you back inside the House in time. Provided you return there, of course. And, thank you for this, once again.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Chaos and I have much catching up to do.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: How interesting to see you here, my child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Please go ahead and do not mind me, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Thank you for keeping Chaos company.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Go forth, bearing the mark of Chaos.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Chaos and I have so much left to discuss.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is comforting to be here again, in such darkness.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I shall see you back at the House soon, child.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is odd to have returned to where I was born.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: We are pleased to see you here, however briefly.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: As Chaos cannot visit us as easily, now I can visit them.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades, where... wait, I know *you*! Guess that means you died out there, huh? Well don't be sad, though, pretty much everybody dies sometime!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh! Hi. I'd ask you how it went, but since you're here again, I guess I know already, huh! Oh well, just come on in!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Ah, good, you're back already, huh? A few of us, we had a bet, about how long you'd last out there, and I just *knew *you'd be back in *no time*!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, hi! *Um*, welcome home! Again! Go right ahead! I think your dad's mad about something or other, though.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Wow, you've died at least *five times *so far, I think? Dying's good for the whole ecosystem down here, so, uh, thanks! You're helping make the Underworld a better place!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Great! Just keep dying over and over and everything will be fine.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: It's fun watching the Pool of Styx, you know? The ripples in the blood, and everything, and sometimes, somebody pops out of there, like you! House staff and guests of honor, no one else. I sign them in, and help make sure they have a pleasant stay!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ooh*, why you made it all the way to Asphodel that time, that's pretty neat! Still died and everything but not as quickly as you used to, so, that's progress, right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, wow, you did it! According to my list it says here you've died, what, fifty times *at least*! That's more than anybody's died around here, I think!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, let me be the first to say: *Congratulations*! You have died a hundred times since I've been keeping score. Since I've been keeping track. No prize for it or anything, but the journey is its own reward, or something, right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You're not going to believe this, here, you ready? Three.. hundred... *times*!! That's right! Three hundred times, you've died! That's like... more than an entire village from an earthquake, all on your own!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, I just can't believe it, although I know my list here never lies! And it says that you have died all of five *hundred *times! *Five hundred*!! I can't even think of a number higher than that!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: It's usually pretty quiet, keeping watch over the Pool of Styx back there. But it's sure been busy lately! Why, somebody else came through just earlier! You should have seen the look on my face when it wasn't you!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, you keep dying! You happen to run into my brother anywhere out there, by any chance? Haven't seen him in ages, what's with the long assignment?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Something about a war. Father sent Thanatos to take stock, but you're right, it's been a while now that you mention it. I guess a lot's occurred down here since then.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I'll say! The lounge re-opened, let's see, what else... Anyway! You see my brother out there you tell him we've got everything here under control!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, did you see? My brother, he's come back! He's here! Somewhere, I think! Good old Thanatos. He's so busy all the time, he... never talks to me! Kind of like your dad with *you*, I guess!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Whaa*! Oh, hah, you just startled me there, is all, I was just... um... I...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, uh, everything all right, there, Hypnos?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, absolutely! Everything *definitely *is. It's just... it's Thanatos. He said some stuff, and... now I'm not so sure I'm doing the best job I can, you know?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sure he wasn't trying to hurt your feelings. Wait, what am I saying, he's always been harsh with you, hasn't he?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, what if he doesn't like me anymore? He's got other brothers!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh hey! Um, this might be a little weird, but I, *uh*... thanks! I mean, you talked to Thanatos about me, right? At first I thought he was acting funny. But he has definitely been a lot nicer to me, lately!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Hypnos, I didn't have anything to do with that. You seem like you've been working extra hard, and taking some of the feedback you've been getting to heart. I think Thanatos really appreciates that sort of thing. Who doesn't?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I don't know! But I really appreciate that you went out of your way, I mean... I just stand here and greet and register the dead! But you? You're a real friend!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, there you are! So is it true?! You know, about you and Thanatos? Because he told me, and I just said, *whooooaaa*, but then, everything made sense?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sure whatever it is he said is completely true, yes, Hypnos.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, did you see? Somebody got me this incredible new sleeper-seat right here! Though, I would never lie down while on the job! I'm perfectly all right sleeping while standing up!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Hypnos? What would it take for you to let me through the locked door down the hall?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, that's a good one, you know I can't let you enter your dad's private chambers anymore, since you betrayed his trust and tried to run away from home! Sorry, Master's orders!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, did you see?! The Queen's come back! Though, did she ever take her sweet time!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey watch it, Hypnos, that's my mother you're talking about!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: What, really? *Huh*! So then *your *mom doesn't spend any time with you, either! We've got something in common!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Wait, wait, wait, so what's all this about you *working *here? I thought they fired you, and that was why you left!
