Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hypnos... you think all these times I've died, it's because I was upset I was let go from a miserable job?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I heard the feast you had here, it was really something else! All the gods, together in one place, eating, drinking, not killing one another! That must have been a sight.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You should have been there, Hypnos! Not that I noticed your absence, though, what happened? Other pressing business?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Slept through the whole thing!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Hypnos? This is for all the well-meaning advice you've given me. A little something from a certain double-bladed-axe-wielding, bull-headed, oversized monster of a man who you admire?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: What's this, it's kind of hard to read the hand-writing, it says, no way... *To Hypnos, my biggest fan. Stay vigilant. Asterius. *There's... even a little picture of a bull. You... I... wow... *wow*!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Hoh*, says here one of the Wretched Thugs got you, too bad! They're slow but they hit pretty hard I guess. Have you tried moving out of the way?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: According to my list here, why, you must've just got clobbered all the way back home by one of those Wretched Thugs again! The old moving-out-the-way trick didn't work, huh...?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Looks like one of the Wretched Witches shot you dead last time, sorry to hear that, huh? Have you tried shooting them first?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You must have had a run-in with a Spreader, huh! They're much more talented than the low-grade witches down in Tartarus, so your dad lets them stay warm up in Asphodel, I guess!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oof*, a Splitter zapped you, didn't she! There's lots of witches in your dad's place, huh? Witchcraft must be pretty dangerous for all those mortals up there. Pretty dangerous for you, too!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Aw*, looks like you died from one of those nasty booby traps left by a Wretched Pest, little guys who look like urns? Have you tried avoiding them maybe?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ooh wow*, so Megaera herself got you last time, that must have been intense! She's fast, and strong, and beautiful, and... um... anyway, I hope the Fates are nicer to you next time!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Hah*! Megaera the Fury got you again! She is unstoppable, isn't she? One time, I tried to stop her on the way to have a chat with your dad, and she didn't even turn her head! *<Sigh...>

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You got *whipped *by Megaera the Fury! *Eh*?! I always wanted to say that. Whipped, you know? Referring both to how badly you lost, and to that glowy purple whip she's always threatening me with whenever I try to talk to her?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So you got skewered by a Spike Trap out there, huh? Well, that's too bad! Have you tried not standing there, like, when the spikes come out?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ooh *looks like one of those Dart Traps killed you last time, bet *that *must have hurt! Have you tried getting behind something?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ow *looks like you got blasted to bits by an explosive urn last time! We keep some really nasty shades all bottled up in those, but... you so much as touch them, *BOOM*! Hah!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Whoaaa*, you just got killed by one of those Bloodless Inferno Bomber skeleton type guys, nice! I always wondered what would happen if you just kind of stood around while all their bombs went off!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Owie*, looks like the Bone Hydra of Asphodel just stomped you that time, huh? I hear each of its heads has its own nasty tricks. That must be tough!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Bone Hydra got you again, huh? Real sorry about that. Though, you know what? I want you to get back out there, you know, all through Tartarus, and Asphodel, again, and knock some sense into it for me, OK? OK!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Wait let me guess, don't tell me... you got slaughtered by the Bone Hydra, again! How many times was that? But you will get 'em next time, I just know it! Maybe the time after that. Eventually, no doubt about it!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Daw*, one of those Wretched Louts just killed you dead that time, those mean old slappy guys? Maybe try killing them beforehand, I don't know!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ooh*, says here a Wretched Lout slapped you to death again, that's a tough break! Have you tried talking it out, or something, I... I don't know?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey you got turned to ashes by those floating Brimstone crystally type things! Next time one's turning you to charcoal with those beams of theirs, how about you step on over to the side?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ooh*, ow, so you got burned down to a crisp out there, standing in magma, right? I know you've got your burning feet and all, but standing in magma, why, I'm not so sure that's a good idea!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Huh*, so you walked straight into a burning magma spout, is that what got you this time? Bet if you waited long enough it'd cool off, instead of killing you!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Hooh*, looks like one of those little Numbskulls took a big old bite right out of you back there, I guess they got you, huh? Maybe if you weren't quite so tasty, they'd leave you alone! And so would I!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Did you just get chomped by one of those little Numbskulls, again?! Oh, that is definitely rough. I guess you must have done something to make the Fates real mad!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oh, hohoh, *you got blown up by a Slam-Dancer, I can see it on your face! It also says it on my list! Got everybody's cause of death, right here. Some real morbid stuff from time to time! So anyway, take care!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Why you look like someone who just got beaten silly by a dirty skeleton! Beaten well beyond the brink of death, I ought to say! And, sure enough, according to my list, you did! Those Bloodless sure are tough!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: My list here says that you got petrified to death that time by some sort of nasty floating gorgon head? No offense to Dusa! Sounds like a pretty painful way to go, though hey! At least you got to be a statue for a little while! I like statues.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Pff*, can I just say *ouch*? Because according to the list here, you got flattened like a pancake by a Skull-Crusher, out in Asphodel somewhere! Keep that up and you're going to get even shorter, *haha*!

Description: Hypnos Consolation Hit And Run Unit
Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Mmm*, you look like someone who just got turned to stone then crushed to a bloody pulp by the Megagorgon of Asphodel, am I right? Well, look, I'm sorry to hear that, and before you ask, I won't tell Dusa, don't you worry about that!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oh*, I recognize that look! That is the look of someone who just got here after having met a most unfortunate demise, courtesy of the notorious Bloodless Wave-Makers!! How do they make those waves, and why do they hurt so, *so *much? Plenty of time to think it over, now!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Looks like you *really *took the heat from one of those Bloodless Burn-Flingers back there, didn't you? I know how tempting it can be to try and catch those fiery explosive bombs they throw, but... if I might offer you a bit of personal advice? You really shouldn't do that.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *wow*, Alecto's got it out for you...? Normally she doesn't kill anyone, she likes keeping them alive... for quite a while, really. Hurts them still, but doesn't kill them off! I guess she really doesn't like you, huh!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: If you got killed by Tisiphone the Fury, why, then it must mean you've been accused of *murder*! A most heinous crime, as I'm to understand! Well, I hope you clear your name. Or whatever those mortals do about that stuff!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So, you lost a duel to the death with an Exalted Brightsword, did you? They're pretty much the best of the best, so don't feel bad! It had to happen! But if it's any consolation, it'll probably happen again!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Says here that you got stuck like a piece of meat on a spit by an Exalted Longspear, *wow*, I'll bet that really hurt! Too bad you don't have a thick, leathery hide or something that could help protect you in that type of situation. Oh well!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Looks like you just got pounded down by an Exalted Greatshield, huh? Did you try attacking while their guard was down? Or, did they just not let down their guard at any point... *Oh*...

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Let me guess, you got caught out by one of those Exalted Strongbows, did you there? Next time, if you don't stand around like you're doing here right now, maybe you won't make such an easy target!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: My understanding is you had a little run-in with a Nemean Chariot, just kind of plowed right into you, there, didn't it? You got to watch where you're going crossing the streets of Elysium next time!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Those Archer Statues in Elysium have got to be a real sight, no doubt about it. But, you can't just stand there and admire them, or else they'll shoot you dead like they did just now!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Sounds to me like you got *stuck *in more ways than one gawking at a Phalanx Statue in Elysium back there! I got to hand it to your dad. He made sure those look just as good as they stab any intruders like yourself!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Says here that you got flash-fried to a crisp within a Phoenix Urn's destructive blast back there, I mean, you really ought to stay away from those, if you ask me!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Woow*, I can't believe you took on the Minotaur, no way! No wonder you're back here! Everyone knows that he's unstoppable. Especially me! Hey, next you run into him, could you... get his autograph, for me?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: The Minotaur killed you again, that must have been exciting, huh? *So*, any chance you got that autograph for me, before you got destroyed?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Slain by the Minotaur once more, now he's a real beast, there, isn't he! But, tell me something, any progress on that autograph request of mine?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, I just knew that you'd be back, soon as I heard you faced the Champion of Elysium, himself! You know, I've heard that, among mortals, it's an honor to be killed by somebody like Theseus! Keep it up, and maybe you'll be famous, too!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Look, I have to say, I just don't think you have a real chance against both Theseus and the Minotaur, together! But, you might just have a chance to get the Minotaur's autograph for me, if maybe you ask nice or something?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Good, you're back! So, prior to when Theseus killed you again back there, did you, by any chance, happen to ask his big bull buddy for an autograph for me, this time?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Looks like somebody just found out that some types of butterflies are incredibly dangerous! Especially the ones that come swarming out of those Soul Catchers! If only you could just... not have a soul, or something? Then they'd bother somebody else!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So, one of those Flame Wheels drove right into you, and burst into a fiery explosion, killing both of you, is that what happened there? Well if it makes you feel any better, *technically*, I think this means you got your revenge!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You had a run-in with those nasty Satyrs all the way up in the Temple of Styx, huh. I can't even imagine the sheer agony, having their lethal poison coursing through my body!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You know, I've only heard the tales of the gigantic, vicious, flesh-eating vermin up there near the surface. Now I guess we both know that those tales are definitely true!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Eugh*, it says here you got chewed up by an angry swarm of Crawlers somewhere just a stone's throw from the exit to your dad's domain? Talk about adding insult to injury, huh?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, I heard the pests of Tartarus had bigger, meaner counterparts up near the surface, but... I guess you just found out the hard way, huh? When you tripped one of their explosive things?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I know that look, why, that's the look of someone just incinerated by a Snakestone, am I right? They spit a whole bunch of those white-hot, flesh-burning beams right at the same time, there, don't they?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, you're back! Wait, wait, what happened? My list says you got killed by a *Redacted*, what's that even mean? I've never seen anything like this!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Redacteds got you again, huh. Here's the thing, I keep asking around about them and no one seems to know what I'm talking about! Could you maybe describe them for me, please?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Huh*, that's funny. Nothing on my list at all this time, except... I could have sworn I saw you walk right out of the Pool back there. I'll have to have this thing looked at.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: The list is telling me you caught one of those gigantic Temple saw blades square in the chest, huh? *Eugh*... At least you're back in one piece!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: What's the matter, there, you got a *splitting *headache from those giant falling axes in the Temple of Styx? Well I have just the cure, which is: Don't get hit by them!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Well *somebody *just walked into a cloud of noxious gas, there, huh! Must have lost all your vital functions pretty quickly after that! Next time, you'll know it's seriously deadly stuff, because it killed you! And because it's green!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So, you just plain ran out of time and died, all according to the Pact of Punishment, there, huh? Now that is what I call a *dead*line, *hahahaha*!

Description: Hypnos Consolation Gun Grenade Drop Trait
Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Why, says here you just blew yourself right up that time, with that weird infernal shooty thing you stole? Remember, next time, shoot the *other *guys!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Whoa, wait wait wait, this just can't be right, it says, it says... *hahahahah*, you got beaten by a tiny little rodent? Oh, *haha*, sorry I just, I, you have my sympathies.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Wait, *what*, you're back *already*? Hey, my list says that you barely made it out of here before you died! Were you even trying? Because if you were, why, maybe you need to try a whole lot *harder *than that next time!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oh*, you got throttled by a Wringer, must have grabbed and crushed you like a grape! You know what grapes are, right? They're like big, squishy pomegranate seeds.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Ah*, looks like you ran smack into the Doomstone out in Tartarus, thing gives me the creeps! Next time, try standing perfectly still. That way, it'll all be over that much faster!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, you're the latest victim of a Wretched Sneak, that's something, right? They like to get you when you least expect it, so next time, why not keep spinning around and around? Then you'll catch them trying to sneak up!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So, let me guess, one minute you were minding your own business out in Asphodel, and then the next, one of those Dracons pops up right in front of you and *pfeh*! Just kills you dead with noxious acid breath. *Ah*, well! It happens, right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Going toe-to-toe with one of those Bloodless Bone-Rakers didn't go so well, *huh*? Next time they're ripping you to shreds, remember: That's your signal to be someplace else, instead!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Wow*, you just barged into the Witches Circle out in Asphodel, and they just filled you full of all those stinging purple orbs and killed you, huh? You can't just show up expecting to join their club! You have to study witchcraft for *years*!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, my brother *Charon *killed you, am I seeing this right? He's never been particularly nice to *me*! Whacked me with his oar a couple times, but it never got *that *bad. Must be some misunderstanding, have you talked to him?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You had it out with Charon again, huh? And turned out like it did before! The thing you have to understand is he's got *lots *of upper body strength. You seen the definition in his arms? Maybe try some rowing for yourself!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: So you met a violent end aboard the infamous Barge of Death sailing the river of flame! Surrounded by skeletons bleeding you dry, Voidstones making all of them invincible...! Have you thought about taking a different barge?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Whoa, what happened to you, you just... died? You just plain *died*, like... nothing stabbed you, bludgeoned you, poisoned you, burned you, crushed you, blew you to bits, turned you to stone, but... you're back here! Must have been those *Natural Causes *mortals talk about!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Natural Causes got you again, huh? That's a real shame, I mean, imagine one day you're just going about your business, and then *ack*!! You're *dead*! Although I guess *you *don't have to imagine it like *I *do!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Darned Natural Causes got you once again, there, didn't they? Well, you show them next time! Would you do that for me, *huh*?

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...You're late with your report, Hypnos. Again. Again! The dead of course can wait, but I'm less patient. Now, explain yourself to me.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oh*! Well, let's see, I woke up, I don't know what time it was, and I made sure that every shade had been accounted for, just like I always do, except I couldn't find my list at first, can you believe it? I thought maybe my brother played a little prank, and so...

Speaker: Hades
Text: Get to the blasted point already, I don't have all day! Or night. *Urgh*! Your report, where is it?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Sure I was just getting to it, Master! My list, I found it over by the lounge, it was inside, but I am not the one who put it there, no sir! So I've been making positively sure it's not been tampered with, that it has everybody's name, cause of death, place of birth, former body weight, any previous allergies or medications...

Speaker: Hades
Text: *Enough*!! Blood and darkness, that's enough from you, just... see to it the ledger of the dead is accurate, and get back to your post. *Ugh*, would that you could be more like your brother.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...Your reports have been much more punctual of late, Hypnos. That is to be expected. However... the illustrated edges... a clever detail. Ensures certain reports are easily procured from a stack of parchment.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *thanks*, Master, glad you like those! Ever since Thanatos made pretty clear to me I was about to lose my job, I started keeping a list of my *own *tasks, which I sort through each day, deciding on priority, estimating time to completion, cost-benefit analysis...

Speaker: Hades
Text: Yes, well. Certainly, then, you have a number of such tasks requiring your attention. Continue working diligently, then.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Master, I just can't thank you enough for putting my picture on the board there in the lounge! I heard it's a good picture! I haven't had time to see it yet, but I am going to, it's on the list!

Speaker: Hades
Text: Hypnos... that shall be all. Lest I rescind your commendation and cast you out of here.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: ....Um, could you say all that again with smaller words, Master, because I thought it maybe sounded kind of *bad*?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: ...I just get sleepy, sometimes, Mom, I mean, I've been working so *much*, lately, just over there? You've probably seen me, greeting shades, making my list, creating a welcoming environment...

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Remember what we previously spoke of, Hypnos. Do not address me thus whilst we are here. Conduct yourself as befitting a servant of the House of Hades... and, continue practicing your independence, please.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You have demonstrated sustained competence in your duties, Hypnos. It gladdens me to see measurable progress. Your efforts are to be commended.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Aw, wow, *thanks*! Commended by whom, exactly? Megaera? Thanatos? Dusa, maybe! Not the Master himself?!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Commended by me. I cannot always look after all of my children, as you know. It falls upon them to take care of themselves, as well as their obligations to our domain. As your mother... it is reassuring to see that you are capable.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Capable? Me? *Aw*, Mom... I mean, um, *Mother Nyx*! Nobody's *ever *called me that before!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are my son. It is to be expected. However... I know it is not effortless, to be of use. Continue to do well. I shall be watching.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: ...And if you ever need *anything *at all, Your Royalness, you can *always *find me wide awake, right over there! Though I really shouldn't leave my post like this! Not even for *you*!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades! Glory in Death!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades, where death is our life!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades, where death is our business!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades, and thanks for dying!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Just keeping watch over the Pool of Styx, there, same as always!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: They won't catch me sleeping on the job again!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, hey, I didn't see you come in, *um*... welcome back!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Whoa*, I guess you must have died out there again, huh.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *whoa*, you're back already, that's too bad!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, hi, um, you're welcome! Just, go right ahead, I guess!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Um*, I was just resting my eyes... you won't tell anybody, right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Well, you know what they say: There is no escape!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hey, you look like you could use some sleep!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, it's you, just, come on in, you're on the list!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You're back, huh? That was pretty soon I guess!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You must be pretty used to dying like this, huh?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: The Fates are pretty mean to keep on doing this to you!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Thanks for dying, nice to see you here again!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Go right ahead, I'll get you all signed in!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Good thing you're basically immortal, huh?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Guess you're here to stay, *hah-ha*!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: There's always next time, isn't there?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: How's my best friend doing, *huh*?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You'll get them next time, right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Don't let me keep you, huh?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Signed you in, you're good to go!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I like having a best friend!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Glad you died so I could talk to you!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Nice to have a heart-to-heart like this, you know?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: See you next time you die, OK?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hope you enjoy your stay!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I've got a survey here if you'd like to fill it out?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of Hades! Just come on in!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome to the House of... oh, you know!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Welcome back to our most frequent guest!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I want you to go out there, and *die *some other way!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: There's no escape, in case you hadn't heard!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You can *do *this! Whatever it is you're doing!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Surprise, Hypnos! I got you this.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Whoa whoa *whoa *you can't bring that in here! Hah, just kidding, thanks! But wait, I'll trade you, look!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh! Wow! Thanks! This is real nice of you, hah! I sure am glad you died out there just now!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm glad I died, as well, Hypnos! I'm glad I died, as well.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Ah, neat! *Huh*, thanks!! It's not so bad that you keep coming back like this, is it? At least for me it isn't!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm getting used to it. Though I don't think I'd feel particularly welcome anymore if not for you, Hypnos.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Whoaaa *you must've really gotten pretty far out there if you could get me one of these, so, wow! And thanks for stopping by!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You lighten up my numerous untimely deaths, Hypnos.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Hah, well this is like a dream come true! I mean, how come you're always being so darn nice to me? But anyway, *um*, thanks!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sure thing, Hypnos! Knock yourself out.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh you are just the best, I bet you died on purpose just to get this back to me, didn't you! Didn't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have a secret, Hypnos. I've died on purpose every single time, just to see you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hypnos, wanted to say you have really helped the thought of my coming back here time after time, painful death by death, not be inherently abhorrent. Your greetings really help! So I wanted you to have this.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: But, but, but, wait, this, it's *Ambrosia*! You are not supposed to have this here! We could both get in a lot of trouble, and I mean a *lot*, if they catch us in the middle of this totally forbidden exchange!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I notice that you haven't yet returned the bottle to me, which I'm going to take as an indication that you're going to hang onto it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: One more forbidden exchange, Hypnos. Sometimes when I'm out there and about to die, I catch myself thinking... well, at least Hypnos will share one of his deep insights about why it is I utterly failed. So here! For all your generous advice.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Aww, I... feel like I am going to cry, I mean, all my advice is free! You really didn't have to do this. But I sure am glad you did! Even if it is highly illegal! I... I... I...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You what, Hypnos? You what?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: ...I think you could be my best friend! Have you... tried being my best friend?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Go about your business, Zag. What if Lord Hades saw us chatting like this, now...? I risked everything by helping you out there, and still you failed.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Turns out there's quite a lot of dead to fight down in the Underworld. Though I probably got farther than I would have, thanks to you.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Always happy to oblige. Especially when it causes me to risk my station. To risk everything I've worked for.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What are you doing back here, Zagreus? I risked everything by helping you out there. So that was all for nothing, then?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Far from it, Than. I got where I needed to go, and if not for your help, maybe I wouldn't have. As for why I'm back... as Father would say, I have some business to attend to, here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well! Don't let me stop you, then. Always happy to risk my station for your sake. To risk everything I've worked for.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Be on your way, Zagreus. I have an audience with Lord Hades in a moment. An inquiry into my recent absences.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What are you worried about, Than? You've never given him a reason not to trust you.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Recently, I'm not so sure. Whatever you're doing, it had better be worth it.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I still cannot entirely believe you really think there's any way you're getting out of here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why? You've been out. It's thanks to you the mortals end up down here maybe half the time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: That's different, that's my job. I can't stay there, and frankly I can barely stand it. Do you have any idea how bright it gets, up there?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No. But I look forward to finding out for myself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Tsch*, well. We'll see what the Fates have to say about that. Maybe the shade of Daedalus can make you some protective eyewear or something.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos, the world outside... didn't you say that it would make you sick, being out there for very long at all? I understand now what you meant by that. Beautiful place and all, but... it's good to be back.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: See what I mean, now, Zag? Nice place to visit on occasion, sure. But I definitely wouldn't want to live there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I met her, you know. Persephone, I mean. You look more like your father, but... you have her eyes. One of them, anyway.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You never spoke of her to me. You must have known... you kept the truth from me, the same as Nyx?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: It's not like that. I didn't know any more than you. Besides, Lord Hades ordered all of us to never speak of her again. I thought it just a bad relationship. I didn't realize she left her son.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Something tells me Father wouldn't let her take me even if she wanted.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Maybe so. But even still, she did abandon you. Your family's here, if you ask me. But I can understand that... you need answers.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Than. Come join me in the lounge for old time's sake. The coast is clear. The work can wait.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're really asking me to join you for a drink...? I mean... you know what, sure. The work can wait.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I somehow knew, you know. I always knew you weren't going to stay. You were... so restless here. You just needed a reason to leave! And I hoped you wouldn't find one this quickly. *Eugh*. What am I saying? You have no idea.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, I know exactly what you're saying, Than. I'm sorry that I'm putting you through all of this, it's just... it's something that I have to do. But, I'm glad we know the truth about me, now. Maybe we can move on from there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Tsk*... I've always lacked your optimism, Zag. Anyway... the work has waited long enough, I need to get back to it. Thanks for the drink.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Watch yourself out there, Zagreus. I have to go.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos, I've meant to ask... is it really the case that many mortals have a crippling fear of death?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: It is, I'm quite feared, up there. Most of them cannot distinguish between me, and, say, Lord Ares, or your father, even. We fill them with despair. No helping it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why not? I mean, isn't it kind of a big problem that they have such negative associations, here? Can't we... I don't know, do something to educate them all?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We've all the time to educate them, here. Their ignorance of death is solved almost as soon as they experience their first. Though I suppose they might be better off knowing before the fact.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than? I had another question about death. So... why is it mortals grieve so much about the thing, I mean... it definitely hurts there for a little while, but... it's not that bad.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: They see it as their one and only chance. Imagine if, after you perished, that was it. Back to the infinite Chaos. Everything about you. Returned to how it was before you were even there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But that's absurd. One life? Though... *eugh*. That's horrible, even to think about.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I know, right? Some of them know that isn't how it is, and try to tell their kind about what it is we do here, but... it's slow going, getting the information out. Either way! I get to be the bearer of good news.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Than? Something's been troubling me still, with what you said, about how mortals look at death. If most of them believe their life is all they have... how do they live? I mean, I can't even imagine what that's like. I'd be a lot more careful, at the very least!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: They live with all their hearts, or at least try. I think there's something to it, truthfully. Though, some of them, they fall apart. They get here without me. On their own, gripped with despair. If only they knew what your father always says about all this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, you mean that *'there is no escape'*? From what? The mortals are up there, not here. Not while they're technically alive in their sense, anyway.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I mean, you can't escape your problems, Zagreus. You can run from your family, but you can't run from everything. You have no choice but to confront it, and work through it, sooner or later, one way or another. You, and all of us.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I'm starting to notice that, yes. Though, to a mortal who has yet to die... don't they think of death as some sort of release? You come to end their misery, something like that?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I can release them from their decaying bodies. Sometimes, the Fates demand I bring them in sooner. That's about as much as I can do. Some of them get it early on, how to live. It's quite impressive, really, that they learn so quick.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, just how far are you able to shift, anyway, Than? I never could go more than a blade's length in front of me, while you're out there skipping across the entire world probably.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Most of it, yes. Don't beat yourself up, though, Zagreus. It's a practiced skill but I've apparently been able to do it since birth. Mother Nyx says I was a real handful.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, what is it you're always staring at out there, anyway, Than? I don't see anything.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: The River Styx is right in front of you, and you don't see anything, Zag? I can watch it endlessly. Studying the competition, you might say. Most mortals expect to get here by river, with Charon. Not with me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So you're locked in ruthless battle with a river, searching it for any signs of weakness, that sort of thing? That sounds stressful.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I find it rather soothing as a matter of fact. A break from having to deal constantly with mortal souls. Speaking of which... I have to pick somebody up right now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, my blade, the one I'm borrowing from Father anyway, it... revealed to me an older aspect of itself, of Nemesis. Nyx never mentions her. Have you two ever met?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: In case you haven't noticed, most of us who sprang from Nyx, we're not exactly close. Nemesis is fully occupied meting out justice on the surface. Our paths are not designed to cross. And based on everything I know, that's fine with me.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: How's that Rail of Adamant been working out for you lately? Always figured the direct approach was more your style. Though, I happened to have a look at your permanent record lately, and turns out you're doing a lot of work with that thing.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why, Thanatos, you're learning to pry in others' business! The Rail's been working out just fine, thanks. Though, now that you mention it, how well do you know Eris, one of Nyx's daughters, right? Seems she wielded the Rail before me.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: The mortals call her Strife. She and her children... it's thanks partly to their dedicated efforts I'm so busy all the time. Though, it is best we didn't speak of her, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess. But, I'm discounting certain aspects that are not so bad. You know what? I'll not spoil the surprise. I have a feeling you're going to see for yourself soon enough.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos, I ought have asked by now, but... what's it like? Up there I mean, outside. You never talk about it, I... almost forget that's where you go, for work.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What can I say? It's... different. I never stay up there for very long, don't think I could, starts making me feel ill. Too many sensations all at once. And when the chariot of Helios is in the sky, it gets so bright that I can barely see.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That sounds awful. If it's that bad, why would all the Olympians chat it up so much?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: There's no accounting for their taste, I guess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What's going on with Charon, by the way, if you can tell me, Than? He's... never been particularly talkative, but he really seems to know the inner workings of this place.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I correspond with Charon all the time, but even I don't know the full extent of his responsibilities. He's an independent contractor of sorts, been here forever. Your father gives him plenty of space to work.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He must be compensated pretty well for having done this for so long. Tending the influx of new souls and all of that.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I doubt he's in it for the compensation, Zagreus. There is no Underworld without Charon. I think he knows that, and your father knows it, too.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, were you ever close with Charon, Than? Seems like no matter how much I try, I can't quite get through to him.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Wouldn't be surprised if you were closer to him than I am. Not all of Nyx's sons and daughters keep in steady touch. Though at least we're not always at each others' throats, like the other side of your family.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, you're not going to believe this, but... Charon's been helping me. All on his own, apparently! I was so sure that Nyx or someone put him up to it. That Skelly character I mentioned, Charon hired him!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What are you talking about, Zagreus? Just because Charon's selling you things doesn't mean he's helping you. Wait, are you sure?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sure! His helper, Skelly, he's a lot more talkative, and finally let on. Although, he couldn't tell me how come Charon did a thing like this, I mean... we weren't ever close...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Hmm*. All I can think of is... Charon's very dedicated to this House. Like some of us. Maybe he thought... he could help settle things, between you and your father. One way or another.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Than, now hypothetically, if I were to have vanquished Charon in single combat after having, I don't know, say, helped myself to one of his wares at no charge, how long would you say he'd hold it over me?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Everything is an exchange with Charon, Zag. If there was something you refused to pay for, then I'm going to assume that's why you're back here, now. The debt is paid in obols, or in blood. Or their closest counterparts, I guess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, level with me on this. You didn't happen to hire a shifty character called Skelly to assist me here and there, did you?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Who, what? No. Why would you even ask?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Do you remember anything else about my mother, Than? Just, anything. You weren't close, I guess?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We weren't. She kept to herself as I recall, and I would do the same. Unlike my present company, I do not ask too many questions. It was quite clear to me she wasn't from this place.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Father isn't from this place, either. How was she any different?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Sometimes I have to be reminded that Lord Hades wasn't born here, like the rest of us. But Persephone, she... she had a radiance about her, I suppose. Reminded me of the outside, but... I don't mean that in a negative respect.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, you don't hold a grudge against old Sisyphus, do you? He seems rather apprehensive about you. I understand you met not on the best of terms.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: He is a brazen one, I have to give him that. I hadn't realized that you were close. Despite some questionable choices on your part, I don't think you're the poorest judge of character, and so... maybe I have him wrong.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I only have a faint impression of the man he used to be, although it seems he's changed a lot, since then. Thank you for understanding, anyway.

Description: Thanatos About Sisyphus Liberation Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I heard you stayed the knave-king's sentence. I should be angry with you. Sisyphus must be the only mortal *ever *to have humiliated me. But Mother Nyx, she... must have backed you, didn't she...

Description: Thanatos About Sisyphus Liberation Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: We did what needed to be done. As much as Father likes making examples out of wretched shades, an eternal sentence felt a little excessive in this case. Besides... Sisyphus isn't leaving, anyway. Seems to have found his niche.

Description: Thanatos About Sisyphus Liberation Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Oh? Well, he's an odd one through and through, I guess. As long as I don't have to deal with him again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You and Achilles ever get to talk much, Than?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have my orders, he has his. What do you think? Even back when he was still alive, there was no real chance I was going to be the one to take him here, given his line of work.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Because he was a warrior. When mortals die a violent death, they're no longer your case, are they?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: No. I tend to those in less of a hurry to come here.

Description: Thanatos About Myrmidon Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Your trainer's been absent from his post, more so than usual. You voided his pact with Lord Hades, didn't you? I don't know how you did it.

Description: Thanatos About Myrmidon Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know he's more than my trainer, Than. As for how I did it, turns out being the first and only son of Hades has its privileges. Now Achilles gets to be with someone he loves. Who loves him back.

Description: Thanatos About Myrmidon Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Love is common among mortals. Is theirs really so special as to be worth the trouble? Not just on your part, but theirs?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You've seen a lot of Megaera lately, haven't you, Zag?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's not like that, Than. She's there to slow me down. Get in my way.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: If you insist. Although I think it's much more complicated than you say.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yeah... her sisters are back. They're... hard to deal with. I don't think Meg is on good terms with either one.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: That's not what I meant. But fine, you've told me all I need to know, for now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You and Meg go back a long way, don't you? I forget sometimes you two are pretty close.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Our responsibilities must have us cross paths often, yes. But I didn't really get to know her until after the whole humiliating affair with Sisyphus.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, right. He got stuck in Tartarus after that, under Meg's personal supervision. So you bonded over your shared disdain for Sisyphus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We each had to blow off some steam, yes. That was some of the hardest I ever worked, back then, and her, too, I think. When you go through something like that with someone, it brings you closer, I suppose.

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, there's something that I meant to tell you. Ask you, rather. You're close with Megaera, so, what I mean is... you know about *us*, right?

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Yes, of course. Why do you ask?

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's just... I figured since you deal with mortals all the time, I know that some of them, they choose a single suitor. It's a valid custom, if it's yours...!

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: The mortals have their customs, yes, indeed. Quite a variety, in point of fact. However, none as yet have stuck with me, I think. So don't concern yourself with things like that.

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're saying you're not angry with me? Or Meg, for that matter?

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Megaera 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Not any more than usual. Tell her that I said hello when next you meet.

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Dusa 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, you don't take issue with me being close with Dusa, do you? She brings such warmth to this place... I really appreciate having her here.

Description: Thanatos About Being Close With Dusa 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You don't need to ask me such things, Zagreus. They're your feelings.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, what's your relationship with Ares on Olympus? I know he deals in death himself, but... his approach seems rather different from your own.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I do not care for his approach at all. But he has been professionally courteous with me. More than I can say for most of your Olympian relatives, I suppose.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You mean the rest of the Olympians don't treat you well?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Discounting Hermes, I should say, the rest of them have nothing much to do with me at all. I can imagine why, I know it's complicated with your father here. But as for Ares... I think he's all right.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than? I thought you ought to know that Ares, he... I think he's taken quite an interest in Nyx. Keeps asking me to talk to her on his behalf.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Finally. It's about time Olympus took notice of Mother and all her accomplishments.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Finally? You don't think Ares has untoward intentions or anything like that?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: He'd be a hollow fool if he did. Why do you think they fear us on Olympus, Zagreus? Because of Hypnos? I don't think Mother Nyx requires your concern. Though, by all means, talk to her about it, if you like.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Mother Nyx told me you restored the Eldest Sigil, Zagreus. I couldn't believe that was your doing. What you did... it meant a lot to her.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It was my pleasure. Say, did Nyx ever let on to you of her relationship with Chaos, at any point?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: No, not everyone is quite as sharing as you are, Zag. Nor as inclined to pry. But still... in this case, sounds like it worked out. So, thank you. If she hasn't said as much.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I can tell when Mother Nyx is upset, Zagreus. And I know better than to ask her, so I'm going to ask you. What happened?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Probably because Nyx took issue with me chatting with Dusa from time to time. Is that really so unbecoming of me? Not even Father seems to care.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well, Mother cares! And I, for one, know better than to question it. None of us would be here were it not for her. If she has a request for you, you honor it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're telling me I should just start ignoring Dusa from now on, like you do?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're a god. I'm telling you to learn to act like one.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sorry I raised my voice with you last time, Than. I know Nyx puts so much into this place, and has nurtured so many of us here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: It's not me you should be apologizing to, Zag. Although, with Mother Nyx, sometimes it's best to leave her be. As for Dusa... I didn't mean to suggest you should abandon your friend.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx let her go, Than. Dusa, I mean, she's gone. What do I do?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: If I were you, I would start getting over it as soon as possible. But, I don't see you doing that. Just remember... maybe this isn't about you. Dusa's job may have been far too much for her. Mother Nyx is strict, but she is fair.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Then she should give Dusa another chance. Has Meg heard? She'll be furious.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Megaera will be no such thing. Some of us don't default to questioning every decision from our superiors.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I saw that Dusa's back. You must have worked your ways on Mother Nyx. Don't know how you do it. Can't remember the last time I saw her budge on anything.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx genuinely cares about this House and all of us. She had to come around on something like this. Dusa's one of the hardest workers here. Even if she has room to improve.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Incessant hard work can lead to trouble, Zagreus. I think maybe that's why Mother was concerned. We all know how your father can get. She doesn't need someone like Dusa taking after him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Than, you know, Hypnos, he adores you. Besides just driving you to madness, now and then.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'm rather used to the relationship, thanks, Zagreus. Seems like you got to know him pretty well.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, dying repeatedly can end up bringing people closer, I suppose.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I don't know what's worse, dying repeatedly or Hypnos. Although, I guess I'm grateful for your patience with him, Zag.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Got to tell you something, Than. You can be pretty mean to Hypnos! And that's coming from someone who's mean to Hypnos a lot. Believe me, I completely understand, but... still.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: He's utterly incompetent, Zag. He wouldn't even be here if Mother Nyx wasn't trying to whip him into some sort of shape.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yeah, but... pretty much none of this would be here, were it not for Nyx, right? Anyway my point is not that you should go easy on him, but... there must be some way not to get as frustrated. You'll both be better off.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I know, it's just...! You're right. I catch myself feeling particularly horrid after talking to him. He can be very frustrating, and self-absorbed... though, I know he means well. Probably.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I can hardly believe it. Hypnos finally came out on top, huh? Even Father seemed pleased with him. That's more than I get.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I can hardly believe it either, Zagreus. But then again, he's one of Mother Nyx's offspring, so we shouldn't be so surprised. Though, I have to thank you for talking to me about him a while back...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, that? I noticed you two getting along better recently. So what's your secret?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: He loves lists. Doesn't do well with subtlety, so much, but spell things out for him, and he will get right on it. Long as he's awake, at least. He's still working on that part.

Description: Thanatos About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I saw you voided the old pact between Orpheus and your father. So now he gets to see his wife from time to time?

Description: Thanatos About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He does, and I did, Than. I think we can stand to see a little less of him if it means he can be happier for the remainder of eternity.

Description: Thanatos About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You really need to learn to stop meddling in others' affairs. Did either of them even ask your help? I can't imagine Orpheus did, and I'm guessing his wife's feelings were complicated, too, from what I know of the circumstances of their final meeting.

Description: Thanatos About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What? Orpheus is my mate, Than. And I came to know his muse, Eurydice, as well. They still had feelings for each other, but with no way to communicate.

Description: Thanatos About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: So you decided to step in. *Tsch*. I think my instincts on the subject are just not the same as yours. I know your intentions were in the right place, but... you know what, forget it.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I saw the Fated List of Minor Prophecies was requisitioned through the House Contractor, Zagreus. Didn't take you for an agent of the Fates.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Turns out I'm full of surprises, Thanatos. Though, the Three Fates are your sisters, aren't they? Surprised you didn't requisition the List yourself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Guess it just wasn't meant to be. Though, I don't know them at all. Keep only to themselves, somewhere. Sometimes I wonder whether everything really is preordained, or whether they're making all this up as they go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You took Lord Hades down... you really did. I've never seen him quite like this before. I could scarce believe it when he came up through the Pool of Styx, himself...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Seemed only fair in the grand scheme of things. He slew his own parents at some point, right? I think the Fates enjoy this sort of thing.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Come on, Zag, take some credit where it's due. Though... you'll forgive me if I keep my distance for a little while, as I think you have some issues to resolve. You watch yourself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...You're really staying, Zagreus? I mean... between the generally ill-conceived attempts to reach the surface every so often.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I am. I figured it's the only way I could continue interrupting you while you try to do your job. You work too hard, Than, live a little, right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Heh*. Well then, I'll see what I can do about that. You'll have to show me what you mean by *'live a little'*, though.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Have to tell you something, Than. My birthmother... she didn't abandon me. Or at least... she didn't think she did.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: She didn't *think *she did? What are you talking about, Zag? She left when you were born. Was never seen or spoken of again, until all this with you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it turns out... she never knew I was alive, at all. Complications when I was born. She had been struggling already here, and it was all too much, I guess. By the time Nyx brought me back... my mother was long gone.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *What*? But, Mother Nyx, and your father, they... could have sent for her, let her know... they must have known where she went!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx knew. But, Father must have convinced her that my mother... that it would be for the best if she never found out. About me. So she could live in peace. Away from all of this. And away from Olympus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: That's... a lot to take in.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Answer me something, Zagreus. What am I to you, exactly, as of late? Because, sometimes, with you, I...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sometimes at a loss myself, Thanatos. Though one thing I know is it's always really good running into you out there, it's... well, exciting. Sparring with you and all that! And then, I know it means that I might get to see you here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well, here I am. But you didn't answer my question. Though, you know something? Forget I asked. I've got to go.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Than, tell me something, and forgive the awkward question here, but... are we good? I mean... between us. Any infuriating habits I should know about, that sort of thing?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You know I don't have time to list all your infuriating habits, Zagreus. Though... if any of them were outside my usual tolerance threshold, I promise to let you know, all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So then, we're good. Because I think we're good, but I just wanted to make sure.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We're good. See you, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...It just struck me how much you've changed, Zag. I still remember when you kept trying to singe Cerberus' tail with your feet. Haven't seen you do that in a while.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, I definitely learned my lesson there. But, thanks, I guess. You've opened up a lot, yourself, by the way. Talking to you lately, it's a world apart from the first time. You looked like you were going to slice my head off.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: It sure must have taken a lot of courage for you to come right up and tell me you thought I looked better before I cut my hair. I still ask myself how come I didn't keep ignoring you after that. Or slice your head off.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, the option is always available, I guess. Hey, you ever think of growing it out again?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: No. It kept getting in my way. Sliced it right off and never looked back. So... plenty of personal growth all around, then?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: How's everything been going with your mother, Zagreus? You've been pretty quiet about the whole thing, is everything all right? You can tell me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you for asking, Than. I don't know how much more I can say right now, given everything. I'm still figuring it out myself. I'm thankful you've been there to help me get to see her from time to time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well, if there's something more that I can do to support you in this, let me know, all right? Sounds like you're making progress, at least.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: So, between us... all your attempting to break out of here, over and over... you're now authorized to keep that up? Exposing weaknesses in Underworld security, huh.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Something like that. I guess I've gotten pretty decent about escaping from a place that's known for being inescapable. Lets me keep in touch with the other side of the family. Work with you from time to time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have to say I never thought I'd hear you talking about looking forward to working, Zag. You feeling all right? Spending too much time on the surface, maybe?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh I'm feeling fine. I never thought I was much good at anything, but... if my fated purpose is to be a master of frustrating Father's efforts to make everything strictly perfect, I think I'm OK with that.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well, then, I'll be looking forward to working with you in a more official capacity. Even if we're still supposed to keep it all under wraps, for sake of appearances. See you out there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Have to tell you, Zag. It's different, with your mother around here. Don't mean to be so obvious, but... it's something about your father, I suppose.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think they have a lot of work ahead of them. As long as they're trying... he's trying... I think I'm good with that, for now. Though, I am glad she's here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'm beginning to think we all are. And, please don't take this the wrong way, but... I think you and your father have a lot of work ahead of you, as well.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Your mother's very clever, Zagreus. I always thought you got that from your father, now I'm not so sure. So all is well with the Olympians, again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: For now, I think it is. But, you know how they are. How we all are, I guess.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Hah*! Yes, indeed. Well, then! I guess enjoy it while it lasts, as mortals sometimes say. I'll see you out there.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Such tardiness is oft to be expected from your brother, but from you, Thanatos? You're practically the god of punctuality.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: My lord, I apologize sincerely for the lapse in my performance as of late. I think my duties following the recent war above took more of a toll from me than I expected.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Thanatos, even we gods require rest from time to time. Someday we might get it around here, once this accursed House is well in order, finally. Until then, I appreciate your diligence. Do not overextend yourself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Thank you, my lord. I am at your service. I'll be getting back to my assignment now.

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...You have been rather slow about your duties, lately, Thanatos. And I'm receiving incident reports from Tartarus involving *you*. Remember your responsibilities. And, remember, *I am watching you*. Now, get out of my sight.

Speaker: Hades
Text: You've been abetting him, Thanatos. Behind my back! Betrayal. I would ask you *why*. Well?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: My lord, he and I... please. Go lock me up in Tartarus, or deal whichever justice you see fit, but... my loyalty is not subject to change. And I cannot stand by and watch you fight. The matter between you and Zagreus... there has to be some resolution, here.

Speaker: Hades
Text: You dare to lecture me? *Tsch*. My loyal subjects are too few of late, I think. This is *your *realm, not mine; I'll not cast you into that wretched pit. It's not like I have someone to replace you here, besides. Now then, begone.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'm deeply sorry, lord...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You wished to see me once again, my lord? It's been... a while since I had an audience with you.

Speaker: Hades
Text: It has. The last time, what was it you said? That there must be some resolution to the *matter*, as you called it, with my son? Well it is settled, now. Isn't it, boy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I mean, you're still trying just as hard as ever to prevent me from escaping past the threshold of your realm, so, I don't know if I'd exactly call the matter *settled*. But... it does feel different, now.

Speaker: Hades
Text: And so you see... I would continue in our mutual good graces, if you please. This House can only function if the upper management is in accord. What do you say?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I say, you honor me, my lord. I appreciate you telling me, yourself. And I concur that, for the good of all the Underworld, it is imperative that each of us continue to perform at our full strength.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Then, as you were. Dismissed.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hypnos, really, that is the worst idea I think I've ever heard. Do you understand how little sense that makes?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I'm just saying, maybe if you just, I don't know, had all the mortals die at the same time, it'd save you a bunch of trips, and then we'd have more time to spend together, huh?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I don't know why I bother with you, honestly. Get back to work, and let me do the same.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You cannot keep falling asleep on the job like this, Hypnos. This is completely unacceptable.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh I just nodded off a little while, Thanatos! I rest easy knowing that you're here! But if I goofed, why, I guess you could kill me dead, or something, huh?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't give me any ideas. Pull yourself together, and quit slacking off. The House needs help, and you've got a job to do. Now get to it!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Hypnos, this list has a bunch of tasks from I don't know how long ago, I mean... I took several of these last year! And you've already submitted this week's registrations, why isn't that marked complete?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Don't you know it, I was just about to get to that! Then you showed up, and I got so distracted, it just kind of slipped my mind! It happens, right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You need to focus, Brother. Or it'll be Lord Hades reprimanding you again, and that is not something you want.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, I don't know about that, last time I talked to Master he made *pretty clear *he never wanted to speak to me again!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hypnos, you're not irreplaceable, you understand? If you don't shape up, quickly, someone else is going to have your job.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh I hear you loud and clear, Thanatos! And, let me tell you, they will have the *greatest job in all the Underworld*!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I feel like I'm not getting through to you, Brother. Well, after the inevitable happens, don't come telling me I didn't try.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Well, how often do you consult these lists you make? If you're spending too much time just making lists, you're not leaving time to get anything done.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, I *love *making my lists... I always illustrate the edges, each one is *unique*! That way anyone who gets to review the work, it's a whole *experience*, you know? But... I guess it does take up a lot of time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You'll have to work around the constraints of your responsibilities. You do take breaks, don't you? Before and after each break, maybe that's a time to make sure your own list of priorities is up-to-date.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Wait, my own list of priorities...? But, you're saying I can just go and make a list... for me? Huh. Whoa. *Whoa*....

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I've heard that your reports have been immaculate of late, Hypnos. I have to know, who's helping you with them? It can't be Zagreus.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *haha*, no, he doesn't help. It's just I took to listing only the important stuff up top, and spending just a bit more time on the priority reports, and... guess it's working out!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Look, whatever the case... the work's improved. It's been observed. You ought to keep it up.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Though, what I mean to say is, that... I'm sorry, Hypnos. You're my brother, but I haven't always treated you that way. Would you be willing to forgive me?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Aww, come on, Thanatos, are you kidding me, right here? We're like two skeletons in a crypt! You're the best, and you're always looking out for me. Even when you're not around for what can seem like aeons at a time!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well let's not get ahead of ourselves, here. We each have got important jobs to do. Isn't that right, Brother?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Congratulations, Brother! I saw you finally made the board. You made us proud.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Sure did! That's something, huh? Though, sorry Thanatos, can't really chat right now, the shades are stacking up, there's greetings to be done, and sign-ins... lots of work to do, you know?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I definitely know the feeling. Well then, let's keep it up, the both of us, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Mother, is there something I can do to help, with all of this? I spend too much time away from the House. Please, let me know.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are already doing what you can to help, my son. Continue doing so. Matters are at stake here concerning you and all of us. Your support and choices in this shape the outcome that shall come to pass.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I understand, and I will do my best. Thank you for taking care of everything. I've every faith in you, Mother. And in this House. Farewell.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Am I imagining it, Mother, or has this House been running relatively smoothly as of late? Although I know I must be tempting the Three Fates by putting it like this.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: It is through a concerted effort that the House thus thrives, for now. Though, it shall do so only through continued diligence on your behalf, and that of many others here. It is a good occasion to take brief reprieve. But we need you working to the best of your ability, here, Thanatos.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well... know that I am ever-grateful, Mother. And I love you very much. Where would we be right now if not for you? I don't take what you've done for us for granted, nor does anybody here. You rest assured.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...But that was then and this is now, and we have work to do.... *Uh*, anyway, Than, I think we'd best continue this discussion at some other time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're interrupting private conversation, Zagreus. Leave us.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No, let him stay, if that's what he wants. What does it matter? He's technically allowed within these halls, but he must know he isn't welcome anymore.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Queen Persephone. All of us, we are most pleased you're back. If there is anything that I can do to ease your acclimation to this House, you need but ask.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Why, thank you, Thanatos! I'll take you up on that if I can think of anything anytime soon. But my, you've grown! I understand you've been looking after my son, in the meantime?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Your son, he... is very capable of looking after himself, it turns out. Although I try to be there, just in case. Though, I must beg your pardon, Queen. Someone awaits me on the surface now.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I thank you for your blessings, Queen Persephone. Your son and I... we always were quite close, but through all this ordeal, we've become rather inseparable, I think.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Well, I can see that he has better taste than I do, Thanatos! I have a sense of how industrious you are. You just take care of yourself, please. And take care of each other, too, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: As you will, Queen. I mean, all right.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Sorry, Zagreus, I have to go. Lots of assignments as of late. Too bad I can't be everywhere at once.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: No use in making idle chat, right, Zagreus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have a job to do, and you've no interest in remaining here. See you around out there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't bother, Zagreus. I was just leaving.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I hope you've thought through all of this. For both our sakes.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I can't keep bailing you out each time you get in over your head.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have to say it's quite a mess you've gotten yourself into, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You better know what you're doing.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're wasting your time. Just go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Shouldn't you be back out there by now, getting yourself killed?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You know how much trouble I am getting myself into here?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: There's nothing left for us to talk about.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't talk to me. Just go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Excuse me, I've got work to do.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Not now, I have to go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I don't know what you want from me.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have to get back to my responsibilities.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You are in so much trouble.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You watch yourself out there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Take care of yourself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'll see you out there, I guess.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I hope all this is worth it.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We'll meet again out there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I hope you know what you're doing.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Can't talk right now, I have to get to work.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I need to get to work. I'll see you later.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Your father's going to have my hide.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I am in so much trouble, you have no idea...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What have I gotten myself into, Zag...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Much as I would like to stay and chat, I'd better go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Zag, I've got so many mortals on my plate right now...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: See you out there soon enough, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: If you stay out too long, I'm going to track you down.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Sounds like we've both been keeping plenty busy as of late.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Now that you're here, I can finally head out.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We'll have to catch up more some other time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Sorry Zag, I'm due to get a bunch of mortals now.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Excuse me, Zag, just got word that I'm needed back up top.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hope your father's going to be all right with all of this.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We showed those wretches last time, didn't we.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good running into you out there, and glad you made it out.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Impressive that you went the distance once again.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Was good having an opportunity to back you up out there.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I heard you did good work out there last time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: The shades are murmuring about your latest exploits, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't have a lot of time for catching up right now, here, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're not in too much of a hurry, are you, Zag?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well then... some mortal up there's lived a good, long life.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Mind if I practice my ability to shift short distances with someone else?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well... I'd say that test was a success, wouldn't you?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have to shift away from here, though if you'd care to join me...

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Too bad I can't just shift you to the top, though this wasn't so bad.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hey let's get out of here for just a bit, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Whew. Thanks for the break, now back to it, I guess.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Was just about to go on break, if you would care to join me.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good catching up. Take care of yourself, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I think you'd better head back to your quarters, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Mm. I'd best get back to my responsibilities for now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: This is a private chat, if you'll excuse us, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We'll see you later out there, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Just catching up on things with Megaera here, Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We were just talking about you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well if it isn't our mutual friend.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Enjoy the peace and quiet with us, Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Just catching up with Thanatos, if you don't mind.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Discussing work-related matters, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Look who it is, Than. Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We've been comparing notes about our latest tasks.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We're in the middle of a conversation, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Catch up with you some other time, all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Looks like you have everything under control. Nice work, Hypnos.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Plenty of time for sleeping once your shift is over, right, Brother?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Heard your latest reports were looking good, Hypnos. You keep it up.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Anyway, good catching up, Hypnos.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...That's the last of the new registrations, but I should have more soon.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...All right, I'd better get going. Take care, Brother.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...We have another task for you.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: As you will, Mother. It will be done immediately, then.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Understood, Mother. Commencing the assignment now.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...Your expertise is needed once again.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Then, very well, Mother. I'll begin right away, and be back soon.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I hear you, Mother, and obey. I will return when the task is complete.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Thank you for thinking of me for this task. I'll make it happen shortly.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...The task is clear to me, Mother. I go. Your will be done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...It shall be as you say, my lord. I will report back soon.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Yes, my lord. I will begin, and not return until the deed is done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...If that is all, my lord, then I will make way for the surface now.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I understand, my lord. I know where they are and soon shall bring them here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I do appreciate your faith in me, my lord. Begging your pardon, please.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...This matter will be dealt with promptly, lord. I expect to return shortly.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It isn't much, Than, but I got you something.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You want me to take that off your hands, fine. But you are taking this from me, and if anybody asks, we're even. Or, scratch that, don't tell anyone about this, understand?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What, really...? Come on, what is this, Zagreus. You think handing this to me makes up for everything you've put us through?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's just something I found out there that I thought you might like, Than. Don't think anything of it.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Why bother with such empty gestures, Zag. You've said you're getting out of here; best focus on that and leave me be.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's not an empty gesture, Than. Besides, if I wasn't trying to stay focused, I'd be drinking it myself.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You shouldn't be doing this, Zag. You picked sides, and things are not the same. A momentary stab at thoughtfulness can't fix something like that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't know what you're expecting, giving this to me. If there's a catch here, I don't want to know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: We've been through a lot, Than, and I think we'll be going through a lot more yet. Consider it a token of our kinship.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What is it with the generosity lately...? Look I'll just stash this with the rest if you really don't have a better thing to do with it than dump it off on me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, that's an idea. One of these days or nights, we'll have enough of this stuff to throw a feast to make all of Olympus jealous.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You can't be serious. You're serious...? *Eh*, you know what, fine. I'll take this and we'll go about our business. Though I don't see why you bother.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why I bother? Why, how else can I show you how I feel except by handing you these bottles from time to time?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Than. For all the times you've bailed me out, and just, all the times you've been around for me... I thought I'd get you this. The real thing.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Ambrosia...! Zagreus, where did you even... don't you think this is a bit excessive?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You say that like it's a bad thing. Little bit of excess from time to time never hurt anyone I'm sure.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Oh*, you would be surprised. Though if you're going to embarrass me, you know what, I am going to reciprocate. *Behold*!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: For you, Thanatos. The Olympians might be accustomed to this stuff but I think we should have our share of it down here. At least you should.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You know... the Olympians do have good taste in certain things. The last bottle you gave me... it was... better than expected. Though, I almost decided not to try it at all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But try it you did! And now, you'll get to try this one for comparison's sake. Each one's supposed to be different you know.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Different, huh. Well, then, I guess I'll have to see what you mean by that. Thank you, Zag. You didn't have to do this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I hope you're ready for some more of the real thing, there, Than, because I got you some, and I won't be taking *'Tsch, what is this, Zag' *for an answer.

Speaker: Thanatos
