Text: Ugh, what is this? Come on, already, Zagreus, are you just messing with me, now? How did you even manage to get more of this, much less decide to hand it off to me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: In order: no, I'm not; by ransacking my father's realm repeatedly; and it's because I like you, Thanatos. In case you still have some misgivings about that.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You *like *me, Zagreus...? I never thought, I... don't know why that sounds so strange, coming from you. Given everything that's happened as of late.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yeah. Look, if you don't feel the same way about me at this point, I would rather know. Cease all these coy gift exchanges, and all that.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I never said anything like that! You know what, there's... a bunch of mortals I have to go fetch. Good-bye.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos, I wanted to apologize for the last time I approached you with a bottle of the real thing, and give the whole exchange another shot. Would that be all right?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Hmph*! You're asking my consent to give me yet another lavish gift? Sure! Permission granted. Though, what makes you think that your approach this time is going to be any more successful than the last?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't know that it will. I never really know exactly where I stand with you. But I know how I feel. And I'd rather be up front with you, even if it means risking our relationship, such as it is.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Our relationship? It wasn't long ago you were prepared to throw it all away while making for the surface, if you don't recall. But now you're saying that you care for me, and... what, exactly, Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yes, that's what I'm saying, Than. I should not have left the way I did, without letting you know. But when you found me, I... think that's when... that's when I knew. Or started to realize, you know?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I... yes. I know, I think, because... when I heard you took off, the anger that I felt, it was... it wasn't something I expected. So... *ungh*. What do we do now?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Maybe we ought to take our time? Unlike the real thing there, that's a commodity we have in good supply. Just know that, if you feel the way I do... you know where to find me. And if not... I'm grateful, anyway.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...I see. Well, then. The best that I can say for now is that... I'm grateful, too, for this. Take care of yourself, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have to hand it to you, Zag, you're really putting in the work to get me to forgive you after all you've done. I'm honestly surprised.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't be. That feast of ours is really going to be something, Than.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: ...Thought you could just get away from me, did you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos. I figured it was only a matter of time before Father sent you after me to do his dirty work.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Zagreus. Is that really why you think I'm here? Let's see how many of these exalted champions you can send back to their dooms, unless you'd rather I would send you back to yours.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Barely caught up with you, here, Zag. You must have had a little help from Hermes, I suppose.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You have the butterfly I gave to you. Stay back, then, and it'll make you stronger once I'm finished here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Got little Mort with you, there, huh. Well, there's no need to summon me this time.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're back. I thought you made it out. No matter.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good to be working with you in a more official capacity, Zag. Shall we get started?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Thought I might find you all the way out here. Although, quite frankly, I'm surprised you're still alive.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I can hold my own in case you haven't noticed, Than.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I haven't, Zag! Now, stand back, and let me show you how it's done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Still at it, I see. You're stubborn. And you are going to get me in a heap of trouble before all is said and done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: How about another of our little contests, Zagreus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We'll have to catch up at some other time. Though good to see you anyway.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I have a feeling this is not going to take much time at all.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I only have a little time until my next assignment, but this shouldn't take too long.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Thought I might stop by and check up on this corner of the Underworld, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You've come this far, now let's make sure you go the distance, Zag.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I heard there was a matter that required my attention here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Had a feeling I would find you all alone out here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Want to stand back and watch me work, here, Zag?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: This one is off the record, Zagreus. Come on!

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Looks like we've got an urgent work-related matter to attend to.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Your father's forces making trouble for you, Zag?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Not a word of this to anyone back home, you hear me, Zagreus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I heard you got yourself into another mess that needed cleaning up.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: We'll catch up later, now let's deal with these wretches and be done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hope you don't mind if I cut in, here, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What say we go take care of business here just like we used to, Zag?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I can't stay long, so how about we get this business over with.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Figured you'd be up to have another of our little contests. Now let's go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What do you say we deal some death together, Zagreus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Don't have much time, but let me see if I can pitch in.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Remember, not a word of this, to anyone. Let's go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You look like you could use a hand.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Let's see who's better at this, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I got the feeling you could use some backup here.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Let's get this done.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good, I'm not too late. Got here as quickly as I could.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I got the message that you need assistance, Zagreus?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You left, without so much as telling me good-bye. I suppose you knew I'd catch up with you sooner or later, is that it? No escaping death, and all?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I left when it was necessary, Than. I thought of you and hoped you'd understand. I have to do this.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: That's more motivation than I've ever heard from you. Well, if you won't say it, I'll say it. Good-bye, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I've got to hand it to you, Zag. You're easy to track down. The shades of Tartarus are beginning to fear you even more than your Lord Father.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh they won't fear me once they get to know me.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I'm not so sure about that. Even I'm beginning to fear you, I think. Seems I don't know you as well as I thought.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What's with the look? You had your hands full, now you don't thanks to me... *Tsch*, seems I'm left to thanking myself, since you're too proud to do it.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You seemed a little winded, there, no? Not even close to the surface, yet, either.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanks for the vote of confidence there, Than.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You're very welcome. Now, I'd better get back, before Lord Hades catches on to this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I told you I don't need your help here, Thanatos.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: It wasn't being offered. Just happened to be in the area is all. Carry on, Zagreus.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Still running from yourself, I see. How's that been working out for you thus far?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm searching for my mother. You still live at home with yours. You don't know what it's like.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Mother Nyx was like a mother to you, too. And this is how you repay her. You should be ashamed of yourself, and learn your place.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Listen to me. I don't know how else to put this, but, I want you to come home. Voluntarily. It's not just you swept up in all this nonsense now. And, I know you didn't ask for me to get involved, but, what did you expect?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Than. Home is never going to be the same for me. There's no use trying to pretend. I have to go.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: You don't *have *to do anything of the sort. You have no idea how good you've had it here. Maybe someday you'll come to understand.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Outdid me once again, there, huh. *Tsch*. I have to admit, you're not as bad at all of this as I expected. First I found you, I was certain that you had no chance at all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I seem to have this whole easy-to-underestimate thing about me, based on a decent sum of my relationships. In any case, I always welcome your appearances out here. I know it's not been easy for you, Than.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: That's fair as an assessment, I would say. But then again, it's never been an easy time for me. I know I have to do my job. But I don't have to keep on helping you, like this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...What, you're telling me this is it? You're just going to leave me to my own devices, then, I've proved myself to you, something like that?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: No, you deadbeat, I am telling you the opposite! Why do you think I keep on showing up? You may not really need me, Zagreus, but I will take these opportunities to help. I take it that's all right.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Good to see you taking little Mort there on one of your strolls. Means I can better keep an eye on you out there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He's been great to have around, for sure. Still can't believe you found him after all this time! You used to always carry him around, I was so sad for you when he got lost.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: And I cannot believe you still remember that. Regardless, he will not be getting lost again under your supervision, accurate?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: About when we last spoke. I care about you, Thanatos. A lot. Though, you asked what you are to me... how am I supposed to even answer that?

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: *Ugh*, I don't know. Sometimes I miss not feeling anything. Can't always trust what feelings say. I get to thinking, are we only friends, or... look, this is embarrassing.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: To think discussing feelings would be even harder than annihilating Father's forces. But... I've been asking myself the same thing, Than. If it's any reassurance.

Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Well, if you come up with any answers, I guess let me know. Good running into you.

Description: Thanatos Field About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Hey. I didn't mean to lay the guilt on you for what you did for Orpheus, Zag. I just worry when we get involved... we can make matters worse.

Description: Thanatos Field About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You haven't ever made anything worse, Than. But as for me, I realized what you meant. I was so eager to do something for Orpheus when I first met Eurydice, I... never asked them if it was OK.

Description: Thanatos Field About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: At least things turned out well for them. But that was fortunate. Family troubles, personal relations, and the like... it's sensitive business. Though, who am I to talk. You didn't ask me to show up, like this.

Description: Thanatos Field Became Close Back Off Aftermath 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Than, are you OK? I mean, with everything, lately?

Description: Thanatos Field Became Close Back Off Aftermath 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I am. Though, thanks for asking, Zag. The risk of being close with anyone is sometimes things get complicated, fast. Admittedly it's not a risk I often take, but... in your case, it's been worth it, all in all. We're good, all right?

Description: Thanatos Field About Persephone First Meeting 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: What are you doing back here, Zag? You made it out.

Description: Thanatos Field About Persephone First Meeting 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I did... but I had to come back. And, not exactly voluntarily. I'll be visiting up there from time to time, though... it looks like I'll be staying here.

Description: Thanatos Field About Persephone First Meeting 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: Visiting from time to time...? I don't understand.

Description: Thanatos Field About Persephone First Meeting 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's my mother. She's alive and well! It's just that I can't stay with her up there for very long! So we'll have to catch up... one visit at a time.

Description: Thanatos Field About Persephone First Meeting 01
Speaker: Thanatos
Text: I see. Well then... that's good. That's good, because... it means that I won't have to track you down up top. Because, between us, I can only take so much of it up there.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, *oh wow!!*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, *uh*, just wanted to say, the lounge looks wonderful, as good as new. Better! Hope it's not been too much trouble patching up.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I, *aah*, I have to clean the rafters, I...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! The Prince himself, you, want to talk to me...? Me?! Oh, wow, *oh wow!!*

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, *uh*, just wanted to say, don't bother picking up my room today. I'm headed out for a while.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I, *aah*, I have to clean the rafters, I...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, *ah*, hope you're having a nice stay! Even though you don't want to live here anymore, Your Highness!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Dusa? Turns out that I may be stopping back from time to time, like this. But, please don't bother picking up my room. I won't be staying long.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, sure! But I'll just keep an eye on things in there, from time to time, in case you change your mind, um, so, good-bye!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Prince? Your father, I, I think he's pretty steamed right now, about something, so, maybe you could stay away from him? Or... I could tell him you're not here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's quite all right, Dusa. I'm not afraid of him, and neither should you be. You're the best help he's ever found.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Just, *ah*, just doing my job, here, Prince...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *um*, so, hi Prince! So, is there anything I can get you, or maybe tidy up some more, or... I just thought maybe you'd like something to drink? Sometime?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*! A drink sometime sounds wonderful, Dusa, maybe tomorrow assuming I'm not getting out of here by then...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Whaa*, I mean, it's no big deal, I mean, forget I asked, or anything, I'm sorry, bye!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Uh, *um*, I just, wanted to apologize, because, I think maybe I didn't act very appropriately last time you spoke to me? But I just really, really like this job, and promise I will always do my very best, so, I just hope I'll have another chance?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, please, there's no need to apologize! You've been doing a wonderful job, really!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I... *what*? You really mean it, Prince, I... thank you, thanks so much!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *um*, hi, Your Highness? I, just wanted you to know, that if you do get out, I, we are going to miss you. Around here. OK? So, bye...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Ms. Dusa, I wanted to, *uh*, cordially invite you to an outing in the lounge? Remember when you asked me about a drink?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Aaah! *Oh, oh, oh, really, what you mean, right now, you're... I... I guess I'm overdue to take a break...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...And, well, since I don't exactly fit the mold of your traditional gorgon, I mean, I have no body for example, I had trouble finding work! That is until Lord Hades took me in, and then, I met you, and, well, I just love this job!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*! I can definitely relate at least to some of that.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *<Sigh> *I, I, I, thanks, Your Highness. Prince. Prince Zagreus!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, P-Prince, the way you look so sad sometimes, when you come back in here, out of the Pool of Styx? Is everything OK? Because if there was something I could do...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, it's nothing for you to be concerned about, Dusa. I'm just having a harder time fighting my blasted way out of this place than I anticipated. If you'll excuse my language.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*, I... this is silly, but, I'd no idea anybody could beat *you*, I mean, the Prince? Greater than the mighty Achilles, more cunning than his father, faster than Hermes! But... you're just struggling, like me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I am. And that stuff you heard about me isn't true.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...sorted the cutlery, wiped the counters, replaced the candles, did the dishes, swept the floor, inspected the barrels, let's see what else, *oh*!! The Prince, it's you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's me! Dusa, I'm impressed you're able to manage this whole lounge all by yourself. How do you do it, what's your secret?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Hahaha*, secret? I'm two weeks behind schedule with this place, at least! Fortunately, no one here seems very good at keeping time, so, no one's gotten on my case just yet, but... oh, you aren't going to tell, are you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Of course not. What's behind schedule, though? This place doesn't seem any worse for wear than usual.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Well, that's just it! Miss Nyx, she tasked me with a pretty big project a while back, to make this place *worthy of the name*, which means... there's so much left to do, I need to get everything ready, please, excuse me, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'll excuse me, please...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then *nooo*.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: The House Contractor isn't cooperating with you, huh. No wonder so many lounge renovations are clogged up in the works. Though maybe I can grease the wheels a bit?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *AAH*, I completely forgot!! I need to get more cooking grease for the Head Chef! I have to go!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...patch up the seating, update the menu, clean the stove, stock the honor bar, sweep the rug, dust the rafters, mop the flooring, pay the broker, oh!! Um, sorry, Prince, way behind on my assignment, so if you'd excuse me, please...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, wait, before you fly away... there must be something I can do, to help pitch in with everything? Doesn't matter how good you are at your job, what you're describing, that's more than one individual can handle!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Your Highness, please! I know you mean well, but I have this! Wish everybody wouldn't doubt me all the time, like that House Contractor, just gets to stand around, waiting for work orders! Unless they come from me, then *nooo*.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ooh*, that might be my fault. I've been giving the Contractor lots of work. Some of those lounge orders must be coming from you, right? This place is really shaping up!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Wha-wha*, wait, then you're the one who's been authorizing all these improvements?! Oh my, oh my, *aaaah*!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: The lounge is really starting to look nice lately, Dusa! All your hard work is really paying off!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Hah*! Why, thank you, Prince, it's just that, lately, the House Contractor's been slightly more agreeable I guess, working a little faster, maybe, but there's still a lot we have to do, so, you just wait!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Prince Zagreus...? I just wanted to say something, if you have a little time? I know you're really busy... I can come back.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, no, now's fine, of course, what is it, Dusa? I'm not so busy, by the way, and always happy to check in. Wait, is something wrong?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: No, *nononono*, it is just the opposite, I... can't believe you helped me, with the lounge. I don't think *anyone *has *ever *helped me out like you did, cleaning up after Cerberus, and the new rug, and the kitchen, and, just, all of this!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It was my pleasure, really. All of us use the lounge, don't we? This House can really be a lot, but in the lounge here, things are easier a bit, I think. I'm so glad we have you watching over it.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Y, you really mean that, Prince...? But you don't know what this means to me. I'm finally caught up on work! W, what am I going to do? I, I don't know what I'm going to do with all this extra time! I have to go, and plan everything out!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Zagreus? I wanted to talk some more, if you're available? I mean, if you're free. I mean! If you have time to right now. Is that OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Of course, Dusa! Where should we chat? The lounge, or maybe somewhere more private...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Somewhere more private, please, if that's OK? Thank you.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...Um, Zagreus... so, ever since you told me you had feelings for me, it's been, like... my whole mind is on fire. I haven't been able to think straight, or get anything done. It's all been so much!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm sorry, Dusa, I... put a lot on you, and... maybe I shouldn't have, since I'm the Prince and everything, as you point out, and... sometimes, I forget myself. I'd never pressure you, it's just... I thought you had these feelings for me, too.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I *do *have feelings for you, silly! That's what I've been trying to tell you, it's just... it's just...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's just what...? Whatever it is, it's OK. You can be yourself with me, Dusa, I promise.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'm glad you put it that way. I... I'm not looking for an intimate relationship. You're the kindest soul in this whole House. And I have learned so much from you! But, when I really think about my feelings... I'm just, not attracted to you, in that way. I'm sorry. You're a really nice guy!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, look, there's nothing to apologize for, not at all. In fact... all this is a relief. I've learned a lot from you, too, and I cherish our friendship for what it is. Do you... do you think that we could still be friends? Or, is it better that you didn't see me anymore...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't say *that*! Though, I was going to ask you the same thing. I'd really like it if you'd be my friend! Though, my career comes first, so... I don't want you doing any special favors, promise me? I need to see how far I can get on my own.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I respect that so much, and yes, I promise, Dusa. So, well, then... friends? For all eternity?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Yes. Friends. For all eternity. Now... I had better go. See you, OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, Zagreus, I... wanted to talk to you again, I... what I mean is, I just, hope I didn't hurt your feelings, because, if I did, you'd let me know, wouldn't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, please! Remember *friends for all eternity*? That's a long time, so, there's no need for second guessing. I'm glad we had a chance to talk.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, well, good! That's a relief to hear, but... one last thing, so I can clear my conscience of it, I... I've saved all the Ambrosia that you gave me, and I figured since... I didn't realize, you know, the way you felt? I can be a little dense! I have it here. And I would like to give it back. Is that OK?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello Zagreus. You look a little down. And so I was just wondering, would you perchance fancy a song right now?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, *um*, Zagreus? I wanted to say, that was very sweet of you, letting me hang onto all that Ambrosia you gave me before? It's in safe keeping now! Except one bottle... that kind of slipped, and broke. Though that did mean I got to try the stuff!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you got to try it, after all? What did you think, all it's cracked up to be?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: It was a*maz*ing. I've never had anything like it! It's so good to have a forked tongue, meant I could taste it twice at the same time! So, um... if one of the other bottles slipped and broke... you wouldn't mind, would you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, I can't shake this feeling, so I wanted to apologize to you, because... I think when we first met, I just... I don't think I took it the right way. I never had a fan before! I wanted to live up to your idea of me.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince, Zagreus, don't worry about that! Even I didn't know what I was going through. When I first started working here, I was just *so *impressed with you, I mean... you were the only one who would stand up to your father! I thought about you all the time!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But you didn't even know me, yet. We didn't get to talking for what seemed like ages. You can be difficult to find! Since I can't fly up to the rafters like you can.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Well I'm so glad you kept trying to talk to me! If you hadn't... I'd probably be up in the rafters still, building up this idea of you that's not even as good as the real thing!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Dusa, something I was wondering, and it's just curiosity, mind you, but... is there somebody else...? I mean, somebody special, whom you're close with, or would like to be. Romantically, I mean. If it's all right to ask.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, you can ask me anything! But, *um*, somebody else romantically, not really, no? It's not really my thing? It doesn't mean I don't have feelings for you, though! You know that, right? I wouldn't drop what I'm doing and throw myself at danger for just anyone, you know!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I definitely know. There's seven kinds of love, or so, isn't that right? It isn't something that's taught extensively down here, though, so... there's still a lot for me to learn, I guess.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Wow, I never thought of it as *love *until you said it there just now, Prince, but you're right! I love you, Zagreus! *Hah, haha*, that feels good to come right out and say, you know? OK, well, bye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I hope it's not been too much, having to care for Cerberus, is it, Dusa? He isn't quite as fearsome as he seems. At least, that goes for two heads out of three!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Cerberus is a good boy, he's fine! One of the highlights of the job, for sure. We really hit it off after he finally realized I'm not a ball! So, I've been feeding him, grooming him, changing his water dish...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Cleaning up after him...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Most definitely, yes. If you'll excuse me, by the way? He's got to go. I mean! I've got to go! I mean!! You know what I mean, bye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ungh*, Dusa... it's a little much out there sometimes, I have to say. Different stresses than in here, but still.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh don't you lose hope now, Prince Zagreus! There isn't anything you couldn't handle, I just know! You're every bit as tough as your father, except, you're nice! And you never back down from anything. You can do this!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I don't know that anyone can do this. No escape from the Underworld and all that. Though, thanks for cheering me up.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'm not just saying it, I mean it, Prince! Look at how far you've come! Practically everybody in this House believes in you! Even the Wretched Broker and the Head Chef! Oh, I've asked them! Everybody thinks you're going to succeed!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Can I ask you a couple of purely figurative questions here, Dusa? First, what have I gotten myself into...? And second, what am I going to do...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Believe me, I know the feeling, being in over my head! Though, if I can find my way out of my messes, then I know, I *know*, you definitely can! I don't know what you ought to do, but I am always here to listen.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know Achilles reasonably well, don't you, Dusa? Seems like he's always stuck there in that hall. At least you get to fly around. Sometimes I think he wishes he was someplace else.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: There has to be a way to help him, Prince! He's been so loyal to this House, and he has to be your truest friend of everybody here. But he's the pity-party type. He needs someone to get him out of this!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince, I heard the news about Master Achilles, that's so great! I'm going to miss him being here as often as he used to, but I'm just so happy for him, and for you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Me too, Dusa. The happy-for-him part, at any rate! He's a good friend, and he deserved much better than to be stuck here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Ms. Dusa, I ran into hostile gorgons that resembled you out there in Asphodel. Resembled only in the vaguest sense, I mean, they lacked your charm or social graces, anyway. I just, hope you are not related, since I sort of... you know.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, those old things? They're relatives just in the loosest sense, like... say you had some nasty, almost mindless siblings born entirely from your own blood, something like that? Do you have any idea how hard it was to get a steady job because of them?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So I have your permission to continue hacking down such gorgons with impunity?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I had another question about your relationship to other gorgons, Dusa. So... I notice you're not much for hissing, snakelike noises when you speak, and so on? Is that some sort of special gorgon language or something?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: No, *um*, not exactly, Prince! It's what it sounds like, *hrrrsssss*!! Just, scary hissing, really, takes some practice not to sound like that with a forked tongue! I really wanted to fit in. Hey, how about you? Always wondered how come you have a surface accent. Weren't you born here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, wait, me? I never gave it any thought. I... guess it's from my father. He insisted that he teach me how to speak, himself. Maybe it's in the blood.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Dusa, this is kind of personal, and you don't have to answer, but I have to know. So... did you... use to have a body, and all that? Because, I've heard of gorgons, well... that you had wings, and such?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Prince, so, look. That's something very private that you're asking, and... I know you don't mean any harm, but it just isn't something I discuss with anyone, OK? I'm who I am. Besides! As you can see, I don't need wings to fly!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Ms. Dusa, I, *erm*, wanted to apologize for when I pried about your past. I just wanted to get to know you better, but... I was insensitive, and I'm sorry.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Your Highness, Zagreus, come on! Don't even worry about it! I'd already forgotten, really no big deal. It's just, the past me, it's as though... it wasn't even me. This is me, now! I'm glad I'm here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, it must be pretty handy, being able to turn somebody into stone. Is that something you can just do whenever you please, like... I don't know, sticking out your tongue or something?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Not quite as easy as all that, but not so hard! You have to get yourself pretty worked up, and picture what you're seeing like a... well, um, like a picture, really, and then, *fwoop*! Stone statue. It's funny, I used to think everybody could do it!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, Prince, I saw that Orpheus, he got some time away, did you do that? He's visiting his muse, that's what he said! That's so exciting, I mean, they've been separated the whole time they've been dead!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: They have a lot of catching up to do, for sure. Though I think they're going to be all right.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Do you have to work with Hypnos pretty closely as part of your job, Dusa? Feels like I've been running into him a lot lately.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Mister Hypnos, I have trouble getting through to him, I think? He gives me plenty of advice, it's just, it isn't really why I talk to him. I... only talk to him when I don't have a lot of other choice, I guess.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, Prince, is-is it really true? About Miss Meg and you, I mean, that you're, you know, um, I? You know!! Because, if so, then I want you to know, *I'm just so happy for the two of you*! That's wonderful, you two!! I'm so glad!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, thank you, Dusa, I know you and Miss Meg are close, so, I am grateful that we have your blessings. Though, we're kind of... not out in the open with it, necessarily, so if you please, just... keep it quiet for us, would you?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, you better believe it, I will tell nobody whatsoever, *no*! I'll just be very, very happy to myself! All right, then! Bye!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, I saw you and Thanatos recently, Prince! You two, if you don't mind me saying, you are quite the pair, I mean, you ought to see yourselves! You're, *whew*...! Makes me a little woozy just remembering it now! Well, up I go, then, bye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, I don't mean to upset you but, I'm worried you're going to burn yourself out if you keep pushing yourself past your limits... are you sure you don't need a break?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I'm sure, Prince. This is my chance! I'm custodian of the House of Hades! I need to keep doing my best right now. Thanks so much for the Nectar! Bye!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh hey, you brought some fish, could smell it all the way from down the hall, that's great!! The Head Chef can take it off your hands, should be right in the back of the lounge like always! Thanks for helping us out, Prince!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Dusa, in your work around the House, you wouldn't happen to have run into a *Skelly *character, out in the courtyard, there, have you?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! Not really, um, because, my work is in the House itself, and, well, the courtyard, technically, it's kind of right outside, so, I'm supposed to stay inside the walls. But, I think I know who you mean! I've seen him, standing there just past your chamber doors. Why, is he OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Have to tell you, Dusa, your job seems really stressful, here. It's a big House! You have to tend to the entire thing?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh! Well, most of it isn't so bad at all, but... ever since Cerberus tore up the lounge, I... guess it's been a little hectic, getting everything back to normal like before!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm not sure it was ever normal around here, but... I'm sorry I created work for you. Cerberus tore the place apart because of me. Though, maybe I can help you patch things up?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't say that, Prince! Cerberus knows better, and besides, you have your job to do, don't you? And I have mine! And I will do my very best at it, just wait and see!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, there is something you should know about me. Me and Nyx, that is. She's not my real mother...! My real mother's called Persephone. She's out there, somewhere. On the surface. That's why I left. Wait, just a moment, are you laughing?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Haha*, oh, uh, no, it's just, *uhh*... I'm really, really, really sorry, I can't help it, I, *um*, didn't want to interrupt, because, I kind of knew all that, already? Um, meaning, I had heard about it, everybody talks, you know, from time to time? But I just... really hope you find her soon!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, there is something you should know about me. Me and Nyx, that is. She's not my real mother...! My real mother's called Persephone. She's out there, somewhere. On the surface. That's why I left. Wait, just a moment, are you laughing?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Haha*, oh, uh, no, it's just, *uhh*... I'm really, really, really sorry, I can't help it, I, *um*, didn't want to interrupt, because, I kind of knew all that, already? Um, meaning, I had heard about it, everybody talks, you know, from time to time? But I just... really hope you find her soon!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I trust you not to mention this to everybody in the House, but... *I have*. Found her, that is! I'm... trying to figure out what happens next. Can't really talk about it yet, so... bear with me?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Whooa*, that is exciting, what's she really like? Is she tall? Does she have your eyes? Where does she live? What does she do? Does she have a job? What color is her hair? Is she, you know, is she with anybody?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Whoa*, why, Prince, you're... wait, you're back? I mean, I thought...! I heard that...! How come you're still here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, *hah*, yes! I made it pretty far! On that account you heard correctly, Dusa, but... turns out I have unfinished business here, so... I should be turning up like this from time to time.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh *wow*, well, that's great!! I mean, I hope it's great? I mean, if you agree it's great, I also think it's great! If that's OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, in my father's chambers, he... he has a bedside portrait of somebody. Is... is she someone with whom you are familiar?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince, I'm not permitted in your father's chambers, are you kidding me? I'd ask you what it's like in there, but... I don't think I'm supposed to know!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, wherever did you get that Fidi Companion you gave me? You know how much that thing is worth? To me at least, I don't know who collects those anymore, but I sure do!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! I'm so glad you like her, Prince! I could think of no one better to take care of her, and best of all... she'll remind you of me! But as for where I got her, you're not going to believe it... can you guess?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, wait, you don't mean... *no*, not from Nyx, herself? Did you, wait, Dusa... you didn't, how to put this, *borrow *her from Nyx, did you?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Haha*, no! Happen to value my job, here, among other aspects of my well-being, but... after the lounge assignment, Nyx herself commended me, and gave me Fidi as a nice reward! Although, she probably knew I'd just end up giving her to you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How's your relationship with Nyx been lately, Dusa? She strikes me as a pretty intense supervisor. You getting on OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Miss Nyx? I'll do whatever she says! Why, did she say something about me? She did, oh, why would you be asking otherwise, oh no. Am I losing my job?!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, *no, no no*, it's not like that, it's just... a feeling that I've had from glimpses of the interactions that I've seen between you two. I haven't always got along with Nyx, but I know she cares deeply about this House and everyone in it. Including you.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Hahaha*, well, that's nice to know! She cares about my work performance, that's for very sure, and I am doing everything I can to live up to and exceed her expectations, tell her that!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Aah*! The Prince! Miss Nyx, she, I, I'm not supposed to talk to you! I have to go!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, *hey*, hey what's the matter, you seem... something's wrong, what happened? Tell me, please.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: No, Your Highness, you... you're not supposed to talk to me, I mean, I'm not supposed to talk to you, you see, Miss Nyx, she... oh, I will be in so much trouble, now!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, Dusa, slow down, what is the matter? Nyx really has forbidden you from even speaking with me? Do you know on what grounds?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I've no idea, Prince, I, look... I really want to keep my job here, so, I can't, I can't be seen with you right now, like this, please understand, I have to go, OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, I... think that Nyx has some concerns... maybe with me, because it's like you said, she doesn't want us talking here like this. Is she... not satisfied with the work you've been doing, or something?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Ah*, Prince, no, it isn't you, it's definitely me! There's all these things she said I need to work on, calmness, not making so many lists, putting things into perspective, not working myself too hard, not taking blame for things that aren't my fault...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Those sound like reasonable goals, though I just wish that Nyx could find a way to tell you that wasn't so upsetting. Won't you take care of yourself, Dusa, please?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...And plus, she said I'm not supposed to talk to you, she said that too, oh, I am going to be in so much trouble, *aah*!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, *um*, Prince, I... wanted to say good-bye, because... it's my last day. Or night? *Um*, anyway, it's really been a pleasure, knowing you, and working here, and so...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Wait, wait, wait*, what exactly happened, your last day or night, what is all this? You're really leaving? Why?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I lost my job! Miss Nyx, she... it's her final word, and so... I need to go, before I make things any worse. Farewell, Highness! Farewell...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Prince, I... hi, again, I guess... I guess I'm back? At work, here, once again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Imagine my relief. I'm glad that Nyx has come around. I... understand she was concerned, but... I hope she never looks past all your good qualities like that again.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I hope so, too. I'm glad to have my job back. It's hard work, and I know there's more to life, such as it is, than this, but... it matters a lot to me, you know? I have to do this, so... I'm glad that all of you are letting me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So, what even happened when you lost your job, Dusa? Did you have someplace else to stay? Was everything all right?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You know, it's funny, after I was fired... at first, I just couldn't believe it, I... felt lost! But, after a few days or nights, it's like, it opened up my eyes, you know? Suddenly, I had all this time to myself, and... what I realized was, I was... so, so tired. I think I really needed the break.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm surprised you wanted to come back to work after something like that. Wouldn't you be totally fed up? Burned out on the whole thing?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I love this work too much to get burned out, Prince. But that's me. I know there's more to being alive or being dead than just your work, but... my work happens to be important to me. And besides... if I don't push myself from time to time, how can I ever know my limits, right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But if you go too far beyond your limits, things can get bad. Believe me. I mean, you almost lost the job you care so much about.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You're right, I... need to be more careful, not to push myself too hard, too often. Hey, could I ask a favor? Would you tell me if I go too far with work again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How's work lately, Dusa? You seem to have a handle on your new responsibilities, or so I hear from Nyx.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh yes, it's going pretty well, so far, I think! I have some new accounting duties, though I've parceled everything, and got a budget for a little extra help. It's funny, I-I should be busier than ever, but... I have more time to spare, lately, and things are good, I guess?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, hey, I wanted to congratulate you! Saw you were chosen as the featured servant of the House, getting your portrait there, right in the lounge for all to see! That's quite an honor!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *haha*, it's really nothing, Prince, something that anybody could have done really, as long as they were fired up to do their very, very best, all the time, with a positive attitude, and without worrying too much about the overwhelming amount of work that still needs to be done!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince! Persephone, your mother, wow, she's, *woww*...! It's no wonder you wanted to try to find her. She's something else! Although, I guess you didn't know that till you met her, huh? But, still!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's definitely an adjustment, with my mother here. Especially for her! I'm glad the two of you are getting on all right. I guess things will be different, now, but... hopefully, it's for the better, isn't it?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Are you kidding?! *Ah*, didn't mean to be so rude, it's just, I think it's definitely better, now! We're like a complete team!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Prince, so, is it... really true, then, that you're staying, and... that you'll be working here, officially, I guess?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... well, when you put it that way, yes, I guess it is! We're going to try and make it work like this, for now.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Well you know what this means, don't you? We're *official co-workers now*!! Isn't that so exciting? We can share our latest learnings, compare notes about the challenges we're up against, run into one another in the hall...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Dusa*... we've been doing everything you said this entire time.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: But it is *not *the same! The entire feel of it's completely different, now! You'll see! So, OK!! Bye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I think I finally know a little more about how you must feel, Dusa. Working for Father, I mean. I was so intent on running away from here, but... here I am.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Look, Prince, *um*... your father's always been a pretty scary god. And, this is something between you and him. Though, if you can forgive him, I guess... it means you'd stay? And I would like that, so... that's where I stand! I know it's really complicated, though.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, this whole place, it looks *immaculate*! That's even after all Olympus came here for that giant feast? How did you get everything clean so fast?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *ha-hah*! Well! I guess I have my ways, Prince. Sometimes you get one of those jobs and you just want to give it everything you've got, you know? I get a lot of jobs like that! Feeding Cerberus, cleaning the rafters! But this one? I just knew it was the perfect job for me!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *uh*, hey there, Dusa! How's your endless toil treating you?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, Mister Hypnos, do you... maybe think that you could, you know, *uh*, keep an eye on the procession line before Lord Hades? Like you were supposed to...?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: *Oh*! Um, that's no problem, I can definitely do that, I'll just add it to the list!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, good, then! Glad we had a chance to chat. Now, maybe get some sleep or something. You look pretty beat...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Mister Hypnos, I, *uh*, wanted to check in with you again, regarding the procession line that's... right in front of you, right over there, it's... moving pretty slow.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: I *know*! Those shades, they just go on and on, and *on and on*, forever, blathering about this or that! I mean, Lord Hades, it's a wonder he can *stand *it, listening to them every day or night!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, well, it's just, I think you were supposed to keep things moving, so, if they're taking too long, I guess that maybe you could say something, or... any bright ideas?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: It's a toughie, Dusa, because I think it's important that the shades who wait their turn, why, that they get a chance to say their piece! But it's a real tricky situation you bring up, so, let me tell you what I'm going to do: I am going to sleep on it! And then, get back to you!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: OK, well... if you don't, though, I'll check in with you again, later, I guess? Because, I'm under orders, so... *um*... bye...

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Heya Dusa, let me guess! You're here regarding the procession of these shades, who have been standing here for quite some time, clogging the hall a bit... they've barely moved at all!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Y, you guessed it, Mister Hypnos, so... have you, um, given any thought to maybe focusing the traffic flow through here a little bit, to keep the hallway clearer, and, oh, I don't know, put some sort of time limit in place?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You know, can't say I have! I've got my registration list, and I have had to keep a careful eye on it, with all the shades that have been pouring in? It's really gotten slow around here!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: It definitely has, I... have to go, um, hope you get yourself some rest, OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I can't believe it, Mister Hypnos, how... *how did you do it*? All the shades that have been lining up, they... they've been moving right along!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: You know, you're right, *they have*! They definitely have. It's pretty hard to notice, since they're slow, but I have a keen eye. And so do you! You noticed before I did in this case. What did you say your question was back there?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I asked you how you did it, got the traffic flow moving a little faster, and... it's the sarcophagus things, isn't it? Right down the hall! The shades, they're scared to stand around! That's brilliant, Mister Hypnos, I'm impressed!

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, that, well, really, it was nothing, Dusa! Though, I'll tell you something! It is good to know that you're impressed with me!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, *haha*, don't know if I'd go that far, um, anyway! I'll mark this as resolved!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...And after that, Dusa, you are to clean the rafters once again, and prune the gardens thoroughly. By then it should be time to tend the kitchens, and sweep the lounging area a second time...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Y, yes, right away!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...Lastly, Dusa, you are not permitted to address the Prince, unless first spoken to. You are invisible to him. Now, are we understood?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Yes, Miss Nyx, we're understood, I mean... I understand. I, I'll be going, then.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Miss Nyx, you're...? Do I want my job again, I... *wha*, I, more than anything! This job, it, it means everything to me, I mean, working with *you*? You are the Night Itself! This place, and all of you, all of it, it's so amazing to me, and I just... I, just I want to help! Just, give me one more chance!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Your one more chance has certain stipulations, Dusa. If you think it is necessary to exceed the allotted time for your responsibilities, I expect you to ask. You are not the sole bearer of this House's fate. Your temperament toward your work is as important as the end result. Now then... I would ask that you return to your post.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: What, I, Miss Nyx, you mean... like, start right now? *Now *now? I mean, I, I don't have a lot of pressing obligations, so, I'll do it, *yes*!! I accept! I'm so excited to be back! Where do I even start, I can survey the lounge, sweep the cobwebs, walk Cerberus, check the pantry, ah, OK, I'm off!!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...and, therefore, for your diligence and service, and for having demonstrated such improvement... by my authority as Night Itself, I hereby name you Chief Custodian of the House of Hades, and appoint to you the privileges implied. Bear the responsibility with honor, Dusa.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Miss Nyx, I am truly honored, and, I'm very grateful for this opportunity, and for the trust you've placed in me, in this expanded role. I promise you, I will not let you down. Not you, or anybody here! Thank you so much!!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You are most welcome. The orderliness of this House is a reflection of the realm as a whole. You have internalized this, and understood that a disciplined approach toward work is far more valuable than mere exertion of effort. Although, you understand the need for exertion, as well.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...And then, all seven of those wretches tried cutting to the front of the procession line, can you believe the nerve? As though they'd get an audience that way.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Ha, hahah*, what a bunch of dummies! What were they even thinking, cutting the line, I mean, in front of *you*?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Let's just say, if they still have any complaints for our Lord Hades, they'll be waiting for a long, long time before they get the chance to bring them up.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I swear you're right that one is such an idiot...! Though anyway, I'd best get back to work. Next round's on me, Dusa, and you take care.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You take care, too, Miss Meg, thanks for the drink! Bye now...!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Follow your heart? That's odd advice, especially from you. Though, no offense intended.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I just mean, if you don't believe in the work you're doing, why keep on doing it, just out of obligation? You have to take care of yourself.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I don't think there's any rush for that. We won't just shrivel up and die in forty years like mortals do. But, I know what you're saying. I'll think about it, Dusa. Thanks.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...We got off on the wrong foot from the start. Just what happens when you're born of Titan blood, I guess. It's for the best we haven't crossed paths much since.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: But they're your sisters, I mean... they're family! You must have something in common, some way of, I don't know, seeing eye to eye?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're more my sister than they are to me, Dusa. I don't always agree with Lord Hades but I am thankful that they're not permitted in this House.

Description: Duo - Dusa and Megaera High Affinity (1)
Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...You sure that you're all right, with everything? I just... I wouldn't want you to be caught up in the middle of all this. If you so much as said to call it off...

Description: Duo - Dusa and Megaera High Affinity (1)
Speaker: Dusa
Text: No, *nononono*, no, Meg, no! No, Meg! Come on, now, are you kidding me? I mean, I couldn't be happier about it, really! You deserve this! As long as you're happy, yourself, right?

Description: Duo - Dusa and Megaera High Affinity (1)
Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, thank you, Dusa. You've always been so kind. I don't quite know what to say.

Description: Duo - Dusa and Megaera High Affinity (1)
Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hey, now, that's my line! Look, though, I better get going, but, I just want to say this is great news, all right? Thank you for telling me!

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...Would that all my subjects exhibited such promptness. Your report, then, if you please, Dusa?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Sir! The office currently is running smoothly, sir! Lounge attendance is up by twenty-eight percent, with customer satisfaction ratings in the eightieth percentile. No issues to report at this time.

Speaker: Hades
Text: See that we achieve *thirty *percent before the turn of the aeon, Chief Custodian. Other than that... a satisfactory report. Now, carry on.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, it's my great pleasure to make your acquaintance. Call me Dusa, please! I, I'm your House custodian? And I am at your service! Anything you need, just call, OK?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Dusa! Wonderful to know you! This House is immaculate! Night-and-day difference from before. Now I know exactly whom to compliment.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Thanks so much! I will not let you down!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I, oh *no*, I, just forgot something, I, I have to go!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *um*, Your Highness, I was just, making the rounds again!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Um, everything is spick and span like always, Your Highness!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Y-you'd tell me if I did anything wrong, wouldn't you, Prince?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...dusted the halls, dusted the library, dusted the sconces, dusted the doorknobs, dusted the chairs...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...let's see, I cleaned the mantle, cleaned the rafters, cleaned the skulls, cleaned the bar-room...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *um*, hi! Hello, Your Highness, nice to see you! Thanks!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Working hard, Your Highness! Always working!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'll make sure everything is taken care of!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, thanks for talking to me, Prince, I have to go!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hi Prince, I fed Cerberus already, all three heads!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Wha, hah-haha*, oh, you startled me, Your Highness...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'm just keeping *busy busy busy *here like always, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I, I'm sorry that you died again out there, Your Highness...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *um*, hi! Is... everything all right, there, Prince?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Nothing gets dirty around here while I am on the job, Your Highness...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't worry, Prince! I'll keep an eye on things!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You can count on me, Your Highness!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Anything I can do for you right now, or, maybe later...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...let's see, I did the dishes, fed the heads, cleaned the cupboards, cleared the pool...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince, *um*, I'm supposed to be at work, so, I can't talk, OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Excuse me, sorry, I just have to file this report, it's *very *late!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I have everything here well under control, Highness!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: What, is something wrong, Prince? I'll look into it, right now, up there!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Am I in trouble for something again, or, no...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'm always at 110%, *hah, hahah*!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, I, I, I, I'm sorry, I, I better get back to my cleaning...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *wow*! I'm so sorry, Prince, I'm just behind already on my daily chores!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Ah! Haha*, got me again, Prince, sneaking up on me like that!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You'll get them next time, Prince, I'm sure of it! I think?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Just making sure the lounge is squeaky clean!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: This is going to be the *best *lounge in all the Underworld!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You let me know if you see any dust around here, won't you, Prince?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You rest assured I'm not even *remotely *tired, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Please count on me for all your household needs!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'll make sure Cerberus has everything he needs while you're out!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't tell me I'm in trouble, am I, Prince?!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Just thought I'd mention, I, I really love this job!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...stocked the store room, checked the locks, cleaned the tiles, watered the trees...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...checked the contracts, cleared the ledgers, set the tables, washed the windows...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...sorted the files, gathered the feedback, updated the schedule, sent the report...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You please take care of yourself, OK, Prince?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I sometimes get so worried for you, Zagreus...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't worry, Prince, I have everything here well under control...!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I hope you have a great whatever time it is out there, Highness!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I will definitely keep an eye on things while you are out!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Just in the middle of a wall-to-wall inspection right now, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Heard everything's been good lately between you and Miss Meg!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Eternal friends forever, right, Prince Zagreus?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: So glad to see you back here, Your Highness!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Made sure the House was nice and tidy for you, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Your Highness, *hi*! All's well here, nothing to report!!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Looks like we've both been keeping busy, *huh*, Your Highness?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Whew*, I have been so busy, lately, Prince! The same as you!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Sorry, not much time to chat more right now, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: We'll have to catch up in the lounge sometime, *huh*, Prince?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *haha*, you startled me, there, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Hold on, Prince! Think I saw some dust I missed up there!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Sorry, got to file this report, now, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Nice to see you, now I'm off to clean the rafters once again!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I'm on duty right now, but it's really nice to see you like this, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I know your job gets frustrating sometimes, so please remember to take breaks, all right?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I hope you're always finding joy in work like I do, Prince!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: From the reports I've seen it looks like you've been doing such great work out there!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Not now, Zag. Private meeting.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Don't work yourself too hard, OK, Highness?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Please do remember to take breaks, OK?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We'll have to chat some other time, here, Zag.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: You get rest from time to time, for me, OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I hope you get to see Miss Meg out there next time!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I hope you'll get to see Thanatos again soon!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Can't you see we're in the middle of a conversation, Zagreus?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Excuse us, Zagreus, we're in the middle of a meeting here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know you can just let us talk without being interrupted, Zagreus?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: This particular discussion doesn't concern you, Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Sometimes, though, Dusa, he's not the best at taking hints...

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Now, here you go, Cerbie! And, um, don't eat me, please?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*, here you go, boy! Triple order, just the way you like it!

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...Just, please be careful where you go after you eat all this, this time, OK, Cerbie?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*, come on, Cerbie, hurry up and eat! This stuff can't be that bad! I mean... can it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Ms. Dusa? I wanted you to have this. It's nothing really, just... for your hard work.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: P-P-Prince, I'm really grateful for this, really, and I thought, I, kind of got something for you...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Wh-whaaaa*, b-but, there must be some mistake, I, Prince, you're giving this to *me*...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I want you to know we all appreciate you, Dusa. Don't work yourself too hard on my account, OK?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Ohh*, oh, oh, oh my, Your Highness, are you... are you really sure you want me to have *this*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I really am, Dusa. I hope you enjoy it.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: B-b-but, Prince, I, don't know what to say, I... are you joking around with me, maybe...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, I am deadly serious, Dusa, honest. It's for you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, you must work harder than anyone in this House, keeping everything so neat and orderly. I don't think it should be thankless work, so, thank you! And I'd like for you to have this.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, Prince, *wow*, thank you! Thanks so much!! You've been so generous, I... I think I'm speechless! No, can't think of anything to say right now!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you said it all! Don't mean to put you on the spot or anything. I'm just glad we've had a chance to get to know each other.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I... I'm glad we've had a chance to know each other, too. Thanks for the Nectar! I can tell it's really, really good! *Um*, OK, bye!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Dusa? Here's some more of this really, really good Nectar for you! Please keep up the wonderful work, and more importantly, keep being your wonderful self.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, I, I, I'm really very flattered, Prince, but, I've just been so busy, lately, that I haven't even had a chance to try the last bottle you gave me, so... you want this back, maybe for someone else?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Please, it's yours! Besides, you must have some time off coming up when you can enjoy it, don't you?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! I mean, maybe I do? I think maybe I do, except, nobody's told me anything about that, and besides, there's so much work to do around the House still, I just can't leave everything like this!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Dusa? Congratulations on completing your assignment with the lounge. Look at this place! It's better than ever. All thanks to your effort and dedication. Here, this is for you. Something special for the occasion.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Whoa*, I, this, this is *Ambrosia*, Prince! But, this is for *gods*...! This isn't for... someone like me? But, wait, wait wait, no, here, I'm going to do it, I am going to do it, here, take *this*!! I got it, just for you, so, take it, please! Farewell!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Ambrosia isn't only for the gods, you know, Dusa. It's for anyone we really care about. So, here. Please, enjoy this, or... just add it to the lounge's stash. Whatever suits you.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*, I, but, you... really mean that, huh...? But, you're the Prince himself, and I'm just... look, we both know I am just a floating monster head. And a custodian. I just don't understand. Why keep on being nice to me, like this? I thought you'd never even talk to me...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're so much more than what you said. I wish you could see that. If only everybody in this House had your spirit.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Ah*. If only everybody in this House had yours, Prince Zagreus. You've been so kind to me, and I'm glad we've had a chance to get to know each other more. It's really nice, sometimes... knowing somebody really cares about me here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It should be more than sometimes that you feel that way, as far as I'm concerned. I just... I've never met anybody like you before. My father always told me not to smile quite as much, but... you're like me.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: What, because I smile, *haha*? Smiling's just a little something that I like to do to deal with the day! Though, oh, *that's *what you meant, I... oh, I see. I, look, this is kind of a lot, I, I had better go...! I'll cherish the Ambrosia, though, OK?!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I got you more Ambrosia, Dusa, and I hope this is OK. I figure maybe you could use this for the lounge? Special events, guests, that sort of thing?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: ...I'm sorry that I flew away last time you brought me something like this, Prince... I mean, Zagreus. It's really strange for me to call you that, I... when I started here, they told me not to even speak with you, and now, *uh*... here we are...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, look, if I listened to everything I was told, my life would be a lot different and a lot worse off, I think! So... who cares what anybody says? I enjoy your company.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: And I enjoy yours, too! Wasn't long ago that I was just a lonely gorgon head, all by myself in the big Underworld, looking for steady work. And then, I heard about the opening here, in your father's House? Well I got it! It seemed too good to be real. And then, there was you...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I remember when we first met. You were carrying three bowls for Cerberus and bumped right into me. It all went flying, but you cleaned up half of it before it hit the ground. Then flew away before I got your name. I thought I'd never see you again.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I was *so *embarrassed! Worse... I thought I was done for, here. But, I got another chance! That was your doing, wasn't it? You've been looking out for me, all this time! That's so sweet of you, I... I don't know how to thank you, I... I, I better put this Ambrosia away, for safe keeping, OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Dusa, I was thinking that this batch of Ambrosia ought to hold the lounge over for quite a while! Keep things livelier for everyone. And, please take a bottle for yourself, won't you? As a token of my affection.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Oh*! Y-you said your *affection*, huh, I... wow! I... really like you, also, Zagreus. I liked you from the start! You were so different from your father, and Miss Nyx, I could just tell, but... wait, what am I saying, I am such a dummy! You're just being friendly with me, right...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I would be more than that, if it pleased you. You're very wonderful, and... you light up this House. But I would never risk our friendship, so, if this is where we draw the boundary, please, just let me know.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: *Um*... wait, wait. Wait, wait. Did you just say I'm... *wonderful*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I did, indeed. And I am glad to get it off my chest, if you must know! Though... what about you? How do you feel?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: I, *wow*, I, I never thought you'd... have those kinds of feelings, for somebody like me. It's really nice to hear! It makes me feel complete. But, *um*, Zagreus, I don't know if I can be what you need, I mean? Wait. You weren't, you weren't just being nice to me for all this time, because...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *What*? No, no, Dusa, of course not, I... *ungh*, why is it so damn difficult to share one's feelings with somebody else? I don't want to ruin what we have. If only you could see what's in my heart.

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, I was just checking, don't feel bad, OK? You don't seem capable of hiding what's in your heart. And I mean that in the best possible way. I'm so happy, it's just... all this is a lot, and, I'm on duty right now, but... see you soon...?

Speaker: Dusa
Text: Oh no, no no no, Your Highness, are you, really giving this to me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yes, yes I am, Ms. Dusa, and I hope you enjoy it. Be seeing you, OK?

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Gguhhhhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why good to see you, Charon mate! Just minding my own business, taking in the sights, and, hey what's that you got, some sort of wares for sale? Then, I'll just have a look around.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Gguhhhhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why good to see you, Charon mate! Just minding my own business, taking in the sights, and, sure is awfully convenient to be running into you like this! I'd all this coin I wanted to get rid of.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon mate, now hypothetically, if I provided you with, say, a thousand coins, would you be willing to give me a ride in your beautiful boat? Upriver, I should say, specifically.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Nrrnnhhh, hnnnn, *hrrnn*, hrrrrrnnn....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Charon, mate...? I don't suppose you've given any further thought to my proposal to, just, you know... ferry me up to the surface? Seeing as it's not out of your way.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Rhhuuaaauuggghhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Got to say, you are a sight for sore eyes, there, Charon! So, uh... looks like you're selling, is that it? You come to help me out?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Uunngggghhhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey good to see you out here, mate! And looks as though you've got some fine wares up for sale, don't you?

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Urrrnn*gghhhhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Haaahhhhhhhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Fine day to you as well, there, mate! Now let's have a look at your supply, shall we?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You must have a lot of stops around these parts, don't you, Charon mate. Most of the dead are here in Asphodel, correct?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Nnnnrrrrrhhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Charon, I'm in Asphodel now, aren't I? I'd always heard this was some flower-covered meadow type place, not such a... terrifying hellscape.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hhhhaaaaaaahhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Charon. If there happens to be something really horrible awaiting me beyond that door there, then... give me a sign, won't you?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hhhaaaaaaahhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Care to provide me any insight as to just what sort of hideous monstrosity awaits me over on the next infernal island, Charon mate?

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Hheeehhhhhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, look at you, Charon mate, you're looking well! Something's different about you, can't quite put my finger on it. Have you done something with your hair?

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Urrraaauuhggghh*...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Charon mate, wanted to thank you once again for the fine hourglass you gave to me before! It's been very handy with those Wells of yours.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Hheeehhhhhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Charon, you're not angry with me after we had it out last time, are you, I mean... I figured since you gave me one of your Loyalty Cards, must mean everything's fine, but... I'm... just making sure.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Krrr, *krraauuuggghhhh*...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No hard feelings about that whole battle-to-the-death thing last time, right, Charon? Especially since you absolutely demolished me. I was just messing with you, you know that, right?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Nrraaauuuggghhh...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hi Charon! I finally met Hermes, god of swiftness, travel, bringing souls of the departed to your boat. Calls you his professional associate. You and he, you've been working together for a while, haven't you?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrrrrrnnnnghhhhhhhh...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, I always thought Olympians never consorted with chthonic gods such as yourself. But it sounds like Hermes is a close colleague of yours. You wouldn't... happen to know why he's helping me, would you?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Grrrhhhooo*aaaaaahhhh*...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, Hermes told me that the other Olympians are unaware he's lending his support to me. I'm curious to know what's going on. Thinking of asking Nyx. Figured I'd check with you first.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Mmnnn*rraaauuugggghhh*!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon mate, I know you meet an awful lot of dead, and it probably gets very difficult to remember them all, but... I don't suppose the name *Skelly *means anything to you, does it?

Speaker: Charon
Text: ...Ssss... kkkhhh... rrrrnngghhh... *raauuuggghhh*!!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon mate? As a longtime customer, I just wanted to take a moment to thank you again for your invaluable service as a part of my repeated attempts at getting out of here. What would I have done without your wares all these many times? Besides dying a lot faster.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrnngghh, grhhh, *grhaaaaaaaahhhh*...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, mate? Wanted to thank you very, very much for bringing Mother and me home. Your boat's quite comfortable, you know! Though, I suppose you won't be making a habit of giving me a ride, will you?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrrhh*haaaaauuugghhh*...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, as I know you serve the realm, I just wanted to say I look forward to continuing to work with you in a somewhat more official capacity. I'll still be breaking out of here like always, but... well, you've probably heard.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Nnnrrraaaauggghhhh*....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hope you enjoyed the feast with the Olympians, Charon! We didn't have much of a chance to chat, though it looked like you and Hermes were having a good time.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Krrhh, *hrraaaahhh*...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon? Unrelated to anything whatsoever, I just wanted to say... I'm very grateful to have your support. You've always done your own thing... I never get to see you at the House. But I know you care! An awful lot. So, cheers.

Speaker: Charon
Text: ...Khhrraaa *hhaaaaahhhh*...

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrnmmmm....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Khhhrrrrr....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hhrrrrnneehhhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Urrrrrrgggghhh...

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrrnnnhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrreehhh hohhhhhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Nrrrrggghhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrnnaaauugghhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Grrruuuooaahhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Mmmrrnnngghh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Rrraaauuuggghhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hhrrrnn, *haahhhhh*....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Urrrnngggghhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Khhrrrnnnnnnggghh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: Gggrrrnnngggghhhh....

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Heeehhh*, hohhhhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, you've been such a reassuring sight, I thought I'd offer you a token of my gratitude.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Hrrrhhrooooh*, hnnnn....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you don't have to give me something in return, it was a gift! Though, you're insisting, aren't you.

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hohhhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Glad you like it, mate. Thank you for helping me out with your supply. Even if you fleece me with those prices!

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrrnnnn...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You enjoy that, mate! And, when it comes time to reconsider your price structure, hope you think of me!

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Hrrrn*, hhmmm hmmmm....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Enjoy it, Charon mate! Don't go thinking I'm just being kind to get you to lower your prices for me, that would be unconscionable!

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hrrooooohhh....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, I thought you'd say that, Charon mate, but I insist you take it and enjoy, all right?

Speaker: Charon
Text: Hhhrrrrhh... *hhhrrrnnnn*... hrrrrrhhh...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm pleased to have you as a friend as well, Charon. The pleasure's mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Charon, I realize you have a very busy schedule and certainly needn't keep going out of your way for me like this, so here. Just a small token of my appreciation for you. If you ever want to talk, know that I'm here.

Speaker: Charon
Text: *Hrrrnnnnnnnnn*...! Thhhrrrrrrrrnnnnnn... kkrrrrrrrrhhh...!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello, Zagreus. I understand you liberated me from my eternal punishment. And so I have returned to serve your father here. Thanks.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, you're back! Look, don't get on Father's bad side like that and you're going to be fine. Besides... right now I think he's angrier with me.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I grieve for you, my friend. But if you've come to ask me for a song, why, I'm afraid I must stand firm about my answer.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello, Zagreus. I understand you liberated me from my eternal punishment. And so I have returned to serve your father here. Thanks.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, you're back! Look, don't get on Father's bad side like that, and you're going to be fine. I've fought with him enough for all our sakes.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I grieve for you, my friend. But if you've come to ask me for a song, why, I'm afraid I must stand firm about my answer.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello Zagreus. I was just wondering if you had ever heard of any other court musicians who had lost the will to sing? Your father's asked me to explain myself and honestly it has been rather difficult.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If it's any consolation, mate, I'm certain every single undead court musician serving in the throne room of the god of the dead has been through everything you're going through.

Speaker: Orpheus
