Text: It's awfully quiet here, you know, when you're out and about? Makes me a bit self-conscious, truth be told, seeing as ostensibly I'm the musician of this court.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Look, if you decide to start strumming on that lyre again, I'm sure nobody here is going to mind. Though you take care, OK?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello Zagreus. You look a little down. And so I was just wondering, would you perchance fancy a song right now?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, forgive my bluntness here, but I have to ask. Why won't you sing? You were a legend, mate! Our court musician!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, it's that I have lost my muse, my friend. It isn't harder to explain than that. Have you not had such moments in your life, where you had lost the will to chase your passions?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, I suppose I have, yeah. But recently I found my drive again, and that's why I have to get out of here.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: And I am truly happy for you, friend. Alas, I've had no luck in my own search, not that I'm searching any longer, so, I'll just be over here, OK?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Anything I can do to help you find your muse, mate?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I fear my muse is long since lost to me, my friend, though truly thanks for asking. I suppose she must be out there somewhere still, since I once traveled 'cross this land in search of her, and found her then. But that was quite a while back.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you found her? What happened?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Well, this was back when I was still alive, you understand. Your father, why, he doesn't care for anyone to leave this realm, and, basically now I'm stuck here as well! Not seen her since, and, I'm not much for travel anymore.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's... I'm sorry to hear that. Thank you for letting me know. I hope you get to see her again someday.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I appreciate the sentiment, my friend, though please don't worry about her or me. I mean, we're dead! We're fine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mate, if you don't mind, I'd love it if you told me more about your muse.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My muse... never has somebody been as splendorous as my Eurydice...! She was so gentle, yet so stout of heart that it would make yours ache, just thinking on it. She inspired innumerable songs of mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's quite a few. She sounds like she was a real catch all right. I'm sorry for your loss. Thank you for sharing your memory of her with me.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Thank you for listening, my friend. Eurydice, she likewise used to listen to me all the time....

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mate, if you don't mind, I'd love it if you told me more about your muse.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My muse... never has somebody been as splendorous as my Eurydice...! She was so gentle, yet so stout of heart that it would make yours ache, just thinking on it. She inspired innumerable songs of mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice...? I know a... anyway, she must have been a real catch! I'm sorry for your loss. I have to go look into something here.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Thank you for listening, my friend. Eurydice, she likewise used to listen to me all the time....

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I understand you've journeyed well beyond the pits of Tartarus, my friend? Another most heroic feat of yours, and truth be told I find it quite inspiring.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Inspiring enough to... make you want to sing, again?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, that's a rather bold insinuation, Zagreus. I don't know that I've the will for that, I... just, I need some time to think, is that all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It sounds like Father's very cross with you, Orpheus. Won't you consider singing once again? You know his threat of further punishment is not a bluff.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Your father can be.... most persuasive, yes, my friend. However, this time, I am... putting my foot down! I have no plans to sing for him again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well then how about for me? Or for your other friends among the court?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I... no. Please. My muse is gone to me. I can do no such thing.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You seem quite agitated, as of late, my friend. Is anything amiss with you, perhaps?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Oh*! No, I'm all right, Orpheus. Just a lot on my mind is all, sorting out what's next. Stuff I need to work through on my own.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Ah, well, I truly understand. I was reluctant to discuss my long-lost muse, really for quite some time. Well, if you do require some emotional support, know that I likely shall be standing over here...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, Orpheus? I heard from Hermes, messenger and god of travel, and all that? It's odd *I'm *giving you his message in this case, but he says hey! Admires your musical ability, as well.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *Oh*, that was kind of him, my friend! When I first ventured deep into this realm, whilst searching for the soul of my lost muse... after I failed utterly, it was Lord Hermes who whisked her away. It happened so fast. He did an *excellent *job!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I always meant to ask you, Orpheus. Where did you learn to sing like that? Was it really Apollo himself who taught you?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *Oh*, why, I learned from many different sources, Zagreus. That is before all of my inspiration started coming from a single source. I credit my accomplishments to her, and to Apollo, and the gods. And to considerable time spent practicing!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus? I know Father appreciates your songs, to the extent he's capable of appreciating anything. Though, has Nyx ever responded to them? She's always right nearby yet you two don't seem to talk...

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Almighty Nyx appears to tolerate my presence, Zagreus. For she could cast me into everlasting darkness if my song failed to be pleasing to her. She is a most-discerning listener!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Are you the one whom I should thank for this most wondrous music stand, my friend? Why, it is positively splendid, isn't it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Our renowned court musician ought to have the finest means available, I think. I'm pleased you like it, Orpheus. Though, tell me something, how can it play your music when you're not even here?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Who can explain the secret art of Daedalus, my friend? Know only that, whenever it produces music for your listening enjoyment, that the sound you hear is coming from my soul!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: So, I am quite confused, I must admit, my friend. The Queen Persephone, she is your mother, then? How is it that she came to reside, here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, *erm*... it all started when my father saw her on Olympus, and... they fell madly in love. He swept her off her feet, and brought her here. The Olympians, they got pretty worried when they saw she was gone. But now it's OK! Everything's out in the open.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: But, surely the Queen's mother on Olympus, the great goddess Demeter... surely she would quite like it if she saw her daughter still, from time to time?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, that! Thing is, Mother ate some... pomegranate seeds when she was here. And we have rules about that stuff, you know! It means she cannot leave this place for very long at all. I'm sure Demeter will understand. And unfreeze everything when her daughter's around.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Ah, yes, pomegranate seeds, of course, of course! Though, there is one more subject I don't understand, which is... how *you *fit into all of this. Were you not trying to escape from here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Forget about me, Orpheus! This isn't about me, it's about Mother. What's important is she's here, where she belongs.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I see! I understand. Well, thank you, then, for clearing all that up. It is a splendid tale, I must say, and every part of it makes sense to me, at last.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I've decided I should give this singing thing another shot for now, my friend. I hope you like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is amazing, mate. So does this mean you found your muse?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh no, I never found my muse, my friend. It's just... seeing you carrying on like this time after time, I was reminded I ought to get on with my life, too, such as it is right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I've decided I should give this singing thing another shot for now, my friend. I hope you like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is amazing, mate. You sing quite beautifully, with or without your muse.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: How kind of you. It's just... seeing you carry on like this, time after time, I was reminded that I might as well get on with my existence, too. Such as it is right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I've decided I should give this singing thing another shot for now, my friend. I hope you like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's beautiful, mate. If only Eurydice could hear you right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: How kind of you, my friend. It's just... seeing you carry on like this, time after time, I was reminded I ought to get on with my existence, too. Such as it is right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I became so enthralled with song once more, my friend, that I have been inspired to compose another one. For old time's sake, perhaps.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is amazing, mate. You sing quite beautifully, with or without your muse.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: How kind of you, although... my voice is nothing but the crunch of gravel underfoot compared to hers, which soars as though on wings.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Orpheus? I ever tell you I once single-handedly slew a multi-headed bone hydra within the magma fields of Asphodel without so much as breaking a sweat?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My, that is wonderful to hear, my friend! Another in a litany of such heroic deeds, more noble than the heroes of our verse, and even great Achilles over there!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm glad you think so, mate! These tales of my valorous accomplishments do seem to cheer you up, so, I will keep reporting back once I rack up some more.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus? You know about the time I vanquished seven legions of Bloodless warriors with both hands tied behind my back while hopping on one foot? Lord Poseidon dared me to do it, you know.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, that is a spectacularly vivid tale, Zagreus, and most deserving to be chronicled in song! Would that there were a poet here still willing to commit such deeds to verse.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Orpheus? I take it you know all about the time I burned my father's hands to a crisp the moment I was born? He grasped me by the feet, and they caught fire! And that's why he still wears those fancy rings: to cover up the hideous scar tissue.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: But that is such a splendid tale, Zagreus, deserving to be sung both far and wide, until it turns into the stuff of myth, as deathless as the gods themselves! I'll gladly tell that one about!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus, you've noticed the resemblance between me and Dionysus, haven't you, mate? I'll tell you a little secret but you have to promise not to tell... We're really the same god. I love a good feast, don't I?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: But, Zagreus, that is a striking revelation, the connection you describe. I see it! I can see it now! To think the god of wine and you are intricately linked, it isn't obvious, is it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, there's more to it! A bit grim, really, as I'm a little older than I look. You see, the Titans, they once tore me limb from limb, but then my heart was saved, and that's where Dionysus comes from! That is the connection between us, you understand me, mate?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Your tale stirs my soul, it truly does, my friend. It is a marvel to me that such heroism isn't widely known, and I'm committed to the spread of all such truths.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus, you know I've just been messing with you, with those Dionysus tales, and all that? Just trying to liven things up for us, mate.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, Zagreus! There isn't need for such humility, not when one's deeds of heroism are as great and numerous as yours! It is an honor to have heard such deeds first-hand!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, mate, sometimes I worry that you're taking my tall tales rather seriously. You're not really going about and telling everyone this stuff, are you?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Come now, my friend! I know this is a test of faith! Of course I am committed to the spread of such heroic deeds as yours. And I do so enjoy getting to hear them first!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Orpheus? I figure that you've heard by now about how I bested the Minotaur Asterius, alongside Theseus, the Champion of Elysium, himself? I don't think I even broke a sweat.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I scarce can possibly imagine such a spectacle, my friend! But certainly I shall attempt to try!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, you have to hear this straight from me. I vanquished my own father, on the outskirts of the Temple of Styx. At the surface! I know how this looks, since I'm back here, and so is he. You believe me, don't you?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Of *course *I do, my friend! Though, you must know, your father has requested his relationship to you be kept quite clandestine. You'll understand if I not sing your praises in this case, won't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, sorry to interrupt, it's just... I couldn't help but notice that new ballad that you're playing, there.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Technically, one ought consider it a hymn, my friend! In honor of your numerous travails, prior to your current set of circumstances, which must pale in comparison to all the rigors you've endured to date!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, the thing is... none of the information in your hymn is accurate. It's nonsense. I was just kidding with you, mate! I tried to make that clear. You get so lively when I tell you my tall tales, you know? You're not angry with me, are you...?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Heavens, no, my friend! Your humility is matched only by your perseverance in the face of adversity! May your great deeds live on forever, much like you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Orpheus. You wouldn't happen to know the nymph Eurydice, would you? Tall, woodsy type? I get the impression maybe you know each other.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *What*? Why... yes. I know Eurydice. Or, I once knew her, I should say. Whyever would you ask me such a thing, my friend?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I saw her, mate. In Asphodel. She's doing fine up there! All on her own. The two of you, you used to know each other, then?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: We more than knew each other, Zagreus. We were husband and wife. She was my muse. To think that we are doomed to be apart during our afterlives. Ah, well!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ah, well*? Don't you have a message I could bring to her, if we should meet again? Something like that?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I do not wish to trouble her again, my friend. Speak not to her of me, all right? I have my memory of her; it is enough.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Orpheus. You're not going to believe this. I happened on a certain nymph during my journeys recently. It was Eurydice. Tall, woodsy type?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *What*? Why... truly. I knew Eurydice resided in your father's realm, but... I had not anticipated you would cross her path. You're certain of this, then?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I saw her, mate. In Asphodel. She's doing fine up there! All on her own. You said the two of you were very close, isn't that right?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: We were much more than that, Zagreus. We were husband and wife. She was my muse. To think that we are doomed to be apart during our afterlives. Ah, well!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ah, well*? Don't you have a message I could bring to her, if we should meet again? Something like that?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I do not wish to trouble her again, my friend. Speak not to her of me, all right? I have my memory of her; it is enough.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, I saw Eurydice again. I... couldn't bring myself to do exactly as you asked, I... sort of mentioned you.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You *what*?! Or, what I meant to say was: Oh. Did you perchance get the impression she yet harbors toward me feelings of resentment, and the like?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You seemed to be a bit of a sore subject, yes. What happened to the two of you, if I may ask?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, it's just... I almost saved her soul from this domain, back when I lived and breathed. But in the final moments of my rescue, my faith faltered. She is lost to me forever, now. Though, I'm pleased to hear she isn't lost to you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, I saw Eurydice again. I... couldn't bring myself to do exactly as you asked, I... sort of mentioned you.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You *what*?! Or, what I meant to say was: Oh. Did you perchance get the impression she yet harbors toward me feelings of resentment, and the like?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You seemed to be a bit of a sore subject, yes. You really almost freed her from the Underworld, huh?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Almost, my friend, almost. But in the final moments of my rescue, my faith faltered. She is lost to me forever, now. Though, I'm pleased to hear she isn't lost to you!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Pray tell me something, Zagreus. How is she lately, hm? Eurydice, I mean. Her hair, fall colors, or full bloom? Her poise, as proud and supple as the oak?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She's all right, Orpheus. Seems comfortable within her little place in Asphodel. The only thing that seems to bother her at all is... when I mention you. Is there nothing you can do to patch things up?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Alas, I cannot change the past, my friend. So, no. As you can plainly see by now, I'm dead to her. Rightfully so, at that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But that's just a technicality! I mean, you're here, she's there! So what if you're not breathing anymore, you have all eternity ahead of you. Don't you want to see her again?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Don't I want to see my Eurydice again...? Why, yes. That, more than anything, my friend. Provided she wanted to see me. I tried once to disturb her everlasting rest, as you well know. And that did not pan out as I had hoped....

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: What news of late about Eurydice, my friend? She is as delicate as I described, no doubt? *Ah*, but... I am dwelling on her once again, it seems.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I knew she was a talented musician, mate, but you never let on that she is an amazing chef, as well. She's been hospitable to me each time we've met. Though you still seem to be a bit of a sore subject.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: How very understandable, indeed. Were I to have been failed to be rescued from the depths of hell, mere moments from escape, I too would be quite cross with my attempted rescuer. And for quite some time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, I don't suppose you know how come I keep running into Eurydice in particular out there? For all the shades resting eternally in Asphodel, it seems beyond coincidence I always find the one that's dear to you.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I have no knowledge of the weavings of the Fates, my friend. Perhaps they trample on what used to be my heart for leisure or for sport, do you suppose?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Orpheus, Eurydice told me your songs, some of them came from her? She seems quite brilliant. You choose your muses well!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I owe my everything to my Eurydice. She authored many of my songs, indeed; and she inspired many, many more. Whilst living, we collaborated frequently, you see.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But weren't you the famous one? I don't understand why she doesn't share your renown.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It is but one of life's injustices, I fear. I always sang her praises every chance I had. And she asserted herself splendidly. Yet even still, our listeners believed our songs, they came from me... what else could I have done?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't exactly know the ways of mortals, mate. But I'm pleased to hear you always giving credit where it's due.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, you said that it was one of life's injustices that Eurydice doesn't get her fair share of the credit for the songs she wrote. Isn't there something we can do?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, I don't know, my friend. Once people set their minds to certain things... it can be difficult to show them other possibilities exist. What's to be done?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't know... tell them they're wrong? Politely, perhaps not? Or... tell them what's right. Get the word out about what's right? Can't we do that?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Get the word out...? But I am court musician of this House. My songs no longer reach too many ears. Although... I do suppose all of these shades about... they are my audience, as well. I shall make certain that they know whose songs I sing.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I must confess something to you, my friend. My mind still wanders to Eurydice quite often, and my memories of her. Despite my best attempts to move along with my existence here. I would call it a fatal flaw, except, I am already dead.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't torture yourself, mate. You've been through enough. As has she! You still care for one another just don't have a way to get the point across. But I have an idea.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I, too, once had ideas, Zagreus. --eas, and inspirations. It was so very wonderful, to have a muse...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I got you something, Orpheus. It's a new song. From someone who still cares for you.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My friend, you wrote a song, for me...? Oh, but this is not from you, it's from... *Eurydice*... I, no, I don't know what to say, I... I...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You sing beautifully, mate. If only Eurydice could hear you singing this right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh. Thanks for the sentiment, my friend, it's just... when I sing this song of hers, why, I've this feeling where my heart once was that, well... perhaps she *can*.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Zagreus! The most amazing circumstances have occurred. The terms of my employment, they've been altered such that... I may visit Asphodel sometimes. May visit *her*.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's great! Orpheus, what are you waiting for, mate? Go and find your muse out there! You two have lots to catch up on, I think.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I think you're right. I am so very anxious, I must say. But I must also thank you, for this opportunity, and... for speaking with me all this time. So, how might I repay you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Why is it always talk of payment around here? You're my mate. And your songs have lifted many spirits here, including mine. Now go, and make the most of this, will you?

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus, you're back! How was your trip? I hope it was all right.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It was more than all right, my friend. Why, it was positively inspirational. But I've returned as promised to this House. My love is there, whilst my responsibilities are here.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You sound despondent again, mate. You must wish you were there right now. I'm sorry you had to come all the way back.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, on the contrary, Zagreus. It dawned upon me that having some distance between my responsibilities and my domestic life, why... it is not so bad. Besides, Charon makes travel to and fro quite simple for me, really.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 02
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to ask you something, Orpheus. It seems like everything has been all right for you, except... you don't look very happy to me, mate. Is everything all right? Between you and Eurydice, I mean?

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 02
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, *haha*, but your concern is much appreciated, friend. I feel I am in everlasting bliss. It simply does not show upon my countenance. Perhaps through song is how I best express myself.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Orpheus. You know I'm very happy that things turned out well between you and Eurydice, but... looking back, I think I might have overstepped my bounds with you a bit, and wanted to say I'm sorry.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You're sorry, Zagreus? Whatever for? If not for you, I fear I never would have seen my muse again.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's just... when I met her, and I found out the two of you were having problems, I... well, I just wanted to see you patch things up. But, it wasn't any of my business, and you never asked my help. Neither did she. I could have made things worse.

Description: Orpheus About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: But, you didn't make things worse, my friend. And... truth be told, I do not think I ever would have asked for help, at any point, because... I don't entirely know how. So I am grateful to you, and your generous instinct.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, Orpheus! I heard what must have been a song of yours, it went *something, something, in the blood*, you know that one? It was amazing, mate.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, that one, yes, I know! I mean, it was a favorite, I was told, by those who listened to the music I created with my muse. It was a most productive time, back when we were alive!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Would you ever sing it again?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Orpheus. The keepsake that you gave me... it's come in useful, thanks. I can't quite see what's in the container, though. I shouldn't open it, should I?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: No, Zagreus. Unless of course you wanted to set loose a cherished living memory of mine, and take from me that fleeting bit of joy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Orpheus, the Distant Memory you gave me... it's a bit of your past with Eurydice in there, isn't it. I'm grateful, but... why give me such a precious gift as that?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm glad you like it, Zagreus. Some memories are cherished, yes, indeed. But there can come a point where they provide more benefit to others than ourselves. Don't you agree?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Have you considered doing music-making as a recreational pursuit, my friend? You have such slender hands, why, I believe you'd do quite well at it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Not really been at the top of my list of late, mate, but who knows. It's something I've been meaning to try at some point, I suppose. Thanks for the words of encouragement!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus! I got myself a lyre much like yours, except I'm absolutely miserable when I try to play! Got any advice?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, why, that's splendid, Zagreus. And I can certainly show you a thing or two. First, the proper posture is important, here...

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...now remember to practice the plucking technique which I taught you, and mind your off-hand constantly. And, above all, continue practicing! The joyfulness is in the practicing itself.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Zagreus, I heard your recent lyre-playing from your bedchambers. Let no one lead you to believe it's not a reassuring start.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, come now, mate, I'm terrible and you know it. You pulling one over on me as payback?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm being serious, my friend. It is a challenging pursuit requiring a dedicated state of mind. The progress shall come. You shall discover what I mean.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Your music-playing has improved substantially. Perhaps in time you shall surpass my own abilities!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I highly doubt that, mate, though thanks for noticing. Creating music's quite rewarding once you get the hang of it!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I must commend you on the most splendid lyre-playing emanating from your bedchambers, my friend. It seems we have a second court musician, now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you for encouraging me to give it a shot, mate. And for the kind words.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...You called upon your humble court musician, as I understand, Lord Hades sir? Referring to myself of course?

Speaker: Hades
Text: Well, Orpheus... if you're quite finished with your little stint within the depths of Tartarus, I'd like to ask again: Play us a song, already. Or else next time I'll not be quite so charitable with your punishment.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, that. I must apologize, again, Lord Hades sir. For I'm afraid that I've no wish to sing as yet. In spite of your persuasiveness even. And, that, um, is my final word upon the subject. At this time.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Is that so...? Why, then, I'll go ahead and wait. I've all the patience in the world.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Help me to understand something here, Orpheus. Why do I bother keeping such a worthless shadow of a court musician in my House? You prattle ceaselessly, yet I can't get even a single note out of you?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: If I may be so bold, my lord? Perhaps the merest sight of me still stirs in you a memory of my performances of yore. It gladdens me you used to like my songs.

Speaker: Hades
Text: I used to tolerate your insolence. We're finished here. You find your voice. Immediately! You have one hundred years, and not a moment more.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Finally returned to your senses, haven't you, Orpheus. A court musician who refused to sing! Such nonsense. I trust there shall be no more insubordination from you, moving forward?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm gladdened that my songs yet stir your soul, my lord. But, I have to confess my choice to sing again was motivated largely by the Prince. And by my muse, of course.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Still going on about your so-called muse, I see. You had your chance with Eurydice. You squandered it. And now you're here; a deal is a deal. I expect you to comply with your end of our agreement.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...I'm pleased to know my new, more flexible arrangement remains to your satisfaction, still, my lord. I must admit I feared that my departure would result once more in a protracted stay within the pits of Tartarus.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Don't give me such ideas, Orpheus! Instead, you go about your business, there, and play your blasted songs when circumstances call for it.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I shall be happy to oblige, my lord. Eurydice and I are grateful for your magnanimity.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...You're much too modest, Lord Achilles, for someone with such a number of heroic deeds and glorious decapitations to his name! You ought to be more like ever-boastful Zagreus, and talk it up some more!

Speaker: Achilles
Text: Oh, fear not, Orpheus, I was quite boastful in my day. And would you look at where it got me? Besides, I've not the imagination to come up with tales as tall as those of our Prince Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...Do you miss it, yourself, Lord Achilles, sir? The freshness of the air. The need to have meals several times a day, and such.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: I scarce remember it, my friend. Although your songs do stir up memories, sometimes. I'm used to things the way they are, I think. But you, not so much?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, on the contrary, sir, I am profoundly satisfied. We are most fortunate to have employment even after death. Imagine, merely resting for eternity, when you could work!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...*Ah*, but to think that our esteemed musician of the court is none other than *you*, Orpheus! In matters of music, at least, Hades and I have similar tastes. Anyway, I don't mean to keep you!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I shall be honored to perform my songs, Your Grace. And, might I add, Your Grace bears many of the striking features of your son? I understand now where he gets his charm.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm sorry I've no will for singing, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I feel a bit self-conscious seeing as I must refuse to sing...!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I remain your humble court musician, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm truly pleased to see you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Would that I could aid you in some way, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It's awfully quiet whilst you're not around. Still rather quiet now!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Nice speaking with you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm afraid I haven't much to say on this occasion, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I hope your day or night, I guess, is going nicely, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Please do be careful out there, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I wish I could direct you towards a much more lively court musician.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Normally I'd offer up a song for such occasions, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Be strong out there, my friend, OK?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm cheering for you all the way, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Good luck to you out in that deadly hellscape, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Thank you for checking up on me, my friend, although I'm quite all right.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm still fresh out of songs or will to sing them, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'd ask if you remember what it's like to feel inspired, my friend, but I don't want to know.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, hello, Zagreus....

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I pray the Fates not ruin all your dreams as they did mine!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: May you emerge from all of this unscathed, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I trust your neverending toil in the Underworld is proceeding well, my friend?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I have an optimistic feeling about your next attempt to run away, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: May you yet find your muse somewhere out there, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Each failure brings new opportunities for self-reflection, right, my friend?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Please keep me well apprised of all of your incredible achievements, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It lifts my spirits when we briefly interact, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I pray the Fates not ruin all your dreams as they did mine!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'd best get back to singing, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Let's talk when I'm not singing, Zagreus?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Hello, my friend, let's get back to my song?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm kind of singing at the moment, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Terribly sorry I can't speak with you right now.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I thought I'd lost even the gift of music, Zagreus. So, thanks again for helping find that one for me!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I must say, it's nice having some music in my life again, and hopefully in yours!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: We all could use a little song from time to time, isn't that so?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It's nice that I no longer have to live and breathe, and can be focused purely on my song...!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You rescued me from an eternity of not getting to sing, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I hope your day or night is just as splendid as my own, my friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I pray the Fates fulfill your dreams as they did mine!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, Zagreus, how wonderful to see you once again!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I was just thinking of you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My greetings to my very dearest friend.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I am in concert as perhaps you see, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Begging your pardon, Zagreus, but I'm amid performance at this time!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I'm quite preoccupied with singing all your praises, Zagreus!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: This hymn is dedicated to your deeds, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I cannot talk right now, my friend, for I must sing!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I trust my music brings some lightness to our gloom-filled times, my friend?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: The tale of your birth is so complex, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I ask you please hold your applause until the end!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: To think Lord Dionysus and yourself share such a bond!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: May my performances spread wide your fame, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Your parentage need not be secret any longer, Zagreus!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I shall keep singing of your praises, far and wide!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You've helped inspire me to song, my friend!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I must stay focused on my singing, Zagreus.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I trust my hymn provides some solace to your days or nights?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: My muse writes absolutely wondrous songs, don't you agree?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *Ah*, this reminds me so of my Eurydice...

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Would that I were together with her now...

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: The songs of my Eurydice are without peer...

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: This is a favorite song of mine, and perhaps yours?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, mate, here. I got this for my favorite court musician.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, my, but you can't simply be this kind to me without retaliation on my part, my friend! And so, in turn, I have a gift for you!

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, this is absolutely splendid, Zagreus. Is this really for me? It's so very kind of you to think of me like this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I want you to have it, Orpheus. You've brightened up our lives down here more than you know. I only wish that you could see that.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: *Oh*, why! I'm very much obliged that you have thought of me again, for such a wonderfully thoughtful gift!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's nothing, Orpheus. Thank you for all the inspiration through your song. I love your work, mate.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You're always much too kind, you know, my friend? Now typically I would express my gratitude through song, except, you understand, don't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I understand completely, Orpheus. I think we'll both get through this rough patch in due time.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: You always offer means to quench my thirst, my friend. A wonder that I have such feelings, even now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Now that you've started singing once again, I figured it was thirst-inducing work! Your music stirs so many souls around here, mate.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, mate! What do you say we share this over in the lounge?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, I, certainly, why, I don't see why not. I mean, it's not as though I've got something to do that isn't that.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...And, anyways, I oughtn't have looked back, I mean, the moral of the story is to not look back when you are told not to look back, you understand, don't you, my friend?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't look back, huh. I'll try not to. Though, you can't be blamed for doing it yourself, just the one time. What happened to you... it wasn't fair. If you ask me.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...I quite enjoyed our outing, Zagreus. So, I suppose I shall be seeing you around?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I am indebted to you, Zagreus, both for your friendship and embarrassment of generosity.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And I, in turn, am indebted to you, Orpheus, for your calm demeanor and ability to accept life's greatest challenges. You inspire me, and I wish you the best.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Orpheus, mate! I have something good for you right here... Ambrosia! All the way from the surface. I want you to have it.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Ah, but this is splendid, Zagreus. And I must say, apart from my Eurydice, I've never felt as strong a bond of kinship as with you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Orpheus, you know I once wrested this bottle of Ambrosia from the Champions of Elysium, defeating them two against one, just so I could bring it here to you personally?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Please, my friend! I feel I am undeserving of such a relentless show of kindness on your part. I shall accept, but you'll relent, won't you? As well as forgive me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mate, if that is your wish, then it will be my pleasure to oblige. Though, may this gift symbolize the strength of our friendship for an eternity to come. I've learned so much from you.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Thank you, my friend. Would that I had capacity to take some joy from this.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, Zagreus, how wonderful to see you here. Eurydice and I, we have been catching up for all the time we've spent apart.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah. So, if you would excuse us for a little while, hon? I'm not finished catching up with him just yet. But first, before you go!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I've never heard anything like this. As good as you two sound each on your own, you're positively wonderful together.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: A splendid compliment, my friend. Doubtless the Fates themselves conspired to ensure Eurydice and I would meet, and sing together. Fall in love. And then be cruelly separated for some time!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Now don't you start with that again, you get me, Orphy? Got our whole entire afterlives ahead of us! And lots of songs to catch up on.

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Why, you're correct of course, my dear. If you'll excuse us, Zagreus? Our calling beckons.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, you two, how's everything lately? On speaking terms again? Or singing terms?

Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, things are going very wonderfully, my friend. I never thought I'd see Eurydice again, after I...

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orphy still just can't shut up about that time, hon. But we're making progress. Thanks for having him stop by. I'm sure he needed plenty of encouragement.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice End Theme (1)
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, you're singing *In the Blood *after all, Orpheus! Thank you for taking my request!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice End Theme (1)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Oh, it is certainly my pleasure, Zagreus. This song of Eurydice's and mine, I've a connection to it, I suppose. Reminded me of some fond memories!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (1)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, nice of you to visit us, Your Royal Majesty! For you!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (2)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orphy and I, we're doing great here thanks to you. You take care, hon!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (3)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hope you find yourself someone to sing with, too, hon.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (4)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Don't fret, Your Majesty, I'll have him back to work on time, you hear that, Orphy?

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (5)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orphy and me, we're like your typical old married couple, hon.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (6)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: If you find happiness out there, hon, don't look back.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (7)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Things aren't so bad here, hon. Hope you can say the same.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (8)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What can I say, hon? We like practicing our favorite tune!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (9)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well if it isn't the Hades kid come to pay the both of us a visit!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (10)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: ...You must know, you sound as wonderful as ever, now, my dear!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (11)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Is she not truly wonderful, my friend?

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (12)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: We sing, and sing, and never once grow weary, Zagreus!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (13)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I never thought I would see her again. You are to thank for this, my friend.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (14)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: When we thus sing together, Zagreus, I lose all track of time.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (15)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Is the singing of Eurydice not the most splendid thing that you have ever heard?

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (16)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: Shall there ever be a voice as lovely as Eurydice's, my friend?

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (17)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: It gladdens me that you could join us here, my friend.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (18)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Guess what we've been up to lately, hon? Now if you'll excuse us?

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (19)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: We just finished eating, here! Got plenty left over.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (20)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: The one thing better than singing, hon, is singing with somebody you love.

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (21)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orphy here's just practicing for when he's got to sing next for Hades Senior!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (22)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What do you know, we were just in the middle of a song here, hon!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (23)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Not much luck trying to teach Orphy to cook, but he can sing, all right!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (24)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Look, Orphy, we've got an audience! So sing your heart out!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice Misc Chat (25)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Don't mind Orphy, here, hon. Can't snap him out of it once he gets singing!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (1)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You know this tune, hon? It's one of our old hits!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (2)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: We were just thinking about old times, Orphy and I!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (3)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Thought we'd mix up our singing just a bit here, hon!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (4)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Got to tell you I've warmed up to this old song over the years!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (5)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: I know that you enjoy this one, my friend!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (6)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: This one reminds me of my days alive with my Eurydice...!

Description: Duo - Orpheus and Eurydice In The Blood Chat (7)
Speaker: Orpheus
Text: This song had quite a bit of popularity, one time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Look, I've a reputation to uphold. You get past me again like that, you best go all the way. Now, leave me be, and don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*. The prodigal son returns.... Everyone's saying I went easy on you, Zag.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't worry, Meg. I eventually managed to get home the painful way after all. Though... I managed to get much farther than you'd probably expect.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I expected you to not get past me, yes. Look, I've a reputation to uphold. Don't think you're going to be so lucky next we meet out there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, *uh*, what's that you're drinking, Meg? Anything good?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Whatever it is, it's weak. Enough to be mistaken for your blood.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nice! Well, I'll just leave you to it, then.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'll tear you limb from limb out there next time, you mark my words.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What are your sisters up to these days, Meg? I've not seen them around.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We're stretched a little thin, as you can see. Some kind of war up there meant lots of business here. I'm left to hold the line. And deal with you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What do you want from me, leave me alone. We've nothing to discuss here anymore.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I was just checking up on you, just... let me know if you wanted to talk, for any reason.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I am not interested in having company, especially from you. You stay the hell away while I'm off duty.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I told you to back off.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Excuse me, is there something I can do for you, Prince Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's nothing, I just thought I'd say, that was well fought back there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: There's no returning to the way things used to be, Zag. Now can I offer you some words of advice? Get over yourself. And get ready to die out there next time we meet.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus. Good, I wanted to tell you something. Your victories against me? They don't count for anything.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sounds like you've been giving this a lot of thought, there, Meg. How do you figure?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Nyx's Mirror. You couldn't possibly beat me without its help, or hers.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm not competing with you, Meg. I'm trying to get past you, to the surface.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Call it what you want. You're doing what you have to do. I understand. But you are not stronger than me. You just have more help.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Beaten. By you. Without the help of Nyx's mirror. You humiliated me. And now you've come to rub it in, I guess? Well, go on, then. Not like you can shame me any more.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg, what is it going to take for you to quit treating me like I'm incompetent? Have I not grown even a little since we met? You were supposed to teach me something; what does that make you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*... why don't you raise your voice a little louder so that all the House can hear. Is that what you want? For everyone to know that you're superior to me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're not hearing me, Meg. I know it sounds a little disingenuous considering we keep fighting to the death and all, but... I never meant to hurt you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You give yourself far too much credit, Zagreus. Leave me alone.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Beaten. By you. Without the help of Nyx's mirror. You humiliated me. And now you've come to rub it in, I guess? Well, go on, then. Not like you can shame me any more.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg, that isn't why I'm here, you know that isn't how I am. Why can't you see it? All I've ever wanted was to prove myself to you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*... you think that you can prove yourself to me by winning in a fight?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sometimes I think that I can never really win with you, Meg. If I held back, what would you have thought?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If you think you know me so well, Zagreus, then you ought to know better than to keep this conversation going with me, now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I can't believe it, Zag. I thought for sure that Nyx's mirror was the only reason you could beat me. I knew you'd changed to some extent, but... not this much.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I had to see if I could do it, Meg. I've learned so much from you, I... thought maybe this was a way that I could prove myself to you. And to myself.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Prove yourself, to me...? You must not be as comfortable in your own skin as you let on. I can't decide if I like that about you. Now leave me alone while I give it some thought.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: So, Zagreus. How's it going with that Pact of Punishment you signed? You've made some meaningful improvements to the Underworld.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll fight my way out of this place, or earn it. The Pact is nothing to me other than a way to keep things lively.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You are delusional. I'll never understand you or your father. Anyway, if you're looking for more punishment, you know where to find me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus. I heard Lord Hades served you with a Pact of Punishment. You must be very proud.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, you mean the gigantic infernal contract reserved only for extraordinary circumstances? Yeah, I suppose I'm pleased that Father's gone to all that trouble just for me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, when you're finished being smug about it? Know that all of us are bound by its terms. You can force a lot of things to change if you're not careful.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: A lot of things, such as how you refuse to reason with your positively charming sisters, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: The Extreme Measures condition... you wouldn't dare. Do you have any idea what you're talking about?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, how was it up there, Zagreus? Within Elysium. You'll have to tell us all about it every time the greatest strike you down.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You've never been there, have you? It's... lush? Is that a word? It feels closer to the surface. Closer to the sky.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How poetic. You could have visited as part of your responsibilities. Instead, you trespass. Incurring wrath of fallen champions in service of your father.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: So you cleared out some of the Satyr infestation near the surface, then. How come the change of heart? Not like you to assist Lord Hades in such things.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I wasn't trying to do my father any favors, Meg. Those Satyrs seem to hate me just as much as him. My one way out involves a detour straight into their dens.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: An interesting coincidence. At any rate, that's one less problem for the rest of us to deal with. Until the Satyrs all come back, at least, which won't be long.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You've been through hell more times than you can count by now, haven't you, Zag. You getting used to it? No wonder that you're friends with Sisyphus.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm getting used to it, all right. I'll keep going, for as many chances as it takes. I'll look forward to our next appointment out there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Appointment*. Indeed. Don't keep me waiting. For all your toil, I'm sure you're not even close.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus, please tell me that the rumors are untrue. You really vanquished him? Have you completely lost your mind? You're going to destroy this blasted House!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, Meg, Father had it coming for some time. What's your concern, besides? The House is safe.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: He's not going to take this lying down. He'll find some way to take it out on you. On all of us. You watch yourself, or all of us will pay.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: What are you doing here? I heard you finally made it out. What, did you break out of here, only to die in some pathetic way on the surface?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Long story, but yeah. Boils down to what you said, more or less.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: So you're going back out there, again. Well, it's your business, not mine. For your sake... I hope it's worth it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg, did you... did you ever meet the Queen...? Remember anything about her, at all?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It was not my place to address her. I barely ever saw her. Then, at some point... I never saw her again. And, unlike you, I know better than to get involved in things that are none of my business.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How is it that this place has this secret Queen for I don't know how long, then suddenly she just vanishes, and no one speaks a word of it?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How is she doing, Zagreus? The Queen, I mean. She was... I had admired her.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother... she's doing well, I think. She's in good spirits every time we meet. Happy to let her know you're thinking of her, by the way!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't, it's... it isn't necessary. She doesn't need you telling her about this place. Sounds to me like she is better off without.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Just so I understand. Breaking through everything in your path, taking resources from your father's realm, trying to get through me... all officially part of the job description?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I guess that's right... but, before you ask, I'm not doing it for him.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I didn't think you'd have it in you. To leave this place for good. But I didn't think you'd take responsibility for anything, either. Anyway... we'll just have to kill each other more officially, I guess.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I never thought I'd see the Queen again. I still can't quite believe she's back... and staying? Is that really your doing?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's her doing, not mine. So you know her? Because... you could have told me. About her. Who she was to me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't know her all that well. But I do know Nyx, and I've been bound to secrecy as part of my oath to this House. I flay oathbreakers and liars, Zagreus. Wouldn't do for me to be no better than them, now, would it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, I suppose not. So what does this mean for Nyx, now that she's back? Or for you, for that matter?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: The Queen always gave Nyx her space. Your father, though... I don't know what it'll be like for him, if she decides to stick around this time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: So the Olympians are backing you officially now? Doing their part to help the family business, finally. Lord Hades probably never thought he'd see the day. Night? You know what I mean.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Seems only fair they should help in some capacity. They all work together on the surface, and, let's face it, they're responsible for a good number of shades pouring into this realm. Least they can do is help shore up the whole *'there is no escape' *reputation we've got.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: By making you unfairly stronger by the time you try to get through me?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, Zag? You like things nice and complicated, don't you. Apparently so do I.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If you're asking if I have any regrets about what happened between us, the answer is no. Being with you... any complications there are worth it.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You don't need to tell me. Two rules, if you want to keep this up. First... we set the personal aside when we're out there. I better not hear a soul say I'm going soft on you. And second... keep up this slightly more mature thing you've had going for you recently.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wasn't planning on sliding back into the insensitive nonsense of youth, so I don't think the second thing will be a problem. But the first... can we really just keep killing each other out there like nothing happened?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsk*... Come off it, Zag. Are you really going to act all uncomfortable every time you see me now? More than usual I mean.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, it's just... I felt terrible, turning you away. It's just... I've been so confused lately, and... I trust you. You're someone I can talk to. I guess I'm... afraid to lose that.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't be an idiot, and you won't. We've been through a lot together. Grown, maybe. This particular relationship... it can't die so easily, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I feel like everybody knows about us, Meg. Even Aphrodite, herself, seemed to know we were involved. It's not like I've been going around boasting. You wanted to keep things quiet, didn't you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus. Are you happy with how things are between us now? Or do you have a problem with it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, I could do without the kill-or-be-killed stuff if we're being honest, that part is still a little weird, but otherwise... yes, I mean... I'm happy. You're *you*.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Then, that's enough. Let them say what they want. What does it matter? We're gods. The things they say about us... even other gods... you pay too much attention to it, it'll drive you out of your mind.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But... I know how important your career is to you. This won't create a problem?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We've already crossed that bridge, I think. Stop worrying.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Megaera... you ever been in love with somebody?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...*Hm*. Yes.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Who?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Shut up.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Never in my wildest fantasies did I imagine you'd ever end up on the Featured Houseservant Board, Zagreus. I still can't entirely believe it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Whoa*, back up! Can you elaborate a bit about these wildest fantasies, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm serious. You should be proud. Not arrogantly proud to a fatal fault or anything, but a little bit is all right in a case like this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Got to tell you something, Zagreus. I'm not getting any more used to losing to you like this. I mean... you don't even stop to rub it in. You know how humiliating that is?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you're saying you would feel *less *ashamed about the outcomes of our fights if I were to gloat *more *about beating you? How does that make any sense?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know what doesn't make any sense? That you keep beating me. I must be getting sloppy if I'm that predictable... too bad none of the other wretches I have to deal with put up much of a fight.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You and your sisters really don't get along well, do you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Alecto and Tisiphone and I each have a different outlook, I would say. We've learned mostly to stay out of one another's way.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That doesn't sound like a healthy basis for a relationship between siblings.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Are you lecturing me about healthy relationships with family, Zagreus? Your family, your father's family, is the most broken and corrupted in the history of the entire concept.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Fair point. I... didn't mean to sound like I had any meaningful advice, there, Meg. We're stuck with our bloodlines and our relatives, aren't we.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your family cut their Titan parents into pieces and then scattered them in Tartarus. Remember that when next you tell me about family.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, while it was brutal squaring off against the three of you, I have to say, Meg... I was happy you were with your sisters. Nothing like a common cause for bringing bitter rivals together, right?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You have your Pact of Punishment to thank for our reunion, there. We have to answer to its terms. But my sisters and I, we got on better than I had expected, I will give you that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So you've patched things up, then? Going to start spending more quality time together and all that?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Hm*, let's not get carried away. A work assignment forcing our cooperation is not exactly a big step in the quality of our relationship.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Alecto's really something else. She must have been a real handful, huh?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: My youngest sister takes a lot of pleasure from her work. I've learned something of that from her. But that's as far as we relate, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She could learn a thing or two from you, I'm sure. About having a little common decency, perhaps.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: She won't be learning anything from me. The contempt you get from her is unconditional. I learned not to take it personally.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, so, about Tisiphone, is... *uh*... everything all right with her? Talk of murder, all the time, and all.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Tisiphone is charged with punishing the worst that mortals have to offer. More than charged. Her work is everything to her.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No time for family or recreation, then, I take it? Pity what happens to those overly obsessed with work.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I get what you're insinuating, Zagreus. I'm nothing like her. Not even close. And don't you dare compare the two of us again.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: So you've been trying to give Tisiphone speech lessons between fights to the death. Are you bored, or just naive?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, if her vocabulary consists of two different although admittedly almost identical words, there's got to be room for growth, there. Besides, I feel like... maybe she's lonely, or something. Has anyone ever tried to teach her anything?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Maybe, just maybe, you're projecting your own insecurities onto her a little bit? Tis can take care of herself. Always has. Talking's not her strong suit like it's yours. But if you, in all your wisdom, think you've got something to teach her, you go right ahead.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You've tried already, haven't you? She's pretty dead-set on the murder thing, then?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You and Thanatos don't work together much anymore, do you, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No. Though he still brings me my assignments every now and then.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oathbreakers, traitors, and the like? Sending them straight to Tartarus, huh. Must be quite an experience going from living and breathing, to... being dead, to being whisked off by Thanatos, straight to you and your whip.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If that's not the experience mortals are looking for, they need only keep their oaths and not betray the ones they're closest to. It's not that hard.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're not too broken up about how things ended between you and Hypnos, are you, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm still in a state of shock. I'll have to pick up the pieces somehow, and figure out how to get on with my existence.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You got that court musician to pipe up again. I know *you *can't shut up, but didn't know it was contagious.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, it was all Orpheus, not me. Can't sing like that without a lot of motivation, inner turmoil, who knows what else. Why, don't you like it? This lounge seems better with a little song.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: This lounge is fine. And the singing... not used to it yet.

Description: Megaera About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Megaera
Text: Not seen the court musician sulking over there quite as much lately. Your doing, I hear?

Description: Megaera About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You'll just have to sulk for the both of you, I guess, then, Meg. But if you must know, on my authority I have released Orpheus from the terms of his old, rather unfair agreement with Father, so he can see his wife at least from time to time.

Description: Megaera About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Megaera
Text: And Lord Hades is OK with you just picking out old binding contracts and nullifying them? You're exploiting your status.

Description: Megaera About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm doing no such thing. Father wanted me involved in all this business with his pacts, and presiding over the dead, then fine. But I'll do it my way.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What do you think of all the lounge decor, there, Meg? Looking a little better these days, wouldn't you say?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know, it isn't bad. Though I have heard the strangest thing, that you're responsible, for all of this? I couldn't understand why you would even bother, honestly.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's a popular locale for off-duty Underworld officers to take a load off between shifts, and so I figure... least I can do is pitch in and make the place a little better than I left it, right?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How very selfless of you, Zagreus. Soon doubtless it'll be your portrait hanging on that wall back there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: The prism-sphere in the corner is maybe a little much. But the fireplace... the bat-cage... the aquarium... this lounge is practically comfortable. Lord Hades would strongly disapprove.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Good thing he never sets foot in here, then, huh? Wait, you don't miss when things were all sad and dreary in here, do you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm still getting used to it. But, no.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: How's my little Battie doing, Zag? The one I gave you. Was just a little pup. I figured she'd be better off with you. Please tell me I was right.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Battie's doing great, Meg. Reminds me of you every time I think of her. Helps keep me company throughout my little jaunts outside. So you've a thing for bats, then?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: That's good. And yes, the bats around here, they and I have always shared an understanding, you could say. I usually care for the pups myself. But Battie? She seemed more your style.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg, what's going on with Nyx and Dusa, do you know? I think they've been butting heads a bit lately.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I can't imagine why. Nyx has her under strict orders, yet you keep on stopping by for your little chats. You think she doesn't notice?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What does she care? I talk to everybody around here at least a bit.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It's not my business, Zag. Not even for Dusa. But you watch yourself.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Damn you, Zagreus. She was my friend. And now she's gone.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Who, you mean Dusa? Like I had anything to do with that. It's Nyx you should be cross with, not me!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I don't think so. Nyx warned you. *Ungh*, you know I can't go to her myself about this, so *fix it*!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You saw Dusa's back, right, Meg? She's getting another chance. Nyx reconsidered!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I saw. Nyx doesn't often change her mind when it comes to this House. But I won't second guess what happened or why.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You don't sound all that pleased...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm so proud of Dusa lately, Meg! Chief Custodian of the House, was it? That's quite an honor coming from Nyx.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I thought all the added responsibility would stress Dusa out worse than usual. But she's taking it in stride.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're always looking out for her. Thanks for that.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Not doing it for you. Though... thanks for looking out for her, yourself.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I did not appreciate you sending Dusa after me out there, Zag. You leave her out of this! Though... it was good to see her out of this damned House for a change.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: See, I, too, thought she could use the fresh air. Or... however you'd describe the quality of the air on the edge of Tartarus. You know she'd never mean you any harm, right? In her mind... I think she's trying to keep it friendly between us.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Eugh, she said the same thing to me. Look, you know what, fine. If that's the only way to get her to take a break from this place, I guess it's for the best.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Meg, I understand you're under orders to kill me on sight out there, but... do you really have to go so hard on Sisyphus?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: That wretched shade isn't who you think he is. Do you have any idea of the magnitude of his crimes from when he led a mortal life?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He cheated death. Tricked Thanatos and maybe Father, too.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Before that, he did worse. He was an awful man. I think that is the real reason that your father punished him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What if he's changed? Or... is that impossible. No coming back from certain crimes.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: No coming back from certain crimes, indeed. Though you may have more mercy in your heart to spare than I in mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to ask you for a favor, Meg. And I'm willing to make it worth your while, if you'll hear me out.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: A proposition, Zagreus? Let's hear it, then. While I'm in a charitable mood.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's about Sisyphus. If I can get my father to alleviate his sentence, would you just... ease off of him, a little bit? You and your sisters. I think he's suffered quite enough under your whips.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I don't know what you see in him, I swear. But you don't need to ask such things of me. If you can overturn his sentence with Lord Hades, I'd like nothing better than to never see that miserable shade again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Megaera, I have to ask you something, please. We really need to talk.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...For once, I think you're right. Although, I'm curious, what is it that you think we have to talk about?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I still have feelings for you. At least... I think I do. Isn't there... isn't there someway for us to, you know... work through all of this?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: In spite of everything that's happened, and that's happening right now? What are the outcomes, Zagreus? Either you eventually succeed, and leave this place, or else, what, exactly?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I haven't thought that far ahead. But I don't think it has to be this way. I don't hate you, Meg. I don't think I can ever hate you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Despite my best intentions. Unfortunately, I don't know that I can say the same. Look, I'm at a very difficult point in my career. I need to focus on that now. Do we understand each other?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Megaera, I have to ask you something, please. We really need to talk.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...For once, I think you're right. Although, I'm curious, what is it that you think we have to talk about?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I still have feelings for you. At least... I think I do. Isn't there... isn't there someway for us to, you know... work through all of this?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: In spite of everything that's happened, and that's happening right now? What are the outcomes, Zagreus? What, exactly?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I haven't thought that far ahead. But I don't think it has to be this way. I don't hate you, Meg. I don't think I can ever hate you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Despite my best intentions. Unfortunately, I don't know that I can say the same. Look, I'm at a very difficult point in my career. I need to focus on that now. Do we understand each other?

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Meg, you know what's going on with Than and me, don't you? I just... want things to be out in the open, between us.

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh I know everything about you, Zag. And Thanatos, maybe even better. Though I appreciate you telling me. It's fine.

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's fine? I mean... upon Olympus, jealousy runs rampant, as I'm told. But here it's not even an issue, then?

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Megaera
Text: If you prefer the way they do things on Olympus, then I think you know the way. As for me... dealing with jealousy is what I do. Tell me, should I feel threatened by Thanatos?

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No... he thinks so highly of you, he... he'd never wish to cause you any harm.

Description: Megaera About Being Close With Thanatos 01
Speaker: Megaera
Text: And I feel much the same. He and I, we're not the same to you. I think we both see that, and understand. Now quit your second-guessing me, all right?

Speaker: Hades
Text: ...Make certain of it, Megaera. I am finding, lately, that the help within this House is much more lacking than it used to be. I trust that you shall set it back on course.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...If that is your will, Lord Hades, then it will be done. To the fullest limits of my capability.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Give me another chance, Lord Hades. I can do better. Don't... bring them here.

Speaker: Hades
Text: It is already too late for that, Megaera. They have been notified and are en route to Tartarus even as we speak.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know what they're like. They are best left to their specific tasks. Not this.

Speaker: Hades
Text: Megaera, trust me when I say I know the feeling all too well. However, surely, in your ingenuity, you may yet find a way to get your sisters to see eye to eye.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I cannot work with them, Lord Hades. Please. They don't respect my words, or even listen.

Speaker: Hades
Text: *Enough*! Besides, Megaera, this is not your failing. It is mine. I must attend to these affairs more actively.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I've often tried, but never to a satisfactory result. You're asking the impossible of me.

Speaker: Hades
Text: I am not asking, Megaera.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...But, I don't understand, Lord Hades. I have fallen to him countless times. How can this be...?

Speaker: Hades
Text: You and your sisters have protected Tartarus unerringly. The Prince has proven uncontainable. The fault is mine, not yours. Your duty to this realm must be commended.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You honor me... I have done nothing to deserve this. There must be something more that I can do?

Speaker: Hades
Text: There is, and isn't, Megaera. I ask only that you remain committed to this realm. Bar passage in and out of Tartarus. And, if the Prince continues to show up... you give him hell.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Lord Hades, it will be my pleasure, sir.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...We each have our commitments to this House, Megaera. There is no shame in yours. And whilst your sisters are away, you bear their burden of responsibility, as well.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I understand, it's just... am I supposed to keep pretending nothing's changed? This House is cracking at the seams, and no one's going to admit it?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: The House shall stand eternally, although in what condition, it is ours to decide. Our obligation is to keep the House in order.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I know. You're right of course, you're right... I'll do my best. I'll do my best for both our sakes, Nyx.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: ...and so, who else is there to be depended on...? You are a trusted overseer, Megaera. Your station is no accident and there is no one better fit for what you do. I urge you to look inwardly. How you approach your work is vital to the end result.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Thank you for the advice, Nyx. I don't know what I'd do without you. Or what this House would be if not for you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...But, how can you do this to me? Blast your Mirror. By taking sides with him, you're standing against me...!

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Neutrality ceases to be an option when a crisis rises to a certain point, Megaera. You, yourself, shall have to choose allegiances. I have steadfastly told you this throughout our shared ordeal.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I thought that both of our allegiances were to this House, Nyx. It seems I was mistaken. Do you have any idea what sort of pressure I am under here...?

Speaker: Nyx
Text: Use caution with the tone you take with me, Overseer. I am the mother of the Fates, themselves. I do not act by whim or by mistake. Mind your own station, and perform your role. All shall unfold eventually as it must. I like the intervening time no more than you.

Speaker: Megaera
