Text: ...Nyx, you'd tell me if I made a terrible mistake, or even just a bad one, wouldn't you? I need your guidance on this one, or maybe your approval.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: You shall always be the best determiner of what is right about such matters, Megaera. Though, if you seek my blessings or encouragement in this particular pursuit, please rest assured... you have them both. You know the way, from here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I hope that you are right. You always have been, it's just that... I wish I had your confidence in this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I think I understand, now, Nyx. You've been here longer than the rest of us combined. You've seen this House go through a lot. Even before Lord Hades took his place. I never should have doubted you.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: To doubt is an important instinct, Megaera. Without it, we could not conceive of better circumstances than the ones we know. Besides... I am the Night. Others shall always doubt me. You may doubt me again. I ask only that you heed well your intuitions, from now on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I will. I promise, Nyx. And if there's anything you ever need that I can do, well... please, just ask of me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...They can't be reasoned with, Nyx. You know that. What use are they to us, trying to manage this? They'll make things worse.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: They are your sisters. They are part of your life, whether you like it or not. Your relationship with them is yours to mold.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm afraid there isn't much for me to work with. You have a lot more faith in them than I do.

Speaker: Nyx
Text: I have a lot more faith in *you*, Megaera. There are many obstinate personalities with whom we regularly interact. Thus, we do what is possible.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...Would you look at that, Hypnos. Care to repeat to me the unsolicited advice you just now offered, now that Zagreus is here?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, *hahaha*, well, it is my custom to give pointers to our visitors, who come involuntarily, because, I do pick up a lot of bits and pieces, talking here to everyone! About, you know... dying?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus. He told me that I ought to evade more of your attacks next time. So you just watch your back out there, because I know your secrets thanks to Hypnos here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...I think that I can find the lounge well on my own, Hypnos. Or... wait... what is this, did you just ask me out?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Me? No, *nonononono*, no! I'd never even think to do that, Miss, I mean, you have your station, and I have mine. We're from two different worlds, you could say. Fated never to be seen together much.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Every time I talk to you, you somehow take it as a compliment, is that correct? Then, let me give *you *some advice, for once. Stop being an idiot.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...You haven't greeted me as often lately, Hypnos. I wouldn't have noticed if it weren't half your job. If there's something you wish to say to me, why not just come right out.

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, um, well, I, see, the thing is, Megaera, Miss Megaera, mind if I call you that? As I was saying, I just, thought maybe, you know, we had a thing, a real connection, lately, since you keep on dying more and more, and I keep standing here? But then... I always thought you were invincible...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I see. And so you're realizing now that your entire image of me came from your imagination, is that it?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Well, it's just! I really thought with all my advice that you'd go back to killing Zagreus, rather than the other way around! I just don't think things are working out the way I hoped, you know?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It almost sounds as though you've broken up with me, except... well, are you sure that you'll be all right?

Speaker: Hypnos
Text: Oh, yeah! Look, I'm just glad it's one of you two, sure beats having to greet shades nonstop! They never talk to me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: All right, then... you greet me next I'm here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...It was my duty to prevent him from getting farther. If I succeeded... he never would have found you. So this once, I'm glad I failed. I hope you know that, my Queen.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I hoped, but did not know for certain till I heard from you just now, Overseer Megaera! And, if I may? I understand you have achieved an awful lot since I took my, *erm*, leave of absence from this House. I see why Nyx and Hades put their trust in you!

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Thank you, my Queen. Then, if there's anything else that I can do to help you reacclimate yourself, I'm always at your service. You are most welcome, here.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Likewise, you be sure to let me know if my son there happens to make more trouble for you than you welcome in your life. All right?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Can't you see I'm busy now with more important things than you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: May I help you somehow, Zagreus? Because if not, why don't you leave me be.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Do I look like I'm in the mood to chat?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You've come to gloat, I guess? Too bad I can't just kill you where you stand, within this blasted House.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Have I somehow created the impression that I wish to speak with you? Because if so, there's been a terrible mistake.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: There must be someone else whose time you could be wasting, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It's embarrassing enough having returned here, much less to be seen talking to you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Sooner or later when we meet out there again, I'll kill you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If I have something I decide I wish to tell you, Zagreus, I'll make it clear. Leave me alone.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your father's absolutely right about you, Zag. You are and always will be an insufferable brat.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't test me any further, Zagreus. You know the rules, no violence in the House.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Blood and darkness, leave me be, damn you. I've better things to do than occupy your time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I have to hand it to you, Zag. You've gotten strong. Sending me all the way back here like this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Nyx must be worried, seeing us like this. Lately always at each other's throats.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Oh don't worry, I'll be back in fighting shape in no time, Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Your father's not been very pleased with my performance lately as you might have guessed.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Sometimes, Zagreus, I'm almost not detested by the sight and smell of you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I shouldn't be back here right now. No thanks to you, of course.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm keeping careful track of all the times you've sent me home like this.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: At least the House seems well enough in order since I saw it last.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: We keep on running into one another lately, don't we Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You got me fair and square last time. Though I'm a little bitter anyway.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know we can't be seen together like this, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I should be whipping Sisyphus' lazy hide right now instead of standing here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't like having to come back here quite this often, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'm not even remotely interested in chatting with you, Zagreus.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Why don't you go get out of here if you despise this place so much?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't you so much as dare talk to me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Get out of my sight, Zagreus. And be thankful violence is prohibited in here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Right now I wouldn't talk to me if I were you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I think you'd best be on your way right now, you understand me, Zagreus?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I think you've wasted quite enough of both our time, don't you?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Whatever's on your mind, believe me, it's the last thing that I want to hear right now.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I can't believe you got me like that, Zag. I'm going to get you back.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Just here licking my wounds until we meet again out there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Heard you made it pretty far last time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You almost got there last time, didn't you.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Heard you made it all the way last time.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You're back. Got all the way to the surface back there, huh?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Keep letting down my guard against you, Zag.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Went all the way to the top last time, huh? Not bad at all.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Ugh*, I don't remember the last time I beat you, Zag...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Break's just about over. See you out there?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Hypnos give you any good pointers lately?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Taking a break from putting up with Alecto out there...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Got to say, I like what you and Dusa did with this place.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Didn't rough you up too bad last time, did I?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You showed Alecto again. She must be so mad.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: About ready to go another round with me out there?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I have to speak with you in private, Zagreus. Urgently.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: It's fortunate that matter is resolved. I'll see you out there, then.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Let's go someplace a little quieter than this. Where we can concentrate.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: A little peace and quiet's good from time to time, don't you agree?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Don't even say a word, and follow me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well, Zagreus? Take care until we meet again, I guess.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Zagreus, did you forget about our private tutoring, again? Come on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: There. I take it you'll remember what I've taught you, hm?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Come with me, Zagreus. Your chambers are past due for a routine inspection.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Well! Seems everything's in order. Carry on.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: If you're available right now, I have some parchmentwork that needs review.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Hmm. Less parchmentwork than I expected. Well, thank you for your time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, *uh*, Meg? Look, I know you're just doing your job out there, and, anyway, found this, thought of you and all that, so... here.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I... I'll see to it this contraband is put away at once. Now, take your finder's fee and go about your business.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, Meg! I, *uh*, thought I'd better hand this over.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I'll confiscate that if you really want. Although, I'm warning you, I'm not susceptible to bribes. Many have tried.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey I'm just handing over contraband to the appropriate authorities, think nothing of it, Meg. Just doing our jobs, right?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*. You're serious. You're really giving that to me. I mean, I'll take it off your hands if that is really what you want.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's really what I want. And, I sincerely hope we can move past our differences. Not that turning in this contraband has anything to do with that.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Such gifts won't stay my whip when next we meet out there, you realize that, right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I realize it. And I hope you never change, Meg.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Flattery won't get you anywhere. We can't go back to how things used to be.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Flattery never got me anywhere with you to begin with, Meg. Doesn't mean I won't keep trying. I am ever stubborn, aren't I.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Got you some more of that contraband you like. Don't suppose I could help you put it away or anything...?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Look at me, Zag.... You think that all these gifts will make things go back to the way they were? They won't. It isn't possible. We may be immortals but we're older now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'd hope we're wiser, too.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Ambrosia... you know the penalty for attempting to sway an Overseer of the House of Hades with foreign contraband, don't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I can't entirely say I do, though if it involves lashings and whatnot, I already get more than my share of that, so... figured I would take the risk. So what do you say?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I say hand over the damn bottle. I'll see that it's disposed of properly. Now as for you... you wouldn't know who misplaced something like this, would you? On my authority as Overseer... hang onto it. Though if you tell so much as anyone...!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I had this awful contraband I wanted to turn in as soon as possible, if you don't mind taking it from me, Meg.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Tsch*... you still have no idea how to be up front with me, do you, Zag. Why don't you tell me why you're here, and what you want.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*... so the whole contraband thing, you aren't buying it, I guess? Although I see you took the bottle there, now, anyway... I wanted just to talk to you. And patch things up, maybe.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Patch things up*. What is it, by your estimation, that could use repairs, between the two of us, *hm*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... I was naive. I tried not to get too close, but then I did, and said a lot of stupid things, and then... well, we've since tried to kill each other lots of times, there's that. Look, I am sorry, Meg.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You said a lot of stupid things, all right. And we Furies, we're not much for forgiveness or apologies. But... I can see you're making an attempt. Now, thank you for the contraband. Good-bye.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Here, Meg. Contraband. I wish I could do over how we started.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: I, too, wish for a lot of things. Unfortunately there's no unraveling the Fates' patterns. We can learn from our mistakes or keep repeating them. That's it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What if I've learned from my mistakes? Have I ever done anything to hurt you since we've been like this? Discounting the unavoidable and frequent fights to the death.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: There's nothing you can do to hurt me, Zag. It's just a question of whether you're worth my time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well... am I worth your time, then, Meg?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You know... let me get back to you on that. I need a little time to think it through.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Meg, you're off duty, aren't you? Look, I was just... hoping you might want to split this with me, best stuff I could find out there, and I would give it all to you, it's just... maybe you wouldn't mind some company. From me.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: You sound a little tongue-tied, Zagreus. Just like you always used to around me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're not exactly easy to approach, you know. So... how about it, then? Care for a drink with me?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Open it up, and we can go from there.

Speaker: Megaera
Text: ...You should have seen the look on your face. You act a lot more confidently now. Though, I think, deep down, you are still that inexperienced little godling that you used to be.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And I think, deep down, you are not the heartless harbinger of retribution that you want for everyone to think you are. But I can keep your secret if you're willing to keep mine, what do you say?

Speaker: Megaera
Text: Tsch... that sounds an awful lot like blackmail, Zagreus. You'd stoop to that, with me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, I... I was just, that's not what I meant at all...

Speaker: Megaera
Text: *Hahaha*, I just want to see you squirm. Thanks for the company and for the drink. Guess I'll be seeing you around.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey, Prince Z. Must look like I'm slacking off with the old boulder, here, but... I was just getting back on my feet. The Fury Sisters don't often leave me be. Where'd they go, anyway? And... what are you doing here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you know, just out on a little stroll is all. Do me a favor, though, you see the Fury Sisters, let them know I was headed down the way I came from, will you...?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh I'll let them know, all right, I hear you loud and clear, Your Highness. I'll just go about my business now, and you take care.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You know, Prince Z., I'd not expected to run into you again, not after all this time. Something amiss down in the House, or what? Not had much company of late, is all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, something's just about always amiss back home, sir. Figured it couldn't hurt to check up on things in Tartarus a bit more frequently.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well I am grateful for it, I and the old boulder there, in turn. I'm used to going lengthy stretches on my own, but having visitors from time to time would do me well!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: If I may be so bold, Your Highness, I was wondering... what brings you back around this way again? Same story as last time?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Look, I have to level with you, Sisyphus. I'm leaving the House. I've had quite enough. You understand, I'm sure. I'm going to the surface.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: *Whew*, that is quite an undertaking, Prince. If it wasn't you yourself proposing it, I'd like to call it madness, truth be told. Though you're just mad enough to pull it off! Well hey, I hope you make it. Good fortune out there!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey Prince how goes the old escape plan, any luck?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know it's been all right, all things considered. Dying now and then, and it's been hard, but hey, what can you do.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Ah, well, keep your chin up. Me, why I quit trying to get out of here a while back, but, if I was a fire-stepping youngster like yourself, perhaps I would have stuck to it.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey, Your Highness, anything the matter, or just passing through? Happy that we get to chat like this of late, of course.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, don't take this the wrong way, but... why are you helping me? My father's stuck you here for an eternity of torment and even still, you greet me with a smile, time after time.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: *Hah*! Come now, Prince Z., that's just the way I am! Besides, you're not your father, thank the gods! You always seemed a decent lad to me, and if you're saying you want out of here, why, I suppose I can relate, is all.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You know, Prince, it's been good not having to see those Fury Sisters quite as much lately. The main one, what's her name, she's on your case now, isn't she.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You mean Megaera. She's on my case all right. Under strict orders not to let me out of Tartarus. I guess that means you've got yourself a break! About damn time they gave one to you, sir.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, quick question, Sisyphus, you seen the other Fury Sisters lately?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Not seen the other Fury Sisters in some time now that you mention it! Just Megaera, the kindly one, and she is quite a handful on her own. I'll keep an eye out for the other two!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, how can you stand it, being here like this? You always seem in such good spirits, though.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You push old Bouldy here sufficient times, and you might get a different outlook on things, too. With the Furies all preoccupied and with my running into you from time to time, I'm positively doing great lately. I like to take what pleasures I can get!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Look here, Bouldy, Prince Z. himself has come to visit us!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Does Bouldy really keep you company? Personally I would resent a giant boulder that keeps tumbling back down a hill after I push it all the way up there.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, Bouldy's not so bad, I mean, he's a good listener, a good shoulder to lean on, doesn't wield a whip... I rightly can't complain! Good having company down here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know I was just thinking, sir... sometimes I am a little envious of you and Bouldy there. You seem to have things pretty figured out. I still grow frustrated with myself quite often and don't always know whom to turn to.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, *hah*! Well, I just think you're in a tough spot lately, Prince. But you'll get through! As for old Bouldy, why, by all means do not hesitate to lay your troubles on him if you like! Dumped all of mine on him a while back.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So I can just... walk up and talk to him, and chat? That's all it takes?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: That's truly all it takes to make a friend sometimes, indeed, Highness. Now, here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to thank you, Sisyphus, not just for all the help you've given me time after time, but for encouraging me to have a chat with Bouldy there. I daresay I feel a little more at peace of late, and maybe it's thanks to him.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: He's a good one, all right, isn't he? Though if you've come to such an understanding with old Bouldy there, why, it must mean you've done some growing on your own as well, I think.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey, Your Highness, good, old Bouldy there had several things he wanted to tell you.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey Prince, ah, so... you do know Bouldy's just a plain old rock with a few lines chiseled into him, resembling a face, don't you? Chiseled into *it*, I mean. Just so you don't get the wrong idea...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You ever meet Alecto, Sisyphus? The Fury Megaera's nastier sister. We recently became acquainted, she and I.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Ah, fortunately I've not seen too much of her, myself, Prince Z. And based on everything that I have seen and heard, I'd like to keep it that way for a while! I hope she doesn't cause you too much trouble there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, have you had run-ins with Tisiphone the Fury here before? She isn't much for conversation, I don't think.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Tisiphone. Why, yes, I have, in fact, Prince Z. She's visited on multiple occasions, truth be told. So she is back, is she?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She is. Although, I think she's back to deal with me. I'll have to keep her plenty busy just in case.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Appreciate it, Prince. Of all the Fury Sisters, she's the one I would least care to see. But if she does stop by, you know, that's how it goes.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Look, Prince, I don't hold grudges, you know that. Push this boulder long as I have, you move past the petty stuff. So, just want you to know, in case you make it out this time, it's been a real pleasure.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Feeling's mutual, sir. Someday you'll have to tell me all about how you tricked Father. I might learn a thing or two.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Say, tell me something, Prince, if you don't mind. How come you're so intent on getting out of here? I mean, what happens when you do?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, you ever lose somebody dear to you? There's someone out there whom I need to find. That's... all that I can say right now.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I get it, Highness, and I didn't mean to pry, it's just... I can't remember what it's like to want something so bad, you know? Whoever's out there, I hope you find them soon.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey sir, I've always wondered, what were you like back when you were alive? Were you always this wise?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Might surprise you, Highness, I've a bit of royalty in me, myself. Not on your level, mind, but I was very much a king. Though I'll be honest, I... I wasn't much of a good man.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Huh*! I thought I sensed the royalty in you! Although, I can't imagine you as anything besides the gentleman I know you for, my friend.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well that is awful kind of you to say. Though, I would like to think my punishment here wasn't without warrant. At least I've had a lot of time to think it through!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Sisyphus, you mind my asking what you did to warrant this particular arrangement you've got here? Pushing a boulder till the end of time and all. Never heard it in your own words.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, it's a bit of a long story, Prince. My time had come, though I just wasn't ready, you might say. Your father thought he had me in his clutches, but then, *shoom*! I gave him the slip. Your father's henchman, Thanatos, he'll back me up on that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Outsmarted Thanatos, that's amazing... what happened then?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Turns out your father doesn't like us mortals cheating death. Eventually they found me, so, now I'm stuck here with my boulder friend. I push old Bouldy up the hill to the beat of the Furies' whips, then he tumbles down, and then we go again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So then, you're stuck forever, no reprieve. That's terrible... wish there was something I could do to help.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You save those sympathies for someone else, Your Highness! I could be Prometheus, spending an eternity having my liver gobbled up, but instead I get to stay in shape, and have these chats with you. Now I'd better get back to it!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, I've meant to ask, where are you getting all this stuff you give to me? You must be pretty well connected around here.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, well, you know! I have acquaintances amongst the locals here, try to be neighborly with everyone is all. It's not just Bouldy and myself as you can see. Sometimes I come across things that'd be better off in other hands than mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to tell you, Sisyphus. Sometimes I wish I knew more about your past. You must have been a great king.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, *ah-hah*, the thing is that I wasn't, Highness. And that's not modesty from me, all right? All behind me, now. And I'd appreciate it if we left it at that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I hear you, sir. Though, whatever you did in your mortal days... you've since more than paid for it, I'm sure.... Wait, is that why you're still here, in Tartarus? Because you think you deserve this?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: It's more like... this is where I belong. Where my path has taken me, you know? Here in the Underworld, you can't entirely escape your past... and yet, it's like you get another life to live. With all the wisdom that you picked up along the way.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You know, Prince Z., you really have a look about you that you know exactly where you're going, as of late. I used to think you weren't near as comfortable in your own skin.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you were right. I was never comfortable performing Father's routine Tartarus inspections. Though those responsibilities of mine didn't last long.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Nor did we have much opportunity to chat back then, but hey! You always struck me as a decent sort. Wasn't accustomed to your father's henchpeople greeting me with a smile.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, I know you tend to be in remarkably good spirits, all things considered, but there must be something I can do to help with your predicament, isn't there?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, come now, Prince, do Bouldy and I look like we could use your charity? We're planning to stay put within this chamber for a while. It's hardly a predicament, I'd say.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But, what of the Furies and their torments and all that? They might be back and make all this more difficult for you.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Ah, yes, the Fury Sisters, well. I wouldn't mind seeing them more infrequently now that you mention it, but either way! So don't you even worry about me. Now, here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have good news, sir! I located the contract binding you, and bought it out. It's null and void. You're free to go!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh! Indeed, then, does this mean, Prince, then... the Fury Sisters, they won't come around as often anymore?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Not just that, Sisyphus! You can make your way someplace else, where other decent shades reside! You know, somewhere with fewer chains and torture devices and such?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You're much too kind to this old soul, Prince Z. The thing is, this is home. For me and Bouldy, it is what it is. Though, knowing that the Furies won't be visiting with quite their former regularity, that is a load off. Heavier than Bouldy, there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You mean you're really going to stay? Even though you don't have to?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Is that so odd, Highness? Don't see myself lugging old Bouldy out of here, besides! And if I were to leave, why, we would not be having these exchanges now and then. I happen to enjoy them quite a bit! Now, here you go, and thank you, very much.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Must say, Prince Z., the free life sure does have its perks down here! This place really isn't as bad as it's cracked up to be.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Glad to hear it, sir. But you're still here... the same as ever. Is it really all that different from the way it always was?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, it used to be I'd have to start heaving Bouldy there at any point, if the Fury Sisters decided to show up. But now? I just get to relax, chat a bit with the other shades, and give you one of these when you're in the area!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Ah, there you are, Prince! I was just thinking about how grateful I am that you got me out of that contract with your father. It's been a real weight off my shoulders, truth be told.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You never seemed particularly concerned even before, sir. Must say you're very good at hiding your worries.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: And I could say the same to you! Look, I know you were concerned for my wellbeing. Now you don't have to be. And I'll still be around to help you out. Good feeling, isn't it?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You must have seen everything there is to see here in your father's Underworld, haven't you, Prince? I figure that there isn't any place nicer than this!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh! Well, I suppose now that you're free, you could always see for yourself? It's pretty different as soon as you reach Asphodel. Don't you have someplace or somebody you'd like to see?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I'll take what's coming to me right here, thank you very much. You're the wayfaring sort, but my wayfaring days are over. It's hard to explain, but... this is a much-needed fresh start for me.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I will have you know, Prince, that your visits here have become a very important part of my routine!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And what routine is that, exactly, sir?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Why, the routine of looking forward, of course! I try to appreciate the moment as much as anybody, but you know? It's always nice having something to look forward to. So, see you next time, then?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I heard straight from the source the Fury Megaera's been giving you a time, there, hasn't she. Trust me I know the feeling, so, I'm grateful that you're here and that she's not. You give her hell for me next time, won't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh I'll get her for the both of us one of these days. Nights? Whenever.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey Prince, I heard you showed that Fury Sister the what-for, is that the truth? Might explain why I've been left here to my own devices for a change.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't think she'll be out of commission for very long. She'd best find you minding that boulder, though at least you managed to catch a break for now. Be seeing you, Sisyphus.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Now you be careful out there, Highness. The kindly Megaera is out for blood. She kept on groaning 'bout the last exchange between the two of you. You must have showed her good!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think I might have gotten lucky.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 01
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey, Prince Z., I heard the strangest rumor, here's the thing, I'll give it to you straight. I have heard you've been consorting both with Megaera the Fury and with that old stiff, Thanatos, can you believe it?

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, I don't know where you heard that, but... it's true. They're... they're just doing their jobs, and I... I know how it looks, but... you're my friend, as well, and I don't want you to forget that.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 01
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I... look, I do appreciate the sentiment, Your Highness, I'm just surprised. I thought we shared a common foe in them, is all. What can I say, I hope that someday I can see them how you see them.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you for understanding, sir. Besides... maybe I can get them to cut you some slack.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 02
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, I have to be up front with you. The Fury Megaera and Thanatos... I know you're not exactly on the best of terms with either one of them. But they're both close to me. You won't hold it against me, sir, will you?

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 02
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Look, Prince, it's not for me to judge you, or your friends. The Fury Sisters, Master Thanatos... we got off on the wrong foot, you could say. My fault, entirely. I'd sooner make sure that our correspondence here doesn't make those relationships more difficult.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 02
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't even say that, sir. I think Meg and Than know me better than that by now. Well, thanks for understanding, as always.

Description: Sisyphus Meeting About Meg And Thanatos 02
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Certainly, Highness. And who knows? Perhaps as you spend more time together, some of your finer qualities will rub off on those two!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: How goes it with old Master Thanatos of late, Prince Z.? Is he at least less stern with you than with the poor mortals he's sent to take in here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, Thanatos is doing all right. Much like my father, I think he feels he has some sort of fearsome reputation to uphold. Or maybe he's perpetually stressed over his work. But he's been well lately.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: That's good, I guess! Always appreciated that he ultimately took me in, rather than having to show up here through much more sudden, much more painful means. Didn't stop me from trying to avoid the trip, of course.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Word is you've caused quite the hubbub in Elysium, Prince Z.! Making the champion up there really work for it, I hear?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You could say that, I guess! Apparently word gets around. That Theseus, though... he doesn't care for me one bit, let me tell you!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I bet he'd like you better if you were a regular pushover! Ah, well, he'll learn, I'm sure.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince, you've been gone for quite a while, why... I heard-tell you made it all the way outside! And I believed it for a while there, yet here you are. What happened, might I ask?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I made it out of here, indeed, sir. I always said that I was leaving, but... turns out there was good reason for me to come back. Not the least of which is visiting my friends from time to time.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, I am certainly delighted to hear that! So long as you achieved what you set out to do. But, what brings you back again this way? More than a social visit I presume.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're right. I'm back because... I'm leaving once again. Something I have to do if I get up there, though I should be back before long either way, I guess.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Going to try and make it out of here again and again, is it? Well they say repetition is the key to mastery, Prince Z. Now here, I'll send you on your way.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: So, how do you like the surface, hey, Prince Z.? Now that you've finally had a chance to see it for yourself. Not too bad, I hope?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It takes some getting used to, that's for sure. I'm not sure I'll ever grow completely accustomed to it. Do you miss it, sir?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, you know. I still have almost everything that matters, and the rest? It makes for precious memories I didn't have up there.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: So, all this time, Prince, when you were battling up to the surface, and all that... you were searching for *her*, weren't you? The Queen?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I was. Although, between us, sir, it's important that you keep that one a secret, please. Did... you happen to meet her, ever?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, just the one time, briefly, when your father decided to put me here. And, you have my word, of course. About the... surface stuff.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince Z., my understanding is the Queen herself is back, is that correct? Moreover, I have heard a truly fascinating rumor about her...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That I'm her son...? It's true, sir. And she's back with us for now, indeed. I think we're all still getting used to it, but... it feels good, having her in my life.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: That's wonderful to hear. I'd always heard good things about that one. No wonder such a quality runs in the family.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Just one thing I don't understand, Prince Z., if you'll indulge me for a moment, here. If everything is all right for you at the House, then... why is it you're fighting to the surface, still?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you know. Wouldn't want Father to get too comfortable thinking this place is foolproof. It has a terrifyingly ominous reputation to uphold! *There is no escape*.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Sure, that makes sense! Well, from a certain point of view. Escape over and over to prove it can't be done! I like that. Well, let's both of us keep at it, then!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Not working yourself *too *hard of late, are you, Prince Z.? Remembering to take some breaks from time to time, and all?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think I'm managing, thanks, sir. Though, back when you pushed Bouldy rather than talked to him... I suppose you didn't have much of a choice, did you?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, it was work, you know? Even your Father has to work. Of course, I've since retired! But it seems you and he like to keep yourselves occupied. Whatever makes you feel content.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Say, that's my Shattered Shackle on your person, right, Prince Z.? I'd recognize that clunky thing from anywhere. It serving you all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey sir, certainly it's been most welcome having something from you with me at all times. Though has it always held this power? And... how did you remove it to begin with?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Bit of an odd story, that. Involved a well-timed accident with the old boulder there. Though, I'd best not get into it so that you're not accomplice to that little crime. Surely you understand?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: My Shattered Shackle's practically like new, there, Prince! Minus the part where it's still broken, and all that. Nice work!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanks, sir. It's been of help through my repeated treks across this realm, all thanks to you. You sure you don't want it back?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: *Hahahahah*! Absolutely not, though truly I appreciate the sentiment. I'd rather have a look at the old boulder there than a symbol of the time I first got stuck here, when I wasn't doing quite as well.

Description: Sisyphus About About Singers Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Word is that the most beautiful music's been heard up in Asphodel, lately, Prince! From the sound of it, why... I think that has got to be Eurydice and Orpheus!

Description: Sisyphus About About Singers Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You heard correctly, Sisyphus! Orpheus is reunited with his muse, at last. Or at least, he gets to visit on the regular, when he isn't busy at my father's house. So you've heard of them, have you?

Description: Sisyphus About About Singers Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, I've more than heard of them! I'm sure you know how Orpheus once ventured all the way down here, after Eurydice passed on. I'll never forget his song! Even the Fury Sisters gave me a break, they were so captivated by it, then. *Ah*, good times. For me, at least!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince Z., it seems you've brought my little Shady back to visit me! How very kind. And I can tell he's in good care of late.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He is, sir, and I'm grateful once again to have adopted him. You sure you don't want him back, though? Always seems like you could use a friend.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: All due respect, Highness, but I've the best friend anyone can ask for to my right just there. And as for little Shady, he was more inclined than I to see the farthest reaches of the Underworld. Safe travels to you both!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, sir? Have you any idea how Shady works? I'm able to just whisk both you and Bouldy out of here, and to my aid? It must be awfully disorienting.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, Prince, I told you that we'd be with you in spirit, didn't I? It's not just Shady's power, I suppose, nor is it Bouldy's or my hidden strength. It's testament to our companionship, is all. You gods are capable of anything!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She's gone... You still in one piece, Sisyphus? Not hurt or anything?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh I'm just fine, thanks, Prince. That Fury Sister, she is quite a lass, I have to say, and very, very strong. Bet she could push old Bouldy here better than I!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You've really never gotten Bouldy to the top before?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Never got the boulder to the top, not even once. Always tumbles down right at the very end. Lost count after the nineteen thousandth time or so, but you know what? One of these days, I bet it's going to stick.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, did I just hear correctly that Megaera has vowed to leave you be for now? Both you and Bouldy there?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Why, I believe you heard just that, Your Highness! Seems the Fates are giving me a break. Although, the Fury Sister did declare that she'll be back to haunting me after she's through with you...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, I bet I can keep her busy for a while yet. I'll take it as a bit of good news, sir.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, I'm doing very well, thanks, Prince. I'm not afraid of him, I mean, what have I got to lose? Now here, I wanted you to have this.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Can you believe the nerve of that one, Prince? He's nothing but a blowhard, so, I simply tell him what he wants to hear! He can't stop me from helping you, besides. I'm dead already, what's he going to do?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince Z.! Just missed your stern-faced colleague, feel that stillness hanging in the air? Sounds like he won't be checking up on me again anytime soon.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thanatos really isn't such a bad sort once you get to know him, sir. Though, I suppose you'll have to take my word for that.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, I believe it, Highness. I should think that bringing death must be a lonely job. Perhaps he ought to try pushing a boulder sometime!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Good to see you in one piece, Prince Z.!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Life treating you all right, I take it, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh I'm hanging in there, thanks for asking, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You'll make it out of here, I've no doubt about it!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Nice of you to drop in for a bit!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You are a sight for sore eyes, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Now you be careful out there, won't you, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You give them hell for me, all right, Prince Z.?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Go get them for me, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Got just the thing for you here, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: It's always good to see you, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You keep your chin up, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Keep fighting the good fight, there, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey you take care, you hear me, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Let's both of us keep going, that a deal?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: It's good of you to visit me like this!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hope everything's been well enough of late.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You watch your step out there, all right, Prince Z.?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hullo Highness, you're looking well enough!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey, Your Highness, how goes it, how is everything?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I have to say it's good to see a friendly face!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Always a pleasure, Highness, you take care out there.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Here's my best friend in all the Underworld, how goes it, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Glad you made it all this way, Prince Z.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Think I've got just the thing for you right here, Highness!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: A brief hello from time to time does wonders, don't you think, Prince Z.?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Much as I like the company of Bouldy there, you're always welcome, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Stop by whenever you're around these parts, all right, Prince Z.?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I know it isn't much, Highness, but I do hope this helps!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Here's something courtesy of me and Bouldy, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: How about a little bit of help as you keep on your journey, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Let's see if we might make your going slightly easier, there, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Should have something that ought to come in handy for you, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: No need for these, so take one off my hands, won't you, Prince Z.?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Bouldy and I have got the usual for you right here, Your Highness.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Highness, please take one of these and go!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: All's well out here in Tartarus, Prince Z.! What will it be?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Bouldy and I got our usual selection here, Highness!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Don't let me keep you, Prince, I know you've plenty of important business here.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Before you go, Prince Z., a little souvenir from your fine stay in Tartarus.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Don't do anything I wouldn't do out there, you hear me, Prince?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You're looking good and ready for whatever lies ahead up there, Prince Z.!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You know approximately where to find me if you happen to be in the area again, Prince Z.!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Everything's fine as ever here, Prince Z., so you go on ahead, and don't look back!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I have a feeling you are going to make it all the way topside this time, Highness!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Need a little pick-me-up perhaps?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Bouldy and I will always be here in your time of need, Prince Z.!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Bouldy says whatever we can do to help, we'll do it, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: In case words of encouragement are not enough, have one of these here, Prince!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Let's get you on your way, Prince Z., and in good spirits, too!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Don't you worry, Highness, we have got you covered here!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Told old Bouldy here you'd probably be back if only to say hi!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Hey Prince, Bouldy and I will not be needing these, but maybe they can help!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Just do the best you can, if you don't mind me saying so, Prince Z.!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Speaking for myself and Bouldy there, we're always at your service, Prince.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: You get all the way up to the top and do whatever it is needs getting done, Highness!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I know Bouldy believes in you every bit as much as I do, Prince!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, sir, thought this might ease your burden for a while.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Now hold a moment, Highness, I cannot accept something like this... not without giving back a little something in return, that is!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, my, you're really giving that to me, there, Prince? But, I'm just, why would you...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You better believe it, sir. Now you take care, be seeing you around.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Why, Prince, you being serious right now, is that for me?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You deserve better, Sisyphus! This really isn't much, but maybe it'll help you while away the days. Nights. Whatever time it is.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Wow, Your Highness, you... you really shouldn't have. Thank you for not forgetting about me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're always a sight for sore eyes out here, Sisyphus. Thank you for always believing in me.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: I'm really very flattered, Highness! You didn't have to get me anything, I mean, your company's more than enough for me!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I figured you could do with something more than that this time around, good sir.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Oh, but this is just too much for me, Your Highness, thank you, really. I don't know how I can ever repay you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How about you keep on helping me not die as quickly as I might have otherwise, deal?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sisyphus, sir? You've helped me selflessly time after time without so much as asking anything in return. Wanted to say I'm very grateful, and thought you might like to try this. Here, for a special occasion!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Why, Prince, is this...? It is...! I've not so much as seen a bottle of it, much less sampled it, thank you so much! Although, with all respect, I cannot rightfully accept such a fine gift. Unless...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Unless...? Oh no, you're not making me take something in return, you know this was a gift not an exchange, sir, right? Wait, what is that?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: This, Highness, is a little friend of mine kept tucked away in Bouldy's care. Wherever you'll be going next, he'll make a worthy traveling companion. And when he's with you, Bouldy and I... we'll be with you in spirit, too.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince, that vintage Ambrosia bottle that you gave me, my! That was the greatest thing I ever tried, I think! Even Bouldy enjoyed the stuff!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I thought you'd like it, sir. And so, I'm pleased to offer you another! Almost a shame we seldom get such imports from Olympus around here. I hope I can appreciate it for myself sometime. Once all this is over with, I think.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: What? You mean that you've never touched the stuff yourself? You've much more self control than I have, there. Perhaps someday we'll have a chance to share some between us!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Prince, that vintage Ambrosia bottle that you gave me, my! That was the greatest thing I ever tried, I think! Even Bouldy enjoyed the stuff!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I thought you'd like it, sir. And so, I'm pleased to offer you another! Almost a shame we seldom get such imports from Olympus around here.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Ah, look at what the Prince has brought for us, Bouldy! Perhaps someday we'll have a chance to share some between us!

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: All this, for someone such as me. You know I'm down here for a reason, don't you, Prince? Not just because your father and good Thanatos don't care for me. Yet, from the very first, you showed me decency I'd not experienced since I was a king. Perhaps not even then.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Whoever it was you used to be, sir, I believe you've changed. And I'm proud to say that you're my friend. And Bouldy there as well. It's odd for me to say, but I am glad you're here. I think I've learned a lot from you, about all this.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Well, Your Highness, I am honored very much indeed, and having you amongst my list of friends makes it perhaps the greatest such a list a fellow such as I has ever had. Isn't that right, Bouldy?

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: Wait, really, this, this is for me, you mean it, Prince? I mean, I won't say no, I can't say no to such a thing, so, thank you! Thank you kindly.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're more than welcome, sir. For all you've done for me, it's the least I could do.

Speaker: Sisyphus
Text: ...I'm really rather speechless, Your Highness. I'm just a shade doing my time. I don't deserve your generosity.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Come on, sir, what's a priceless bottle of the drink of the gods between friends?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, Bouldy...? I'm Zagreus, good to make your acquaintance. I know that friends are difficult to come by here in Tartarus, and so, I'm grateful that you seem to be a trusty one.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, while on one hand I know that making offerings to you won't really help get me out of here, on the other hand... maybe it will?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, how do you handle being trapped in Tartarus for all eternity, doomed to be pushed up and down a hill repeatedly for no good reason?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So, *erm*, there something you like to do for entertainment out here, Bouldy? Or just, I don't know, take it all in, I guess?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What's the latest, Bouldy? Had any good tumbles down that hill of late?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, I think I'm growing more accustomed to relating to a giant stone.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't know why I keep doing this, Bouldy, yet here we are.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You take good care of Sisyphus, there, won't you, Bouldy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Sometimes a conversation with a friend is its own reward, isn't that right, Bouldy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're looking as stately as ever, there, Bouldy.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: A tribute to the greatest boulder of all time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: To our most famous boulder!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: May you roll smoothly for eternity.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Thank you for keeping my friend company.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is for you, Bouldy.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, please accept this humble offering.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, lend your favor to me, won't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: An offering to the finest boulder in all of Tartarus.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Cheers, Bouldy! Thank you for brightening my day or night.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, ever get the feeling that we've had this conversation in the past?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Let's be sure to do this again sometime, Bouldy my friend.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Any advice for me on this occasion, Bouldy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Bouldy, you can speak up if there's something on your mind, you know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're always here for me, Bouldy! Cheers.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How's everything going lately, there, Bouldy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Looks like you and Sisyphus are doing just fine, Bouldy.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Good seeing you as ever, there, Bouldy.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're a good friend, Bouldy. I'm glad you're here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You'd tell me if anything was on your mind, right, Bouldy?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Bouldy, what's your favorite color?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Bouldy, what's your favorite form of sustenance?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Bouldy, what do you like to do in your spare time?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey Bouldy, how's everything of late?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: ...Go on, stranger. Plenty more shades looking to fight with you out there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm just passing through. You seem less warlike than the rest. May I ask your name, sir? I'm Zagreus.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Names are there to be forgotten, stranger. You shouldn't be here. May the Fates favor your journey. But just in case they don't, here. Why don't you take this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Is something wrong, there, sir? I mean, shouldn't you be up and about, competing for eternal pride and glory and all that?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What's the use? Let's say we fought, if anybody asks. Now, go. I've no quarrel with you, besides. I'll just remain here, comfortably at rest, for some untold millennia, I guess. Have a nice... whatever time it is.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Still toiling around within Elysium, I see. Battling my brethren, in the name of glory, is that it?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm heading for the surface. Though your brethren are slowing me down. Whether for glory or at my father's behest.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Your father...? *Ah*, that's right, but you're the Prince, aren't you. You must see plainly, then, what your birthright amounts to: You're no better off than any of us here. Now, go.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You again. I told you to stay clear of me. Your father's quite the big shot around here, but that means nothing to me, understand? Go, and tell him he can cast me in the pits of Tartarus, for all I care. It'd be a welcome change of pace from being put to pasture here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I was unkind last time, stranger. Forgive my indiscretions there. Or don't. But I wished to apologize.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Think nothing of it, sir. Though if there's something I could do to help, you'd tell me, wouldn't you?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You have no power to release me from this coil, I'm afraid. So just go on about your business, and leave me to mine.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Stranger, I am warning you: If you keep showing up like this, I'm going to have to find a new nickname for you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No need to go out of your way, there, sir. We're just acquaintances. I don't know anything about you, either.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: And you are better off. This place is for the greatest of the Greeks. Do I seem like the sort to fit in, here? Go on and chat with Theseus, or someone of that sort.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Stranger, I am warning you: If you keep showing up like this, I'm going to have to find a new nickname for you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No need to go out of your way, there, sir. I rather feel like a stranger around here. I have no plans to extend my stay.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: And you are better off. This place is for the greatest of the Greeks. Do I seem like the sort to fit in, here? Go on and chat with Theseus, or someone of that sort.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Tell me, stranger, if it pleases you. How is it you keep running into me...? I thought this the remotest corner of Elysium.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: The ever-shifting chambers of the Underworld leave quite a bit to chance. I took our meetings merely for coincidence.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: When chance is too far-fetched to be believed, then it's the Fates at play. Or something else. I don't know whether to believe you, but I know that I want you to leave me, now.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Tell me, stranger, if it pleases you. How is it you keep running into me...? I thought this the remotest corner of Elysium.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: The ever-shifting chambers of the Underworld leave quite a bit to chance. I took our meetings merely for coincidence.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: When chance is too far-fetched to be believed, then it's the Fates at play. Or something else.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What is it this time, stranger? You're quite effective at locating me, but not so good at leaving me in peace.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Just on one of my little jaunts through paradise is all, sir. Happened to be on the way toward my destination.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You think this place a paradise? At least down in the depths, there are so many other souls with whom to share one's misery. No offense... I know that you're just passing through.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: So, stranger. How goes willful disobedience of late? Would that I, too, had it within me to defy the gods.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, you know, it's going. That I've been able to make it this far means I am getting somewhere, I suppose. No thanks to all your brethren in Elysium.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: No use trying to reason with my brethren here. Many of the shades whom you've encountered, why, I watched them throw away their lives when they were men. Yet still they seek to prove to one another and themselves that they are great warriors.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Say, isn't that the Lethe right nearby? You've been through so much, don't you ever... you could just drink deeply of the River of Forgetfulness, and be done with, no?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It has been rather tempting, yes. And I have taken sips, from time to time. But I've some memories I'm not quite ready to give up on, yet.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You ever want to travel past this glade, sir? Elysium in all its splendors... there's a lot to see. Sure you're all right?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'm sure enough, stranger. I traveled far and wide whilst I drew breath. That got me rid of any wanderlust. This little corner suits me well, I think. I have the statue there, the river... it's quite nice.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, this? How did you know? It's just a keepsake from a friend.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: A keepsake? From a friend...? You tell your friend, then, that Patroclus waits for him, and that he holds no grudge, should he return to him.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. But, then...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You recognize it, then. Of course. It's from Achilles, sir. He gifted it to me. He trained me.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I see... a gift. Well, then, you let Achilles know Patroclus waits for him, and holds no grudge, should he return to him.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What is that on your wrist, there, stranger? Let me see, is that... a bracer of the myrmidons. Achilles...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is his bracer, yes. You recognize it, then. Were you a myrmidon, yourself? I heard they were unstoppable.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well, now... if we were so unstoppable, we'd not be here, would we? May that bracer protect you more than its like protected our phalanxes.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Must say that's an impressive spear you've got, there, stranger. Rather like the one Achilles held. He gave it to you, then? Followed him beyond the grave, only to be handed off.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's... a bit more complicated than that, sir, though yes. This is the very same as he once wielded. I am honored to carry it now.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'll bet. Perhaps you'll even come to surpass the body count Achilles piled up with it back in his day, seeing as you seem to have limitless opportunity to use it.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You know, stranger, there was a time Achilles would have killed someone for taking up his spear. But there you are, like you own it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't think anybody owns this spear, sir. I'm hanging onto it for the time being. Though I don't think I'll be the last to do so.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, there's no need to get all philosophical about it. It's a killing weapon. Nothing more.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You mentioned something of your parentage, stranger. I have a question on that subject, if you please.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I please, sir. What's your question? Ask away.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Your father must have records of the dead. So I was wondering if you might do for me a favor, and look up the whereabouts of someone I once knew.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You've done a lot for me. The least I can do is ask around. Who is it that you're looking for?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I seek one called Achilles. Was rather famous once among the living, but among the dead, who knows. I thought he would be here, but he is not.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Achilles... I've heard the name before. And, *erm*, can I ask why you wish to know of him? In case it happens to come up.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It's just... I simply miss him, stranger. That is all.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Something the matter, there, stranger? Or have you come to torment me some more with idle chat?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know Achilles, don't you, sir. You're Patroclus. Achilles... serves us at my home. He trained me. He sends you his regards and love. He says to tell you he is thinking of you always.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: ...That name. So then you've seen him, have you. In your father's house. And want me to believe he said all that? *Tsk*. You'll forgive me if I am a little skeptical. In life, I left Achilles. And in death, he left me. We're even. And we've nothing left to say to one another, now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But, that can't possibly be true. There must be some misunderstanding here. You haven't spoken since you died?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: We haven't, no. And I don't think we shall. But, you can humor him for me, I guess. Tell him I'm doing perfectly all right, won't you?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Something the matter, there, stranger? Or have you come to torment me some more with idle chat?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Patroclus. I know who you are, sir. And, you know Achilles. He serves us at my home. He trained me. He sends you his regards and love. He says to tell you he is thinking of you always.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: ...*Ah*. So then you've seen him, have you. In your father's house. And want me to believe he said all that? *Tsk*. You'll forgive me if I am a little skeptical. In life, I left Achilles. And in death, he left me. We're even. And we've nothing left to say to one another, now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: But, that can't possibly be true. There must be some misunderstanding here. You haven't spoken since you died?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: We haven't, no. And I don't think we shall. But, you can humor him for me, I guess. Tell him I'm doing perfectly all right, won't you?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: So, how's Achilles doing lately, stranger? I figured you could tell me since you've all this access to him, and I don't.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He's forced to do my father's bidding. And sworn to secrecy, apparently. I don't pretend to fully understand. But, all in all, I think he's doing well. I hope... you'll see him for yourself.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You don't fully understand, but hope. I see. Well, if you do get to the bottom of this little mystery at some point, you'll indulge me, won't you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll... see what I can do about it, sir.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: He's never going to return to me, is he. He's in your father's service now. He's never getting out. Neither are you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No. That's not acceptable to me. None of it.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: How bold. So what do you intend to do? You're leaving, anyway.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll figure something out. But you do something for me, in the mean time: Don't give in to what you're feeling now, all right? Achilles loves you still, like you don't know.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Does he? I'm past the point of making promises, but... I pray the Fates help you in your endeavors, there.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: He's never going to return to me, is he. He's in your father's service now. He's never getting out. Neither are you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No. That's not acceptable to me. None of it.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: How bold. So what do you intend to do? You're leaving, anyway.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll figure something out. But you do something for me, in the meantime: Don't give in to what you're feeling now, all right? Achilles loves you still, like you don't know.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'm past the point of making promises, but... thank you for your words. I love him still, in turn. I pray the Fates help you in your endeavors, there.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: He's just as obstinate as ever, isn't he? Always refused to budge. He ever tell you of the war in which we fought? *I *fought, I should say. He could have ended it. But he refused to take up arms.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Achilles hasn't been particularly forthcoming about his mortal days, no. So he wouldn't fight? I've heard that mortals sometimes frown on that, but... why should he have fought if he didn't believe in the cause?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: He *shared *our cause! So what if it was not completely his? If not for his stubbornness, I... well... I would have come here just a bit later, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He blames himself for what happened to you, you know. I figured he failed to defend you or something, not that... he didn't fight at all. Although, he said something about how, once you died, he shortly followed in a rage...

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I wouldn't know a thing about that, stranger, for you see... I was already dead. Getting my place here in the afterlife all sorted out. Took quite some time, getting accustomed to all this.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: A question, if you don't mind, stranger? Because, I've had one nagging at me since we last discussed the subject. What, exactly, happened to Achilles, can you say? After I died, that is. I've heard the rumors, but... I don't trust any of this boastful lot.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, from what I gathered, sir... after you fell, he was overcome with grief. And anger. He joined the war, just like you urged. And, single-handedly, he almost ended it.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: So then, he threw away his life. Soon enough after I lost mine. Yet, despite vanquishing an army on his own, he wound up in the lowest pits of Tartarus? Instead of here, among the great?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You should know, sir. You were buried together. Your ashes, that is. It was his final request. As for how he came to be at my father's house, that's something I think he can best explain. And I will do everything I can to make sure that he has the opportunity.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: ...Our ashes, you say. Together? *Tsk. *The fool. We could have lived! Not been reduced to meal for the worms. But... I appreciate the information, stranger. Now... please, go.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: ...Forgive me, stranger. For, in retrospect, I was too terse after you told me what became of my Achilles. Tales of his climactic battle, I had heard. The stuff about... his ashes, and my own... that was all new.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No need to even ask forgiveness, sir. Achilles is one of my closest friends, but.. he doesn't care to talk about himself. About those times. It must be very painful. For the both of you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, we've all seen our share of pain, by now. But... knowing that he cared for me, in the end... *after *the end... it dulls the feeling of it, for a bit. As do these conversations, I guess.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I've meant to ask you something, stranger. Would you mind doing me a favor, please? If it happens to come up along your path. Suppose I ought to tell it to you first, prior to asking a response.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, of course, sir, what is it? What's on your mind?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: If I know my Achilles, then he's being rather guarded, when it comes to this predicament we're in. How can somebody be so brash yet hate to take unnecessary risks? Just let him know I said to risk it all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Risk it all? Risk *what *all? He wants what's best for you. He wouldn't want anything to happen.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It's already long since happened. I daresay that, right now, provided what you've said is true, then... it appears we've more to gain than lose. Isn't fear for the weak?

Speaker: Achilles
Text: I thought we might run into you, but... how strange to see you face-to-face out here, lad. To see this place myself. I still can't quite believe any of this...

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: He really can't. Though I keep telling him, it's true. Nothing's accomplished without risk, isn't that so? But, we of course have you to thank, stranger. Our troubles needn't have been your concern.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nonsense, sir. You're my friend. And Achilles... I don't know where I would even be, if not for you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well, no need to get emotional, is there? We myrmidons, we're not the sentimental type. Achilles is simply on break, is all. From a demanding job. You've a demanding job as well, so here! My customary gift.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well if it isn't the ward of Achilles, come to visit us. I don't know how I can ever repay you, stranger. I'm quite sure that it isn't possible.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: I reached more or less the same conclusion, Pat.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How about you just keep offering me those premium goods you have no interest in when I pass through, and we can call it even, sir?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: That I had plans to do, regardless, though... if you should think of something else at any point, please do let either of us know.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Good, there you are, stranger. Settle something for us quickly, hm? Would Achilles not make for the perfect Champion of Elysium? For I think almost anybody would be better than the current one.

Speaker: Achilles
Text: I think I'd rather maintain watch over a nearly empty hall than battle all the shades around here, Pat.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, too, would vastly prefer having to contend with Theseus rather than yourself, Achilles. Although, that's not to say I disagree that almost anybody would be better in the role than him.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It seems, then, I am overruled. But I know Champion material when I see it, and I see it now.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Achilles is returned to work for now... but, waiting for him, knowing he'll return... rather than waiting for the sake of it, for nothing... such a different feeling, stranger. I'd forgotten it entirely, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm happy for the both of you. So, is everything all right, then? The circumstances under which you were separated in life... it's unimaginable, really. How does one move on from a thing like that?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Anger fades, I guess, stranger. Even the famous anger of Achilles. Anger burns hot, then burns out. What's left is a dull ache, but... underneath it, there was something else. It felt as though... well, I was still alive. That feeling... it's worth holding onto.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It's good to see you again, stranger. You don't mind if I keep calling you that, no? Couldn't find a better nickname for you, after all. Besides... I don't want to cause you any trouble.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't mind at all, Patroclus, sir. Coming from you I consider it a term of endearment.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You have my thanks for that...

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Achilles tells me that you're here to stay, at least for now, stranger. A welcome bit of news. Assuming, of course, that it's for the best, for you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think so, sir. I'll still be passing through, and visiting the surface every opportunity I get. But it seems my place really is here. Besides, it means getting to see you every now and then, like this.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: That sounds agreeable to me. Then, you take care.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: There's been considerable talk of late about the Queen Persephone, stranger. Your mother, it would seem? Sounds to me your tale's almost as complicated as my own.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's a long story, at this point, indeed. But yes. The Queen... my mother... she's returned. And, it's been really good, having her back.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I can only begin to imagine. May she help govern all of this with wisdom and with grace.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This spearpoint that you gave me, sir. It's been quite useful, though I have to ask you... is there any particular significance to it? Most spearpoints aren't imbued with power such as this.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, that. Just something I'd been meaning to get rid of, but... it can be difficult, discarding trifles from the past. Knowing it's provided you some benefit is welcome news.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Did you once wield a spear yourself, sir? In your fighting days?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Did I once wield a spear? You could say that I did. I had my moments with it, anyway. Even once slew a demigod! He's probably somewhere about. Quite awkward, running into those you killed. But in Elysium it's all taken in stride.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Whatever happened with that war you mentioned, sir? If you don't mind my asking.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well, truth be told, here, stranger... I do mind. You speak as one who's not experienced a war. Those of us who survived... or, you know what I mean... we do bear some responsibility to history. But, all the same, it's not a time and place to which I would return. I trust you'll understand.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I always wondered, sir. What was Achilles like...? During his youth, I mean. If you can say.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: *Hah*. How to describe what somebody was like? Everyone who saw him on the battlefield agreed he was magnificent, stranger. His allies and his enemies alike. But, there was more to him, I think. A certain outlook. A sense of justice. I knew him before he was a warrior. Only reason I suppose I liked him.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I heard you've vanquished Theseus however many times of late. Or... someone matching your description has, stranger. Almost had to laugh when I heard that. Though, I suspect he hasn't learnt a thing.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What, you know him? Though, yes, he does seem rather set in his ways. Convinced himself that I'm some sort of demon from the lowest depths. Which... well, it's partly true, I guess.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You're quite notorious, around these parts. The tales of your father's monstrous son, kept under lock and key within his House. Fear and ignorance make for great stories, no?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Couldn't help but hear the rattling of battle chariots of late. Raucous laughter and the like. You've really riled up the locals this time, stranger.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Must be Theseus and his fancy Macedonian. So he's been joyriding about in that thing? Showing it off?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Your arrivals are becoming a bit of an event, I'd say. And, yes, the Champion and his bull friend are likely at the center of it. You'll have to forgive me that I've no intent on attending your contests, but... well, here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, for such a loudmouth obnoxious braggart, Theseus does seem to have formed a strong kinship with the Bull of Minos, hasn't he. Are they truly as inseparable as they seem? I feel bad for the Bull.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Sometimes it's our differences that make us drawn to one another, no? And, at other times, there's no accounting for taste. I often don't know which is which, and they can have each other, far as I'm concerned.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Even the Bull of Minos couldn't stop you, huh. That's one whose way I would stay out of if I could, but... well, you'd not be here if you couldn't handle yourself, I guess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You heard I battled with Asterius, here, sir? I thought you kept more to your own devices. Weren't much for conversation with the other shades.

Speaker: Patroclus
