Text: Oh, you're correct in that assessment, stranger. But, as you've seen, I've no ability to stop others from coming and going as they please. So I do tend to hear a thing or two from passersby.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You must have met so many great heroes in your day, having fought alongside Achilles... do you still keep in touch with any of them, here?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Great heroes... haven't you seen, by now, what they are like, stranger? Not all entirely what they're cracked up to be. But, there were good ones, yes. Suppose they're mostly keeping to themselves. Like I am here. Perhaps we'll run into each other, down the line.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Never quite considered... you're related to the gods upon Olympus, aren't you, stranger...? I should be far more careful around you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What do you mean by that, sir? Though, yes, my father being who he is, it means I have a lot of uncles, cousins, and the like, up on the surface, there.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well... you would be wise to watch yourself, with some of them, I think. Don't get on anyone's bad side, if you can help it. Which, when I yet lived, none of us could.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You ever been in love with someone, stranger? Might be a mortals-only thing, for all I know. You gods have strange relationships, I hear.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have been, sir. Or, I should say, I am.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Ah, that's good. Cling to the feeling, then. And if you lose it... reach for it. Search for it, no matter what, all right? Because, without it... well, there isn't much of a comparison, I think.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You ever been in love with someone, stranger? Might be a mortals-only thing, for all I know. You gods have strange relationships, I hear.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Not sure that I have been, sir. I understand it's one of those things where, you'll know it when it happens.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Perhaps you shall, someday or night down here. The feeling comes with pain, and plenty of it, but... the pain is worth it, in my limited experience. And once you find that feeling, cling to it. As tightly as you can. If you don't mind my saying.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well, what's it going to be this time, stranger? The HydraLite? Maybe the Kiss of Styx?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You sure you don't need any of this stuff, sir? I really appreciate it, but... I don't want to take it for granted.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, come, this is Elysium. Taking such things for granted is the point. We gloried shades receive our stipend of the finest goods, so we can battle till we've had our fill. But I've already had my fill, I think.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You've ample time for fishing, have you, stranger? And here I thought you'd more important business to attend to, though it's not for me to judge, I guess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll have you know some of us take matters of fishing very seriously, sir! Besides... helps take my mind off having to fight your Elysian brethren nonstop.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh I'd not take your mind off this fight if it's one that you hope to win, stranger. I once took my mind off a fight, and, well... I wound up here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I have to tell you, sir, it was a real sight to see you fighting alongside Achilles. You two were amazing!

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, I'm a little rusty. But he's not. Still very much in tiptop shape, except more able to control his temper, I should think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't sell yourself so short! Though, I thought you laid down your spear forever. Why choose to fight again?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Achilles swayed me into realizing some activity may be quite good for me. And besides... if we can aid you in a pinch, that's worth my while.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You look positively beaten, there, stranger. Let's see if we can't get you on your feet. For I can do the listless sitting for the both of us.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, you look terrible, if I may say, stranger. Perhaps one of these trinkets can be of some small help.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You again? Then, here. Fates know I'll not be needing this.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Move right along, stranger. Let's skip the pleasantries.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: And here I thought you must have given up already.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Enjoying the splendors of Elysium, yet, stranger?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Don't let me interrupt your stay in paradise, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Returned to take more of these trinkets off my hands, have you?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh, it's only you again, stranger. It's only me, as well.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Take one of these and then just leave me be, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'd like to be alone again, stranger, so you go on ahead.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: No need to linger with me, stranger. Go.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Why your path keeps on crossing mine, I've not the slightest clue.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Some other time, stranger. Right now I'm preoccupied with sitting here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: There's nothing you can do to help me, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Can't you see I'm busy whiling away for all eternity?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: A fine whatever time it is to you, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You haven't lost your will just yet, I see.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Expecting I'll still be right here next time, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Just go, already, towards your next death or whatever else awaits.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You're back again, I see. And just in time to take one of these blasted things from me.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'll wait for him, however long it takes. You tell him that.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I pray Achilles is surviving well. And same for you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It's good of you to visit, though there's little I can offer in return.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Please make yourself at home here in this corner of eternal paradise.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Do let Achilles know I'm doing well, and I'll be ever patient, here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I doubt there's much that I can do for you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You're interfering with my quiet time, you know.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Yes, what is it, this time?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Here's what I have that I can spare right now.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Might I somehow assist you, then?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh good, somebody's here to save me from myself.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: How can I be of use to you, stranger?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I've no shortage of time to spare, I guess.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Ah, just a stranger passing through, I see.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Not in the mood for conversation now, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Go on about your business, there, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Good fortune getting out of here, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Here's something for the journey still to come.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Prepared to face the champion, soon, stranger?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: May this aid you against the champion, out there.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Be careful with my brethren out there, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Battle with glory and all that, all right, stranger?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I would prefer to be alone for now, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Just don't go starting any wars you don't intend to finish, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Leave me be to my eternal paradise, damn you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I shall not take up arms again, stranger, not even against you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Begone from here, we've nothing to discuss.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Go haunt some other corner of this realm; this one is mine.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I thought I told you to leave me alone?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Do I look like I want to talk to you?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What is it that you want from me this time?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What would it take for you to leave me be?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: What would you have me do?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: It's good to see you once again, stranger. Now, here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: We're faring well enough, and may you fare the same.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You've come to be a welcome sight, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: May you prevail in your battles still to come, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: We were just wondering when you'd arrive, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Achilles and I were just passing the time I guess.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I and Achilles here still have a lot of catching up to do.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Fight like my friend here used to fight, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: May all your fears leave you behind once you walk past that door.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You'll show that champion of ours, won't you, stranger?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'm pleased to be of any help at all.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: First a visit from Achilles, and now you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Please stay as long as you would like here in our little glade.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Take caution with our battle-loving brethren around here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: If you can make yourself at home in such a place, please do, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Just restocked on these battle-trinkets, if you'd like one, stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You've become quite the talk of all Elysium of late.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Our so-called champion isn't as popular around here as he used to be.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I'm grateful for everything you've done.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: For all your patience and your kindness.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: I want you to have this.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, look, I can tell you're struggling right now, and... maybe this isn't the way to help you through it all, but... I want you to have this.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: *Ahh*, so you are taking pity on me, then? Well, I've no pride like many others here, so I shall take it. Though, let's make it a fair exchange, shall we?

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Why would you waste a proper vintage on the likes of me? Questions that are better left unanswered, I would guess.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: If this eases your burden even for a little while, then it's in good hands, as far as I'm concerned.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: *Ah*, a means to drown my sorrows temporarily. That's good. And rather kind of you, I have to say.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's nothing. Thank you for not trying to slay me where I stand and boast about it, like seemingly everyone else around here.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Oh. Here in Elysium you have to win this stuff, so I have rarely had occasion to enjoy it. Thanks.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'd say you earned it more than anybody else I've seen around here, lately. Though I don't make the rules.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You owe me neither time nor generosity, and certainly not this. But if you truly have no better use for it...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's not a matter of owe, sir. Please open your mind to the possibility, nay the fact, that there are those who care about your wellbeing.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Just the relief from misery that I was looking for. A fleeting feeling, really, but I'll take a fleeting feeling over none.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's both very dejected and very astute of you to say. Take care of yourself, will you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Here, sir. The drink of the gods, themselves. Thought maybe you would like to try it! Just a small token of my appreciation for your selflessness with me, time after time.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You'd give the precious gift of Ambrosia to someone like me, stranger? A gloried thing like that. Why bother...? I should be just another shade to you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, you're not. You're someone I look forward to seeing here in Elysium, which is more than I can say for just about anybody else around here, so... please, enjoy it. Perhaps with Achilles.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Well... perhaps I'll try. You're not so bad, you know that, stranger? Careful with that, or you'll undermine the ruthless reputation that you have.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I don't see that last bottle of Ambrosia anywhere, which I can only take to mean... you need another. Here, sir. Thanks for seeing me through all of this, time after time.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You're thanking *me*, stranger? I've been here for some time, I think, and yet... some of your customs I'll admit remain quite strange to me. You've done more for me than I've any right to expect, from anyone.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's just a bottle of Ambrosia, sir, it's really no big deal. OK, fine, it's rather difficult to come by, but still!

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You jest, but I do not. I'd offer you my lifelong gratitude, but... well, you know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You've got the rest of your life ahead of you, as far as I'm concerned. Here's to starting anew, right? You can call me Zagreus, or stranger, whatever suits you.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: And... I'm Patroclus, by the way. I'm realizing now... we've not officially met. It's good to know you, Zagreus. Stranger.

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: You're much too kind to such a wretched shade, you know. But I'll not turn away this type of thing.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You don't attack me indiscriminately, I give you Nectar. I don't think I'm being over-generous!

Speaker: Patroclus
Text: Forgive my bluntness, but, why go out of your way for me like this...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'm not going out of my way, sir. Look, I don't pretend to know the depths of your despair. But when I look at you, I'm reminded of how I've often felt. When I was in that dark place, someone said to me: Don't give up. If nothing else... it gives you something to do.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business! Surveying the magma situation firsthand. Don't mean to be rude, though I'm in a bit of a rush.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well don't you have your hands full, hon! I'll let you go, but there's one rule in my place, which is: Nobody leaves here empty-handed, you got that? So take your pick, my treat!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business. Past the menacing Bone Hydra. Don't mean to be rude, though I'm in a bit of a rush.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well don't you have your hands full, hon! I'll let you go, but there's one rule in my place, which is: Nobody leaves here empty-handed, you got that? So take your pick, my treat!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey you must be the Hades kid! How's it going, then, Your Royal Majesty? Nice to meet you, I'm Eurydice. What brings a big important guy like you up to a place like this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hi there! No need for formalities, I'm Zagreus. Just heading out on some official business. Say, if your name's Eurydice, I don't suppose you know an Orpheus, do you? Quite musically inclined, a little dour, impressive hair?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: *He *put you up to this? Look, hon, why don't you get on with your business, then. But you can't leave empty-handed, that's the rule, so take your pick, my treat! Nothing for him, though.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, hon, what's going on, speak up! I know when something's up down to my roots, and something's up.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well it's just, I think that you may know an Orpheus, don't you? Quite musically inclined, a little dour, impressive hair? He's court musician in my father's house. Calls you his muse. Says he misses you terribly. I... thought you should know.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orpheus said all that, huh? Tell you what, the next time you run into him, you ask him about the time that he came all this way to try and save me, even though I was already dead. Can you guess how that turned out?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*... yes, I do believe I can. Look, I didn't mean to upset you.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah, well, neither did he! But you know what? Actions beat intentions, hon. Now, here, how about a treat and you can be on your way.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, hon, what's going on, speak up! I know when something's up down to my roots, and something's up.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well it's just, I think I wanted to tell you more of Orpheus, since... he's court musician in my father's house. Calls you his muse. Says he misses you terribly. I... thought you should know.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orpheus said all that, huh? Tell you what, the next time you run into him, you ask him about the time that he came all this way to try and save me, even though I was already dead. Can you guess how that turned out?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*... yes, I do believe I can. Look, I didn't mean to upset you.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah, well, neither did he! But you know what? Actions beat intentions, hon. Now, here, how about a treat and you can be on your way.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What is it, hon? Oh no, don't tell me you've come all the way from Tartarus to ask me more about your good-for-nothing court musician friend.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Certainly not! I'm merely here for your wonderful singing, cooking, or conversational ability. Though, since you mentioned it, you... seem to have a lot to say to him. Is there anything I can do?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: So let me see if I understand. Orpheus blew it with me like an idiot, but now I'm supposed to be reaching out to *him*? Sorry, hon, but that's not happening. The two of us are finished. And, you know what? I think we're finished here, too. If you'll excuse me!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey there, hon! So what do you think, pretty good tune, right? Don't know how come everybody doesn't sing. Lightens the mood, passes the time. What's not to like?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's a beautiful song. Even though you're angry with him... Orpheus, I mean... you're always singing, still?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh it's not Orpheus' song, you kidding me? This one's all mine. He always did like going on about how I'm his muse, well, that's 'cause I wrote half his songs for him! Bet he didn't mention that, did he.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, not exactly in those words, but... Orpheus can be a little hard to parse.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: He can be a little hard to tolerate. A quality I hope isn't going to rub off on any of his mates. I should get back to practicing, see you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Look, Eurydice, I promise not to bother you with this each time, but... you should know your husband's shattered by what happened with the two of you. He's genuinely sorry, and he loves you very deeply, still, I'm sure of it.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: *Tsk*... and what am I supposed to do with that, Your Royal Majesty...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... I don't know yet. Though, you know what? You shouldn't take my word for it. You should take his.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Don't think I will be running into him anytime soon from what I understand. But you're the Hades kid! You want to pull some strings on our behalf, go right ahead, I guess. But I won't hold my breath. Even if I could.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: So, *uh*, how's Orpheus been doing lately, anyway? Still keeping his hair in those neat little curls? I guess his tan must have faded by now.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Curls? *Erm*, not exactly, no. But he's doing all right! For him. He's started singing again, lately, which was a big step. He never used to, before. Would go on about how he'd lost his muse.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: And now he knows I'm out there, still, huh. That's... well, thank you for the update, hon. Music's his gift. Good to know he's not thrown everything away.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, can I ask you for a favor here? Not that you owe me anything, but, would you hear me out?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah, sure, hon, what is it? Though you had better not be asking for my recipes. Closely guarded family secret! I'd say I'd take them to my grave, but... yeah.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's not your recipes, though they are wonderful. It's your song. I'm sure it'd be a hit around the House! And, I know someone who really needs to hear it. Don't suppose you've got a parchment-copy I could have?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Your Royal Majesty, you want my *song*? You are aware it's called *'Good Riddance'*, right? *Tsk*, but sure, why not. If music's going to be playing in your House, it might as well be great. And let me give you something to go with it.

Description: Duo - Progress and Orpheus Song Reaction (1)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: ...What'd he say, hon? I mean about the song. Bet he loved it, didn't he! But, I don't know for sure. And I've been wondering, kind of a lot, I guess.

Description: Duo - Progress and Orpheus Song Reaction (1)
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No need to wonder any longer. He sings it beautifully, around the House sometimes. It... has a sadder sound to it than when you sing, but... you've inspired him again. As you've done many times before, from what I know.

Description: Duo - Progress and Orpheus Song Reaction (1)
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Huh. So it's a hit, is what you're saying, then. I had a feeling about that one. Sometimes you put some words together and right then and there, you know that you've got something special.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What happens now, hon...? What I mean is... now you got me thinking about Orpheus again, so... what am I supposed to do with that?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Even if you can't be together right now, I hope it feels better knowing how much he cares for you. And I will try to pull some strings, like you said. I can't make promises where my father's concerned, but... I'll do everything I can.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, what can I tell you? Thanks, Your Royal Majesty. That means a lot. No pressure, though. I've been all right without him all this time, and I will be all right, no matter what. If only he could say the same.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, listen here a moment, Hades kid. Look, I... Thank you. From the bottom of my heart. For bringing Orphy back to me again, and everything.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, you're more than welcome, really. You've helped me through the flames of hell, time after time. Least I could do is coax old Orpheus out of his private pit of despair so you and he could set things right between the two of you.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 01
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, you're a real sweetheart, hon. You'll still be seeing Orphy all the time around your House, but now, I get to see him, too. Nice having something to look forward to, you know? Bet someone out there feels that about you.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 02
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey! What's the matter, Your Royal Majesty? You're looking kind of down. Normally you're all smiles, for whatever reason!

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 02
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, I... well, looking back, all this stuff between you and Orpheus, I realized... well, I hope I wasn't too pushy about the whole thing. It wasn't any of my business to pry into your personal life. I should have asked.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 02
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, that? *Pff*, come on, don't even worry about it. If you were being too pushy, you better believe I would have put you back in your place, royalty or not. But hey, can't ever be too careful when it comes to people's past and feelings and stuff, right?

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Got to tell you, hon. Orpheus sure is different since last he and I met. You know, back when he was still living and breathing and all.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think the experience of trying to rescue you, failing, dying, becoming court musician, refusing to sing, then being locked in solitary confinement, then finding out about you probably did a number on him. Why, is everything all right? You seemed to be getting along last I saw.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 03
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, we're getting along great! Better than ever. He used to be a bit more of a hotshot, but now it's like, he's a little more... what's the word... sensitive? Now I can always tell exactly what's on his mind.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 04
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, Your Royal Majesty! I must say you've accomplished some truly amazing feats, according to Orphy at least! But don't worry. Your secret's safe with me.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 04
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, no, he's been boasting of my fabricated exploits to you? I've tried to tell him I was only joking with him but now he just thinks I'm being modest.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 04
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: That modesty won't get you anywhere with me, either, hon, Your Greatness. I'm honored to merely be in the presence of one with so many wild exploits to sing or speak of!

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 05
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey did Orpheus really use to have curls, and... something called a tan? I've only ever seen him looking... well, how he does now.

Description: Eurydice About Singers Reunion Quest Complete 05
Speaker: Eurydice
Text: He did! And a tan is like... well, when you stay out in the hot sun up there long enough, your skin kind of starts to bake a little bit. But nicer than that sounds! Got to say, though, the years have been kind to Orphy, don't you think?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Say, tell me something, there, Your Royal Majesty. You know a lot of shades. You wouldn't happen to know an Orpheus, would you? Spindly little thing, whiny voice? Heard he's officially serving in your court. Making music!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Of course I know Orpheus, we're mates! Wait, why do you ask?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You're mates, huh. Just as long as you don't count on him for anything. Hasn't even mentioned me, has he. Well if he ever does, you tell him I am doing great! I'm great.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What's the latest, hon, anything been happening down in your fancy House lately?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, you mentioned Orpheus... my father had him locked up for a little while for refusing to sing. Being court musician and all. But he's out now, and doing OK! I think.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Not following instructions, huh. Sounds like Orpheus, all right. Well, if that's the most exciting thing you've got going on, then I haven't missed much being out here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, what's up, hon? Say, you must know a lot of big shots, don't you? Other gods and all that?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I know a few. As a matter of fact, I heard recently from Hermes, wanted you to know he felt sorry for how things ended up. That something to do with when Orpheus went in here after you?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, that's sweet of him! Nice enough guy, for an Olympian. Yeah, he was the one who dropped me off here in the first place. No hard feelings here, he was just doing his job. It was Orpheus who messed everything up.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Sure don't see a lot of other nymphs around here, huh! We don't die too easy, most of us. Makes me feel all special!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I've never met another nymph, now that you mention it. Heard of a few! The goddess Artemis, sounds like she spends more time with nymphs than the other Olympians.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: That's what I heard! Though it's not like we all hang out, I mean, you've got the dryads, and the naiads, and the nereids, and the oceanids... pretty much every type of terrain up top, there's a kind of nymph who loves it! Maybe we need a name for Underworld nymphs, too.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, did you by any chance ever meet a *Persephone *during the whole thing when Orpheus came down to try to get you?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, her? Yeah, she was with Hades Senior, why? Wait. *Whoa*. Are you...? I thought...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's complicated. And, please keep it quiet. I was just wondering... what was she like? If you recall.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Didn't get much of an impression, but I can tell you this: She had good taste in music! Orpheus and I, think we won her over with our little duet. Haven't seen or heard from her lately, though. Look, I hope everything's OK.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, did you by any chance ever meet a *Persephone *during the whole thing when Orpheus came down to try to get you?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, her? Yeah, she was with Hades Senior, why? Wait. *Whoa*. Are you...? I thought...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's complicated. And, please keep it quiet. I was just wondering... what was she like? If you recall.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Didn't get much of an impression, but I can tell you this: She had good taste in music! Orpheus and I, think we won her over with our little duet. Haven't seen or heard from her lately, though.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, everybody's saying Persephone... she's back? That sounds like a bit of good news, there, isn't that right, hon?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, she is back, and yes, it is good news, thank you. She and I have a lot of making up for lost time left to do, though I think we're off to a pretty decent start.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, that's a relief. And, you're still here! So I guess you've got more official business to take care of, which means I've still got somebody to taste-test for me every now and then!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orphy tells me the Queen, she's been settling in just fine down at your House! Must be different having a lady like that around. How's Hades Senior taking it, if I may ask?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, he's taking it... about as well as he's taken anything ever, now that you mention it. Still very much himself, mind you, but still... it's been a welcome change.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Glad to hear it! Orphy always liked singing for an audience more than I did, and it sounds like she's a good one.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You ever play any music, or sing or anything yourself, Hades kid? It's good for you, you know!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I play a bit of the lyre, as a matter of fact! Orpheus himself gave me some pointers on it. Never really tried singing, though. I can't even imagine it, really.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, might I recommend giving it a shot at some point? Who knows, you might be the next Orpheus!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You been snacking on *onions *or something, there, hon? No offense or anything, but you smell like you ate a whole one of them raw.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, yes, but... wait. How else are you supposed to eat those things?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What, are you kidding me? You can grill them, saut them, fry them, boil them, pickle them, roast them! Oh, hon. You've been missing out.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You got anyone special in your life, by the way, hon? You seem like you'd be good for somebody out here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know what, yes, I do, Eurydice. Things have moved so fast for me lately I barely stopped to think about it, though. It helps not having to go through everything alone... just knowing I'll see them again soon.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Know what you mean. And hey, that's great! Long as you can still be yourself. I've known too many nymphs, their whole lives revolved around somebody they loved. I bet whoever it is that loves you... it's because of who you are.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, how long have you been down here, anyway, if you don't mind my asking? Seems like you're pretty settled in. It's quite a lovely place!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: How long have I been down here, hon? *Huh*! I don't have the faintest. You lose your sense of time once you're a shade, or maybe once there's not a sun or moon over your head. But yeah, I found myself a decent spot and fixed it up a bit!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You're just in time, Your Royal Majesty! Got something real good cooking right here that you are going to love. You hungry, yeah?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Am I ever. You're always so generous. And you're always cooking! And singing. Do you have many guests come by? Your place seems... somewhat off the beaten path.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What, you think I get a lot of guests, here? *Haha*, no, but I like cooking anyway! It's like singing, in a way. Keep getting better the more you try, turns out a bit different each time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, how can you cook so much with all the searing heat around these parts? Has it been magma-flooded like this all the time?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: The searing heat? *Haha*, I am dead, Your Royal Majesty! Searing's just a cooking technique to me. Don't need to sleep, either! I can just keep cooking up a storm. It's not so bad!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, I've never met a nymph before. You're closer to the gods than mortals, right?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah, gods that can *die*! How is that fair? Was just a stupid snake bite in my case, can you imagine something more embarrassing? You're just minding your business, and then *snap*! You're dead, and on your way down here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... know the feeling better than you might expect.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, I was going to end up here sooner or later. Might as well while I'm still looking good. Though, I guess you do kind of get to lock in whatever age when you register. Bet everybody dying of old age pushed that one through.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What's your official business, anyway, Your Royal Majesty? Seems like it's bringing you through Asphodel an awful lot lately.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's... look, the truth is, I am trying to get out of here. I've hit some stumbling blocks along the way, but, I think I will make it there, eventually.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh really! Say no more, I know how that is. Hope the Fates will look the other way for you. Getting out of here, huh. Not thought of that myself in I don't know how long...

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Of all the lava rocks in Asphodel, the Hades kid found this one once again, wouldn't you know! You got a map or something to this place, or what?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Don't know that a map would help me much since things keep shifting out here every single time. Though it is an interesting coincidence how I keep running into you.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Coincidence? Come on, hon, you're a god. Someone out there is sending you my way. Maybe it's just the Fates. Ah well! I sure don't mind a little company. And I have lots to eat!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, wanted to thank you once again for this enchanted acorn that you gave me. So this is what plants and things grow from, up on the surface?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, not just any plants, hon! Trees! Big gnarled oaks and things. Some of them live hundreds of years! Way up there as mortals go. You take good care of it like that, maybe it'll grow to be something special for you, too!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Hey, this is sort of a weird question, but... this Evergreen Acorn, it's not... related to you, is it? Since, you know, you're... partly oak, aren't you?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Yeah, I'm part oak, that's right. But maybe not the part you're thinking of, I mean, you think I would just hand you one of my babies or something? *Hahahaha*, that's disgusting!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hold on, hon, is that... *huh*! Almost felt like Orpheus was with you there. Would you listen to me? Must have been singing too many high notes, or something.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, wait, you're onto something... I think you must have sensed Orpheus' Distant Memory! He gave it to me as a keepsake of our friendship. Though, something like this... I feel like it should belong to you.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, that's him in there all right! See, I never should have second-guessed myself. Well, you hang onto that, as I've got plenty memories of him already, thanks!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, hon, you look awful. What did you get yourself into? Here, one of these should make you feel a little better.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh, you look like you've been through a lot, Hades kid. Maybe a decent bite to eat will help!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: *Oof*, you're a mess, there, hon. You save your strength and see if this will do you any good.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, don't go bleeding on my floor, hon. I just cleaned the place! Take one of these, maybe it'll tide you over.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Why not have a quick bite of something to eat before you head on out, hon?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Sing when you're happy, sing when you're not, Your Royal Majesty.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, it's the Hades kid! So what's it going to be this time, Your Royal Majesty?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I'd say make yourself at home, hon, but you look like you got cooler places to be!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You are just in time, Your Royal Majesty! Cooked up something special just for you.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Why, Your Royal Majesty, you're back! Well, see you later!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: And here I was just thinking it's been too long since the Hades kid stopped by!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: So what'll it be this time, Your Royal Majesty, hmm?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Oh you look positively famished, hon! Here let me help with that.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You must be hungry, hon. Got something ought to keep you going!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: How nice of you to stop on by, Your Royal Highness! Here!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: How's it going lately, hon, you eating well and everything?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Just singing to myself and cooking up a storm. You know me, hon.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Eat up, hon! Not like I got other mouths to feed!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: All's well in Asphodel, Your Royal Majesty! You take care of yourself. I'll be here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You want the best cooking in all of Asphodel, you know where to go!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, it's the Hades kid! What's it going to be this time, hm?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Take care of yourself out there, all right, Your Royal Majesty?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Don't let Hades Senior get you down, hon. Here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I know you've got important business to attend to, so thanks for checking in, Your Royal Majesty.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You look like you're in a rush, though there's always time for a quick snack, right?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, welcome back, Your Royal Majesty, you're just in time!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Been trying to perfect these recipes for I don't know how long!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You look like you haven't eaten since you were here last!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You're always welcome here Your Royal Majesty.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I get you something for the road there, hon?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: What's it going to be, Your Royal Majesty?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You just be sure to tell that good-for-nothing Orpheus I'm looking good.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hon, I'd ask how old what's-his-name is doing, but I don't even care!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Bet you Orpheus hasn't had any strokes of musical genius lately, now, has he?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Better not be Orpheus putting you up to visiting here all the time like this.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: This song's better than anything Orpheus ever came up with I can tell you that.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: If you'll excuse me, Your Royal Majesty, I'm not exactly in the mood for an extended chat.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You best have no more messages from no-good Orpheus this time.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Here, have a snack, hon, and tell Orpheus it was delicious.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You keep an eye on Orpheus for me, all right, hon?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Do one thing for me, hon. Make sure Orpheus knows I'll be right here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I've got to be honest with you, hon. Sometimes I kind of miss him.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Sometime you'll visit me like this and Orpheus is going to be here too.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Don't let Orpheus get into too much trouble, won't you, hon?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I'm fine here on my own, hon. But, I wouldn't mind if he was here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hope Orpheus is on the up-and-up down where you live.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I'd ask you to bring one of these to Orpheus, but they're no good unless they're perfectly fresh.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Orpheus tells me you've been a good friend. Thanks, hon.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I love Orpheus and all, hon, but it's nice having a little time here to myself!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I know you can't stay long, hon, so eat up and stay safe out there, all right?

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I sing when Orpheus is here, I sing when he isn't. Simple!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, thank you for making me feel welcome in your pleasant home. Can't say the same for most places I've been lately. I've a small gift I wanted you to have.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: *Aw*, that's awful sweet of you, Your Royal Majesty. Bringing me fresh ingredients like this! Know what, here's something for you, too, help keep you safe out there!

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Just the ingredient I needed, hon, thank you so much! You know, you aren't near as bad as I'd heard!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Oh, don't worry, we're still getting to know each other! Plenty of time for me to live up to my notorious reputation. Though I'm surprised you've heard of me at all.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: *Aw*, for me, really, Your Majesty? This will be perfect for my latest recipes.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, of all the souls I've ever met, I feel like you put this stuff to the best possible use.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: You read my mind, hon! I go through this stuff awful fast sometimes.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And I, in turn, shall go through your incredible cooking awful fast, given the opportunity.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Hey, mighty generous of you to keep me stocked up on this stuff, Your Royal Majesty!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: My pleasure! I'm always pleased to see you during my otherwise generally unfortunate travels in Asphodel.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Thanks, Your Majesty! Though you're not going to get in trouble bringing me this stuff, are you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Hah*, no! I don't think I can get into more trouble at the moment. May this make your dishes that much more delectable!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Eurydice, I was thinking maybe this would benefit your culinary practice. Here, please.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Whoa, this is Ambrosia! Hard to come by this stuff around here. You sure I can have this?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Absolutely! Least I could do for all your friendship and support. Always happy to hear your voice when I'm out here.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: I ever tell you you're a real sweetheart, hon? Because, if not, I'm telling you right now. Where would my culinary practice be if not for you?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think your culinary practice would be every bit as extraordinary, though I'm pleased to have done small service to you in this great pursuit.

Speaker: Eurydice
Text: Well, we both know you've done a lot more for me than that. I wasn't expecting to make any new friends here anytime soon, so all the more reason it's been a real treat to get to know you. If I may say? You're a hell of a guy, Your Royal Majesty.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Pray, who might you be, wandering all the way out here? You're trespassing on private property, you know. Speak up!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, you must be... Persephone. My name is Zagreus, and... I think I might be your son.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *What*?! How dare...! Get out of here! Get out, or I shall make you!! *Out *with you!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No!! So then you *are *her. I, I don't care if you hate me, but I'm not leaving until I get some answers! I never even knew you existed. Why did you leave me?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You died! You, you *died*...! Those burning feet, they... sputtered out, when you were born. But... now you're standing here before me. How...?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I died? I died... what, you mean *permanently *died, but, I'm alive! Oh, gods... you never even knew I existed, either.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Alive! Zagreus, he... even kept your name! You live, how can this be, you live? *You live*...! Oh, the cruel Fates! My son!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...In short, I beat him, finally, though he did everything he could to prevent our meeting here like this. But there's something he wanted me to tell you, in the end. He said to tell you Cerberus is doing very well.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Ah*. He told you that, did he. That's good. That's good! Though, tell me something, Zagreus. How... is it that you found me? To have journeyed all this way, I scarce believe it.... Zagreus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Ugh*... Oh, it's... guess I'm just a little tired, that's all. Not accustomed to the weather, as I think you call it.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: No... no, that isn't it, it's that... you cannot stay here. You can't stay here.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Really, you're... *heh*... kicking me out? Why?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: The Fates are cruel, Zagreus. You're bound to that place... same as your father. So they would have us say good-bye, for now. My heart soars, knowing you live. Then it breaks, that our time together was so brief.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No... I can... come back... I can come back, now that I found you, he... maybe he'll just let me come back.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You tell him I demand it. And I demand he also tell me how come he, or for that matter Nyx, never sent notice that you lived! Olympus is all rife with schemers, but I was so naive to think that they were different.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I'll tell him... I'll tell him, I... feel awful. I... I have to go.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: The Styx shall take you, then. Oh, Zagreus. Farewell, my son. Won't you come back to me? When you are able, please. Come back. I shall be waiting here. However long it takes.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I begged the Fates that you'd return to me. Perhaps I ought to be more careful how I speak of them. Tell me, how was your journey? What happened?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Father didn't make it any easier for me. Nor would he tell me why he never sent for you, after you left. So, I don't know, what's going on, still, but... I wanted to see you, again.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I wanted to see you, too. Come, speak quickly with me, that our time together here may be as full as possible, all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I just... I need to know what happened, between you and Father. Why are you here, and not with us?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I couldn't live with myself anymore, down there. After I left Olympus, a long story in itself, I came to be with your father, in the Underworld. It was a shock, to say the least. The others in your father's house were welcoming enough, but... I never felt that I belonged.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I know the feeling, I think. But you stayed. Long enough to have me. Those whom I've spoken to about you, it's as you said, they have fond memories of you. And then, you even had a child. Did Father... did he mistreat you?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: No, no. Your father could be very difficult. Though, he was gentle, with me. Soon enough, we got on fine, better than fine, at times, but... when I was with child... why, I struggled terribly. Because... a child born of surface-dwellers could not live, down there.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Could not live down there, according to whom, exactly? The Fates?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: According to them, yes. According to your father, and to Nyx. Even having heard... I took my chances, anyway. But when you emerged stillborn... it was too much. I fled. I fled, and came to reside here. Above the notice of the Underworld. Beneath the notice of Olympus.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Urgh*... but... why would Father lie to you? If he never wanted you... or never wanted me... surely he had the means.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I don't know. I'm wondering the same. But, oh, look at you, Zagreus! We're running out of time. It's happening again! Stay with me, please?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...I'm trying... but I can't... stay that much longer... I don't think.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, my dear son! Then please... ask Hades what you asked of me! Why he would lie? Tell him I must know, the same as you. And you farewell. Until we meet again!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, I... discovered how come Father led you to believe that I could not survive past birth. He didn't lie to you, exactly. So he says.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Wait, slow down, Zagreus, what do you mean? He told me you would not survive your birth, yet here you are. How wasn't that a lie?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Because... he thought it was the truth. The Fates appointed him dominion over the entire Underworld. But he would never have an heir, so he was led to understand. He never expected me to be born, much less survive.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: He never expected you to survive? Then, forgive my asking, but... why did you? *How *did you? The Fates are not known for making mistakes when it comes to such things.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Nyx saved my life. Or gave me life, I guess. Then raised me in your absence. The Fates are her daughters, right? Maybe she persuaded them to go easier on me. She cannot say more. In any case, apparently it took her quite a while to revive me, and... by then, you were gone.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Nyx... of course she was involved. I only managed to escape because of her. Then, she restored my stillborn son to life, and nurtured him? And, I never would have known, unless that child, fully grown and having learned the truth, defied his father, and then found me here?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yes. Although, we still don't know how come Father and Nyx never sent for you. Though, *ungh*, let me ask you something, Mother, if you please. If you had found out... that I was born, and very much alive... would you have come back?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Would I have come back... to see my only child? Had I but known you lived... I would have gladly gone through hell again to see you, Zagreus. Of course I would have.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well then... what if... *urgh*... what if Father... didn't want you... doing that?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: What if he didn't want me coming back to him? Or seeing you? Oh no, you're fading again, Zagreus. You've pushed yourself too hard! But what is it you meant, by what you said?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: So good to see you, again, Zagreus. Since last you left, I couldn't help but think the worst, about what happened after I had left... or soon before. You mentioned Nyx... you don't suppose that she and Hades... wanted me out of the way?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I just... don't think that can be. Though, let me ask you. How long did you know Father? And Nyx, for that matter? Did they seem trustworthy?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Yes. I knew them long enough to have decided yes, that they were trustworthy. As much as anyone I've ever met. But I also know never to be trusting to a fault. I have to consider the possibility I was deceived.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Especially since neither of them is being forthcoming with me even now, right? And yet, I have this feeling something else is going on, Mother. The way that Father speaks of you, the way Nyx speaks of you... I think... they care for you.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Ah, hahaha*! Well, they have a funny way of showing it, I think. Your father, so... you have to get through *him *each time you visit *me*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I do. Mother, what if... what if Father thinks that he's protecting you? Have you... considered that?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Protecting me? Why Zagreus, what do you mean by that? As you can see, I can fend for myself.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well... *urgh*... you're from Olympus, aren't you? But... the gods, none of them seem to know... you're here... so...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: What, how would you know something like that? Zagreus? Ah, curse the Fates, you're leaving me again...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Son, I have to ask you, how much do you know about your relatives upon Olympus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think I know quite a bit by now. I've been in steady contact with Athena, Zeus, and other members of the family ever since I first left Father's House... they've been assisting me in getting here.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: No... Zagreus, what have you done? You've led them *here*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, no, they think... they think I'm trying to escape from Father so that I can join them on their mountaintop. At least I *think *that's what they think. Most of them, anyway.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: But then... does Hades know of this? That Olympus is involved?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He does. Both he and Nyx. In fact, it's Nyx who put me and Olympus into contact. I could never have broken free of the Underworld if not for their help.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: So Nyx and Hades are against each other, then. And Olympus is helping you... but they don't know I'm here, as far as you're aware?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's right. More or less. Nyx and Father seem to put up with each other. Don't seem to have much of a choice. Though, ever since I learned of you, Nyx has been helping me to find you... while Father's tried to stop me.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That fool... what was he thinking? What *is *he thinking...? Do you suppose... he thinks that he's protecting me from *them*? Oh, no...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... *urgh*... I think maybe he does think so, indeed... because, now having met my relatives upon Olympus, I... can definitely see that they can be a bit... vindictive about things.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Vindictiveness runs in the family, my son. Then, if Olympus is involved, that would explain a lot. I'm here, not there with them, as you can see. But, oh, it seems we'll have to speak some more, when next you return...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Son, I have to ask you, how much do you know about your relatives upon Olympus?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: A little. I've been in contact with Athena, Zeus, and other members of the family ever since I first left Father's House... they've been assisting me in getting here.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: No... Zagreus, what have you done? You've led them *here*?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, no, they think... they think I'm trying to escape from Father so that I can join them on their mountaintop. At least I *think *that's what they think. Most of them, anyway.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: But then... does Hades know of this? That Olympus is involved?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: He does. Both he and Nyx. In fact, it's Nyx who put me and Olympus into contact. I could never have broken free of the Underworld if not for their help.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: So Nyx and Hades are against each other, then. And Olympus is helping you... but they don't know I'm here, as far as you're aware?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's right. More or less. Nyx and Father seem to put up with each other. Don't seem to have much of a choice. Though, ever since I learned of you, Nyx has been helping me to find you... while Father's tried to stop me.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That fool... what was he thinking? What *is *he thinking...? Do you suppose... he thinks that he's protecting me from *them*? Oh, no...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I... *urgh*... I think maybe he does think so, indeed... because, now having met my relatives upon Olympus, I... can definitely see that they can be a bit... vindictive about things.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Vindictiveness runs in the family, my son. Then, if Olympus is involved, that would explain a lot. I'm here, not there with them, as you can see. But, oh, it seems we'll have to speak some more, when next you return...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I could not stand it on Olympus, Zagreus. The blustering, the posturing... my overbearing mother... none of it. I would have left the mountain voluntarily, except...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Except Father absconded with you, didn't he? Dragged you down with him into the Underworld. So if Olympus were to find that out... I shudder to think of the consequences.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That fool is trying to protect me even now. It wasn't he who absconded with me, my son. And it's more complicated even than that. I was content to leave. Willing to make my life within the Underworld. With your father.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I dare not ask who *did *bring you to Father, then. So, essentially, you ran away from home, to live with *him*? I mean no disrespect, but... did you realize what you were getting yourself into?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: We have a tendency to be impetuous when we are younger, Zagreus. I'd heard all about your father before we met. Admired paintings of him. It was very awkward, at first. But he had a bluntness I fancied. A sense of principle. I much preferred him to his brothers, I can tell you that.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So, *urgh*... then you secretly left Mount Olympus to be with the god of the dead in the Underworld. And Olympus never found out. What do you suppose would happen... if they did?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...I think... there would be war between Olympus and your father, Zagreus, if they found out. Especially now. After all this. And after all this time. They slew their parents once. If the Titans could be wiped from this world, so can we all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So it makes sense... if Father, he agrees with you, and thinks... that leaving you in hiding here, that it's the only way... he can prevent that war...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I can see how your father, shrewd but also single-minded as he was, might have followed such a line of reasoning as that. Oh, Zagreus... what have I done?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Zagreus... it's wonderful to see you, but... I need to ask something of you. That you not visit me again, here in this place. Both for your safety, and for mine.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, what? Because of what would happen if the Olympians found out? So, after everything, you're taking *Father*'s side in all of this?!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I am. Your father is no fool when it comes to matters such as this. Besides... all that has happened... it's my fault. I was selfish! And now both sides of our family threaten to be torn apart.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Your fault? So let's say you never left Olympus! Then it'd be just like you thought, until quite recently, I think. That I'd never existed! Besides, they haven't found out any of this. What makes you so sure they will, all the sudden?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Nyx may be veiling you from them as she veiled me when I fled here myself. But even her own powers aren't infallible. Each time you visit me, you are incurring risk. One small slip, and they shall find me. Discover your deception. Go home, Zagreus. Please.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Go home *with *me, Mother! You came here under false pretenses. I haven't fought all this way, over and over again, only to turn back now. I need you in my life! How can you just... turn me away like this?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, Zagreus... I cannot return. After all that happened between Hades and me, and everyone, I just cannot fathom the idea. Besides... the risks we're taking would be even greater if Olympus were to find me there, with him. And you.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Then... *ungh*... you're just... going to stay here? Alone, in the middle of nowhere, in this little garden... forever? After we part ways, just like that?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: My son... I know you've made hard choices and sacrifices to be here with me. And I'm forever grateful to have finally met you. But this is my home, now, yes. While your home is below. Please, if not for your sake, then for mine... do not return. I love you, Zagreus. Good-bye.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You can't do this to me, Mother. You said Father is no fool, and neither are you. There has to be a way to fix this. Not just with you and Father, but with everyone. There has to be a way!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...You have your father's stubbornness. Listen to me. You're endangering everything you care about by coming here. Don't you understand? Besides...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What? Besides what? Tell me, please.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...The truth is that I like it here, Zagreus. I have done well for myself on my own. And your father, he has his domain to look after. The feelings he once had for me... feelings we shared... they fade, with time. You'll understand, someday.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *No*! I won't be understanding anything of the sort. Father still loves you. I'm sure of it! And, he owes you an apology, damn it! I cannot make amends with you on his behalf. It's something only you can do together.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: What do you mean he still loves me, Zagreus...? How would you know?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Because... *ungh*... I'm his blasted son, that's how I know! But *trust me *isn't ever good enough, I know that, too. I'll prove it to you, Mother! Just you wait and see.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You're fading, Son... you don't need to prove anything to me. Please don't do anything rash. All of us made our choices. Now we have to live with them. Isn't it enough, to know that I am safe? That I'm content to be alone?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No... *urgh*... it's not... it's not enough, for me, because... this blasted family... it cannot just keep hiding from its problems! Running from them! We're stuck with one another, we... we have to do everything we can... for one another!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I... oh, my dear boy...

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...Of everything down in that gloomy House, I miss old Cerberus the most, I think. But, I miss other things as well. The lack of light was gentler on my skin. Not being as cold. And Nyx, and her young sons. It was all very odd, but...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother... in Father's bedchambers... mind you, there's almost nothing there, just neatly sorted rows of all his samey capes... but on his nightstand... is a portrait of *you*. Wearing a regal crown of red laurels. A Queen. *His *Queen.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I was fitted for those garments when I first arrived. They... were not my customary style. So Hades has a portrait of me, still. Why would he put it back on display, now?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: No, no, he's never let anybody in his bedchambers! I broke in. Don't you see? He didn't put your portrait back on display. It's always been there! Ever since you left. So, Mother, why do you suppose he would do that?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Because he... because he loves me still. Is that what you want me to say?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Have you ever loved him, yourself?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: All I really wanted was to leave Olympus. I didn't exactly abscond. I doubt I had much of a choice, but I went willingly. Perhaps Zeus knew how I felt, and thought he was doing me a favor. As for Hades... I grew to love him, yes. He always gave me my space.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Won't you... *urgh*... won't you please talk to him? Or visit Cerberus again, or Nyx? As for Olympus... surely all of you... can figure something out...?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: ...I just don't know, my son. Olympus is behind me. And the Underworld... I cannot imagine I would be very welcome there after all this time.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, wait, what is all this?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, Zagreus, I almost missed you. Truthfully, I hoped that I could make it a surprise...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Make what a surprise?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: My arrival. I'm going. To your home. To Cerberus. Nyx. Your father.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You're... *really*?! Mother, you, you're serious?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I am. Now if you could just help me pack up my remaining things? Only a few loose odds I'm bringing, just in case. If we hurry, maybe you could join me, rather than return the customary way. Not something a mother ever wants to see.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Join you, but... wait, how are you going to get back? I... hadn't thought that far ahead.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Just so happens I know somebody who can give us a ride.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Doubtless he has pressing matters to attend to. So let's not keep him waiting any longer, Son. Come on, then!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *<Sigh> *...I'm still alive... but, how?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You're on the River Styx. No longer in the mortal realm, entirely.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I can't believe that this is happening.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I know. My heart is racing. Nothing like a river journey to remind oneself that there's no turning back.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Seriously. Though, even after all of this... it's like we only just met. I have so many questions for you still.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: We'll have plenty of time for them, I think! For now, best we keep quiet. Pretend we're just a couple of dead souls on their final voyage.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This is embarrassing, but... I don't know the way to get back in. Except, you know, the customary way.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That's quite all right; I do. *In the name of Persephone, the Queen*!! Open the gates!

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: How has it been for you so far, Mother? Reacclimating to all this. You said before it was a struggle. Must be very strange, being back. Being in darkness all the time.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: You know, I think it's gone all right so far! Thank you for asking, Son. Everyone has been quite welcoming. The darkness is a pleasant change of pace, and while this dress can be a little difficult to move in... I quite like it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: That's good to hear. I have to admit I was a little worried you'd be desperate to return to your cottage by now. This place can be a little much.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I'm sure it can. And I do miss my little cottage here and there, but... I think I'm through running away. There may be times when it is necessary, of course. But no matter how far you run, it doesn't make your problems go away. You taught me that, you know.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I did? But... I tried desperately to run away, myself.... Oh.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Turns out there's still an awful lot to do around here, isn't there, Zagreus? I'm still getting caught up on day-to-day affairs.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Day-to-day, how can you even tell it's day around here, anyway, Mother?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Well that was just a guess, now that you mention it. In any case, forgive me if I don't get swooped up in every household detail, all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: So, Mother, all the pomegranates around here... those are your doing?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Not a lot of fruit trees take to this environment, my son. Though, there's something about pomegranates! Maybe it's that their seeds so resemble the gemstones your father likes so much. Or that they don't need much water.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: ...Fruit trees, huh. I grew up around all these poms and never thought much of it. Are there many other types of fruit trees on the surface, then?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Well... I suppose there are a few. But I like pomegranates most of all.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: This garden isn't quite the sight yours was back on the surface, is it, Mother.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: On the contrary, Zagreus! It has its own unique charm. As each garden does. I was impressed it wasn't left entirely to rot after my absence.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It was totally off limits to me. Though I guess Father must have taken care to maintain it as best he could.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: He did, all right. Minus the part where you weren't allowed. Though, let's look after it from here, shall we?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: You know, that painting in Father's... I mean your bedchambers, it turned out rather well, didn't it? Some very talented shades around here.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Oh*, it's beautiful! I tried to persuade your father to hang it out in the hall but he's too coy about such things. Though, I like it where it is... a reminder to us, every day and night.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: This garden may not have all the varieties available up on the surface... though it's coming along rather nicely, I should say!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: It's lovely what you've done to this place, Zagreus! It's looking better than ever, thank you.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Were you able to make it to my cottage on the surface, Zagreus? I hope my lavender patches are doing all right.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I, *erm*... I couldn't make it all the way there, Mother. It's like... without your presence on the surface, I'm unable to hang on for very long at all.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Ah*, I was afraid of that. Well, don't despair. I placed a charm upon my seedlings there that ought to keep them flourishing well on their own. Your duty now is simply to escape. You keep it up!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Tell me something, Zagreus... sometimes I fear... do you hate him? I mean your father. Regardless of his intentions... it sounds as though he made your life extraordinarily difficult. All his pent-up fear and anger... you bore the brunt of it.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Do I hate him...? Mother, I don't know that I hate anybody, really. The tales of him and the Olympians rending their immortal Titan parents to bits... I can't relate to how they must have felt. But, I resented him, for sure. And... I don't know if I'll ever get over that, entirely.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I understand. I think that when Hades told you he asked no forgiveness, he understood as well, and meant it. Well, for all his failings, I'm thankful that he did not teach you how to hate. For your own sake, if not for his.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: So, how has it been between you and your father lately, Zagreus? I know the two of you have lots of work ahead of you. Especially him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Well, it's been all right, I guess. I think he's set in some of his ways. But at least we have some sort of understanding now. Even if he acts like everything is still the same when I'm out there on the job.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: He says it's so you put forth your fullest effort every time. All this is a big adjustment for him as well. Not that it's any excuse for how he's treated you. Are you... all right, seeing us together?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: *Erm*, so are things with you and Father... everything all right, so far?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Things are good, Zagreus. I'm from Olympus... all the relationships I've ever known have been the complicated sort. But with your father... despite our different dispositions and interests... beneath it all, we share a simple understanding.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: And... what understanding is that? If you can share.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That we're all we've got. And that we love each other. Through thick and thin.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, you're not... you're not thinking about having more children, are you...?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Nyx has a very steady presence, doesn't she? I want to say she hasn't changed a bit since before you were born, but... I know that she's been through a lot.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: She's always managed, and quite gracefully at that. Never seen her break a sweat over anything. Even when I confronted her about you. Though, you two seem closer than I realized, I think.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Well, your father isn't always the conversationalist, and Nyx... she was the first chthonic god I ever met. I suppose she welcomed having another lady about the House.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Zagreus... how am I doing? As a mother. Tell me honestly. Nyx has had so much to share about raising you. Foods you hated or enjoyed, your natural abilities, your friendships... she knows everything! Sometimes I wonder how I can ever compete?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, I think you're doing great. And I'm sure you know it's not a competition between you and Nyx. I just get the benefit of having two great mothers rather than one. Or zero.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Thank you, my son. I know I wasn't there for most of the hard part, but... I'm here, now. Though, when I inevitably, inadvertently trample all over your feelings at some point, please tell me, all right?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, one thing I was wondering about was, how did you summon Charon to your surface residence? Especially without, you know, being dead.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Oh*, why... he gave me his calling card after he graciously helped get me out of here the first time. No doubt at Nyx's request, but still. Never thought I'd use it, but... I still kept it. Just in case.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, you'll forgive my asking, but... your mother used to call you by a different name, didn't she?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: *Ah*, don't remind me. Imagine if I called you *Zaggie-poo *from when you were born to this very moment, that's how that name felt to me. I much preferred the name my father gave to me.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Your mortal father, right...? So he called you Persephone. What was he like?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: He was kind to me. And funny! Little bringer of destruction, I was to him. I liked that. He was right, I was a terror. But then he passed. I was very little still. My mother never spoke of him again.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Demeter mentioned him a bit to me. She seems... I don't know, but I don't sense that she regrets the relationship or anything. Just sad about the outcome I think.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I suppose I can see that. I thought I might end up like Father... growing old, wasting away. Then the time flew by, and I realized I was closer to Mother's side. Mortals certainly don't have it easy. But their limited days, it means... they live their lives to the fullest, I think.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, just how long has it been snowing on the surface, do you know? Because, it seems to me that Demeter... Grandmother, I should say, she... well, it's been very cold up there each time I've been.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I was afraid of that... I wanted to believe the snow about my cottage, it was native to the climate there, but... seems that Mother took my absence harder than I thought. Oh, what have I done. All those poor people.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: It's not your fault. You couldn't have known. And we can fix this, right?

Description: Persephone About Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Persephone
Text: Nyx told me that you helped her reconnect with her parent... after a long, long time. That was very kind of you. She never asks for anything. But we all owe her a lot, don't we?

Description: Persephone About Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Zagreus
Text: I think so. If not for her... I can't even imagine, really. Did Nyx ever speak to you of Chaos, before I was born?

Description: Persephone About Nyx Chaos Reunion Quest 01
Speaker: Persephone
Text: Not really, no. Nyx is very private when it comes to personal matters. But she has feelings and desires same as anybody. Well, mostly, but the point is... I know this meant a lot to her.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: It seems Achilles had a complicated arrangement with your father. I understand you simplified things for the better, there, and he was able to visit Elysium at last. Well done.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: So Orpheus was finally able to reunite with Eurydice because of you, my son? *Ah*, I'm so glad! Your father's arrangement with him was quite severe. Though he did ask for a lot, for a mortal soul to return to the land of the living...

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Is it even possible, for Father to return a mortal back to life if he so chose? Just by letting their shade escape, or something?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, I've no idea, probably not? But we were so moved by Orpheus' plea and song, that, well... I think your father took pity on him.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Wait, *we *were so moved? You were there when Orpheus came to try and rescue Eurydice?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I was. Your father knew I loved their music. Imagine my surprise to see him as our court musician, here!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I always fancied Thanatos, you know. So put together and everything! I'm pleased to see you've grown so close. Things good between you two?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: That Dusa sure has quite the uplifting presence around here, doesn't she, Zagreus? Sometimes I see you chatting and it warms my heart.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Zagreus, I know you're upset about what happened between Nyx and Dusa. Before you ask... I need to respect Nyx's space and authority on this one, all right?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: I saw that Dusa had returned. I trust Nyx's judgment, though I must admit I was pleased to see she decided to give her another chance.

Speaker: Persephone
Text: All right. We've matters with Olympus to resolve. They don't know I'm here, most of them, besides Zeus, maybe Athena. They think you're Nyx's son rather than mine, and that your goal is still to join them on their mountaintop.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What a mess. What can we do? The gods of Olympus have all been very good to me, for the most part. I don't feel great about deceiving them. They keep trying to help me escape!

Speaker: Persephone
Text: What can we do? We can make peace with them. And let them know the truth. So much of it as they would tolerate. Diplomacy is not your father's strong suit. But I am going to need you two to do exactly as I say. Do you understand?

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Yes, Mother. So what do you intend to do, and how do I fit in?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: We're going to invite all of them to a little family gathering! Here. And you shall personally deliver them their invitations, Zagreus.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: Mother, are you serious? So, we're just going to have a bash with them, and they'll just see you after all this time, and be fine with everything?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: They certainly shall not be fine with everything. But, Hades and I, we'll be prepared to tell them what they need to hear. Don't worry, I shall do the talking.

Speaker: Zagreus
Text: What are you going to say?

Speaker: Persephone
Text: Oh, you know! That we met, fell in love, eloped. Had a child. A child who, once grown, sought desperately to reconnect with his extended family. To the chagrin of his grim lord father...

Speaker: Zagreus
